Maura es una señora de 50 años, optimista con ganas de luchar por sus hijos y triunfar. Tiene 4 hijos, es viuda, vive con una hija en Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Maura trabaja vendiendo cosméticos a domicilio ya que no tiene un local, es el tercer crédito que solicita a fodemi el mismo que va a utilizar para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, joyas y otros productos ya que en temporada navideña incrementan las ventas y para Maura los ingresos económicos que le servirán para dar el estudio a su última hija y cubrir sus necesidades.

El sueño de Maura es seguir trabajando con entusiasmo y ver a su última hija cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Maura is a 50 year old woman who is optimistic and has the desire to fight for her children and to triumph.  She is a widow, and she has four children.  She lives with her daughter in Ibarra in the Imbabura province.

Maura works selling cosmetics door-to-door because she does not have a place to sell.

This is the third loan she has requested from Fodemi.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics like perfume, creams, jewelry, and other products.  During the Christmas season sales increase.  Maura will use the income for her last daughter’s education and to cover their necessities.

Maura’s dream is to continue working with enthusiasm and to see her last daughter fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy products like perfume, jewelry, and creams, among others, in order to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Carmen Lidia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 42 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.
Desde hace unos meses que Carmen necesita un equipo de computo, ya que se le dificulta sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Es por eso que Carmen está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para la compra de un equipo de computo y asi facilitarles a sus hijos y a ella el hacer sus trabajos, para que continúen con sus estudios y puedan llegar a ser grandes profesionales.
Carmen es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 and lives with her family in the community of San Carlos, in the Costa Rican province of Alajuela.  She lives in an area that occupies the first place nationally in the production of coffee and sugar cane.  The area also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers and vegetables.  The Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located in this province.

For several months Carmen has needed new computer equipment to facilitate her children's upbringing.  For this reason, Carmen is requesting a loan of $1200 (597000 CRC) to purchase computer equipment that her children can use to do their schoolwork.  This will allow them to continue their studies and become professionals.  

Carmen is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of El Encanto de Pital and it is her first loan through one of the 150 branches of Kiva partner EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a computer and furniture.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria tiene 20 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Gamitana, ella se dedica  a la agricultura tiene varios terrenos donde cultiva diferentes productos dependiendo la temporada mayormente cultiva arroz, plátanos, piñas y otras cosas más, ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera y a la venta de productos de  primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas y otras cosas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.

Hilaria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en las chacras por lo tanto va comprar semillas y abonos.
 
Hilaria es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” lo conforman 16 socios que viven en el Comunidad de Gamitana en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 20 years old and lives with a partner, and from this relationship she has 2 children. She was born in the city of Gamitana. 

She works in agriculture and has some land where she grows different crops depending on the season. Her main crops are rice, bananas, and pineapples among others. She also sells wood and sells staples such as rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods and other items. She has been doing this work for some years and business is going well.

Hilaria is asking for a loan at this time to invest in the farm in order to buy seed and compost.

Hilaria is a member of the community bank Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana which is made up of 16 members who live in the community of Gamitana in the jungles of Peru.

loans.use: to buy seed and compost

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 59 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su hijo de 28 años de edad. Desde la edad de 15 años, no hace otra cosa más importante que confeccionar, pues fue un oficio tradicional que aprendió de su madre, quien con él se defendió cuando murió su padre. Gradualmente Nancy fue perfeccionando su arte, pues su hermana le enseñó a fabricar pantalones y mediante la repetición adquirió mas pericia, con la hoy realiza su trabajo. Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo confeccionando pantalones, pantalonetas y camisas en la línea infantil, pero gradualmente amplió su mercado y en la actualidad también le confecciona al género femenino. Su actividad la complementa con el comercio de mercancía, lo que ha ce mediante guías especializadas de productos, desde hace 5 años.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, séptimo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que lleva 12 años de estar vinculada.  Con el credikiva,  comprará materias primas e insumos pues en Diciembre es una época en la cual ella no detiene su trabajo, es decir da el feliz año a sus vecinas con la máquina en la mano y esto es lo que hace que sus ingresos sean exitosos. Durante todo este tiempo de vinculación con la FMSD, Nancy se ha caracterizado por ser una clienta fiel de la organización, su negocio ha mostrado un gran crecimiento en su capital de trabajo y en su diversificación de productos y esto se lo debe a su responsabilidad y capacidad de trabajo que hacen de ella una gran empresaria de la microempresa..
texts.en:
Nancy is 59 years old and lives to the south of the city with her son, who is 28 years old.  From the age of 15, she hasn't done anything more important than sewing.  It was a traditional trade that she learned from her mother, who supported herself this way when her father died.  Gradually, Nancy perfected her art.  Her sister taught her to make pants and with practice and repetition, she got more skills, which she now uses in her work today.  When she started her business, she made pants, shorts, and infants shirts, but she has gradually expanded her merchandise and now also makes items for women.  In addition to sewing, for five years she has worked selling merchandise through specialized product guides.  

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her seventh loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has worked with for twelve years.  With the loan, she will purchase raw materials and supplies since December is a time when she never stops working.  She celebrates the new year with her neighbors with her machine at hand, and this is how she is successful.  

During the time she has worked with FMSD, Nancy has been known as a loyal member of the organization.  Her business has shown large growth with her working capital and her diversification of products.  This is due to her responsibility and hard work that makes her a good small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Jose necesita algún tipo de ayuda para poder comprar algunas semillas para sembrar en un terreno heredado por sus padres, ya que se le dificulta sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

Es por eso que Jose está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para comprar semillas y lograr cultivar plátano, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Jose es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 and lives with his family in the community of San Carlos, in the Costa Rican province of Alajuela.  He lives in an area that occupies the first place nationally in the production of coffee and sugar cane.  The area also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers and vegetables.  The Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located in this province.

For some time, Jose has needed help to buy seeds to plant on land inherited from his parents, so that he can support his children.  For this reason, Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 (597000 CRC), with which he can buy seeds and afford his family a better standard of living.

Jose is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of El Encanto de Pital.  This is his first loan through one of the 150 branches of Kiva partner EDESA found in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to cultivate banana plants.

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es: La señora Luz Marleny a sus 53 años de edad trabaja sola atendiendo la venta de comidas rápidas los fines de semana, además la venta de mercancía sobre pedido y la elaboración y venta de artículos decorativos y bisutería. Con el producto de estas labores aporta económicamente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, una hija que aunque ya adulta tiene dos hijos y como no tiene trabajo, la señora Luz Marleny es responsable de sus dos nietos. La señora Luz Marleny necesita de la compra de mercancía tal como ropa y pedrería para elaborar bisutería sobre pedido. El sueño de la señora Luz Marleny es sacar adelante a sus dos nietos.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Marleny, at 53 years of age, works by herself selling prepared food on weekends, in addition to selling merchandise by special order and making and selling decorative items and costume jewelry. With the results of these labors she contributes economically in order to improve her family's quality of life. She has one daughter who although she is an adult has two children, and as she is not working, Ms. Luz Marleny is responsible for her two grandchildren. 

Ms. Luz Marleny needs to purchase merchandise such as clothing, and jewels for making costume jewelry to order. The dream of Ms. Luz Marleny is to bring up her two grandchildren well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as women's and men's clothing and materials for making costume jewelry.

loans.name: Willy Gerardo

texts.es:
Willy es un hombre de 29 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Hace unos meses Willy tiene la necesidad  de remodelar su hogar.  

Willy está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción como Zinc, cemento, fibrolid y para pagar la mano de obra. Con este cambio de infraestructura su familia estará más protegida  y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida. 

Willy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal en la Danta, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Willy is 29 and lives with his family in a community in southern Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on farming, with emphasis on the cultivation of root crops, coffee, corn, beans and livestock.

For some time Willy has needed to remodel his home.  He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1025 (500000 CRC) to buy construction materials such as zinc and cement and to pay for manual labor.  With this change in infrastructure his family will be better protected and will have an improved quality of life.

Willy is a member of the Community Credit Company in Danta, one of 150 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level and to also actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to fix up his house.

loans.name: Sirley Gertrudis

texts.es:
Sirley es una mujer de 37 años. Vive en Isla Trinitaria, un barrio peri-urbano de Guayaquil.  Con la ayuda de su hermana empezó a vender comidas rapidas por las tardes. Sus mayores ventas son de chuzos (caren en palito) y alitas.

Aun que hay un alto indice de delincuencia en Isla Trinitaria, hasta ahora Sirley no ha tenido problemas con ello. No está casado pero tiene hijos, que todos ya son mayores e independientes. 

Con su prestamo quiere construir mejor su casa ya que el negocio lo tiene en la parte delantera de su casa y asi le daría una mejor atencion a los clientes. Quiere comprar cemento, arena, piedas, pinturas.
texts.en:
Sirley is a 37-year-old woman. She lives on Isla Trinitaria, a semi-urban neighborhood of Guayaquil. With the help of her sister she began selling prepared foods in the afternoons. Her biggest sellers are meat shishkabobs and chicken wings. 

Although Isla Trinitaria has a high crime rate, so far Sirley has not had any problems. She is not married but she has children who are all grown and independent now. 

With the loan she hopes to paint and freshen up her home to make it prettier.

loans.use: cemento, arena, piedas, pinturas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a rental house.

loans.name: Lizandro

texts.es:
Lizandro es un hombre de 61 años que vive en Isla Trinitaria - un barrio periurbano de Guayaquil. Allá tiene su negocio por el cual vende productos alimenticios como pescado, cocada, manjar, y melcocha (un dulce tipico de aquí). 

Desde hace 6 años ha trabajado en este negocio, vendiendo cuatro dias por semana. Por el resto de su tiempo se ocupa de su esposa que está discapacitada. Juntos tienen hijos, pero ya son adultos y independientes.

Lizandro está solicitando este prestamo para invertirlo en su casa, mejorandola y volviendola en una casa de cemento. 

También sueña con un aumento de las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Lizandro is a 61-year-old man who lives on Isla Trinitaria, a semi-urban neighborhood of Guayaquil. There he has his business selling food products such as fish, coconut candy, cinnamon custard, and spreadable honey, a traditional sweet from the area. He has had this business for six years and sells four days a week. In his remaining time he takes care of his wife who is handicapped. Although they have children they are adults now and independent. Lizandro is seeking this loan to invest in his home, making improvements and converting it into a cement house. He also dreams of increasing sales in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stone and cement for making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Gricelda Maria

texts.es:
Gricelda es una mujer de 40 años cuyo esposo falleció de cancer del estómago hace solo 2 meses. Le dejó viuda con cuatro hijos de 17, 13, 11, y 6 años. 

Para poder pasar más tiempo con sus cuatro hijos, Gricelda empezó a trabajar como conductora de un carro exprés (un tipo de taxi), hace 7 años. Trabaja todos los días, de las 6AM a las 6PM. Cuando no puede trabajar por alguna razón, le reemplaza su hijo mayor. 

Ella solicita un prestamo para poder mejorar y renovar su casa ya que quiere darle una mejor vida a sus hijos y asi tener fuerzas para seguir trabajando en su taxi. 

A largo plazo espera poder comprar una nueva vivienda en otro sector porque la actual le recuerda a su esposo fallecido.
texts.en:
Gricelda is a 40 year old women whose husband died of stomach cancer only two months ago. He left a widow with four children who are 17, 13, 11 and 6 years old.

In order to spend more time with her four children, Gricelda began to work as an express car driver (a type of taxi) seven years ago. She works every day, from 6:00AM until 6:00PM. When she can’t work for some reason, her oldest child fills in for her. 

She is asking for a loan in order to improve and renovate her home.

In the long term she hopes to be able to buy a new house in another neighborhood because her current home reminds her of her deceased husband.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone and sand for her house

loans.name: Essio Alberto

texts.es:
Essio es un hombre de 34 años y vive en Isla Trinitaria, un sector peri-urbano de Guayaquil. Allá tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio roca firme, que fundó una vez que había ahorrado suficiente dinero para parar de trabajar desde su propia casa. 

Essio trabaja solo y sin ningun problema. Ni siquiera la alta delincuencia de su area le afecta, como pretende.

Está casado con su esposa que trabaja como quehaces domestica. Juntos tienen un niño que nació hace un año. 

Para su futuro, Essio está soñando con la expansión de su negocio, y está dispuesto a trabajar duro para hacer ello una realidad.
texts.en:
Essio is 34 years old and lives in Isla Trinitaria, a peri-urban area of Guayaquil.  There he has an aluminum and glass workshop, that he started when he had saved enough money to work from his own home.

Essio works alone and without any problems.  Even the high crime rates in his area do not affect him, as he expected.

He is married and his wife does housework.  Together they have a child who was born a year ago.

In the future, Essio dreams of expanding his business and he is ready to work hard to make it a reality.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum materials.

loans.name: Zoila Luz Marina

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer de 53 años y vive en Isla Trinitaria, una zona periurbana de Guayaquil. Allá tiene su propio pequeño restaurante. Empezó hace 8 años con este negocio como siempre le ha gustado cocinar. 

Con la ayuda de su nuera, empieza a cocinar desde las 8AM hasta la noche, vendiendo almuerzos y meriendas.

Siempre ha tenido problemas con su vista. Se la operaron los ojos, pero su vista sigue siendo mal.

Está casado con un albañil. Juntos tienen 4 hijos, de 32, 28, 26 y 22 años de edad. Ninguno de ellos se ha puesto a cargo de Zoila.

Ella va a usar su prestamo para mejorar su local y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 53 year old women who lives in Isla Trinitaria, an area adjoining Guayaquil. She has her own little restaurant there. She began this business eight years ago because she has always loved to cook.

With the help of her daughter-in-law, she begins cooking at 8:00AM onwards until nighttime, selling lunches and snacks.

She has always had problems with her vision. Although they have operated on her eyes, she continues to have poor sight.

She is married to a construction worker. Together they have four children who are 32, 28, 26, and 22 years old. None of them have worked in Zoila’s stand.

She will use the money from the loan to make improvements to her facility and thus offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, and tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase "gari" (a cassava-based dough), fish, okra and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. She sells smoked fish at Enyinase near Elmina which she has done for 8 years. Her desire is to increase the quantity of smoked fish she sells. The loan will aid her desire of wanting to increase the fish business by buying more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akosua plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail sells fish at Enyinase near Elmina. She is married to a businessman and has one child. She has sold fish for the past 3 years. Abigail assists her husband in the support of their children. She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale. Abigail will expand her business with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough and firewood to make her food production easier

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Efua smokes fish for sale at Enyinase. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been smoking fish for 10 years. She supports her partner to educate, feed, and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to buy fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fish to smoke for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of gari.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has four children. She has received a junior high education. 

Aba sells fried plantain and bean stew (red-red) at Enyinase. She has done this for twelve years. Her husband is a farmer. Aba uses her income to support and take care of the home expenditures. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase plantain and beans to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and beans to cook for sale.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina used to sell kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) but now sells second-hand clothes at Enyinase near Elmina. She has been selling second-hand clothes for five years. 

Faustina is married to a farmer and has four dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. 

She will use her loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the new profit, Faustina plans to get a shop for the sales of her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana sells Fante kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in plantain or banana leaves) at Enyinase.

She is divorced and has five children. As a single parent, she feeds, clothes, and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales.  

She will use her loan to buy bags of maize for the preparation of the kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for the preparation of the kenkey.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is married to a carpenter and has five children. For the past five years, Florence has sold fante kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish, at Enyinase near Elmina. Florence uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of their home. Florence will use this loan to purchase maize in bulk to produce kenkey for distribution. She plans to reinvest her new profits from her expanded business right back into her business operations.

loans.use: purchase bulk maize for the kenkey production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood for cooking banku

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new products to bring variety to her grocery shop.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saúl es un joven de 22 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Saúl está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de semillas de frijol, ya que es una alternativa fiable y sostenible. Con estos abonos, Saúl aumentara la capacidad que posee el suelo de absorber los distintos elementos nutritivos y con los fungicidas que utilizara gracias a este préstamo también evitara que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, para que al ingerirlos sus clientes no corran peligro de adquirir alguna enfermedad. 
Y así brindara productos de calidad a sus clientes, alcanzara la meta de venta que se ha propuesto para cada mes. Y además dará a abasto con todas sus obligaciones y pagos para así sacar adelante a su numerosa familia.
Saúl es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Saúl is 22 years old and lives with his family in a community in the south of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities, including planting root crops, coffee, corn, beans, and raising livestock.  

Saúl is requesting a loan of ₡500.000 (five hundred thousand colones) to maintain his crops with fertilizer and fungicides in order to protect his bean seeds, since it is a reliable and sustainable alternative.  With the fertilizer, Saúl increases the soil's capacity to absorb different nutrients, and the fungicides are used to avoid the appearance of fungus in his crops, so that his customers don't run the risk of getting sick when they eat his food.  

This is how he provides quality products to his customers, and he meets his proposed sales goal every month.  He is also able to meet all of his obligations and bills in order to improve life for his large family.

Saúl is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, one of the 150 community loan organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is married to a mechanic and has five children. For the past six years, she has been selling wakye (rice and beans cooked together) and stew at Enyinase near Elmina. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Habiba will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and beans, and fish, and will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, beans and fish

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is married to a farmer and has three children. She has received junior high education. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Theresa sells different kinds of fruits at Enyinase, near Elmina. On the table seen above, Theresa has displayed some bananas and oranges. She will use her loan to buy other kinds of fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and has five children. She sells pepper at Eyinase. She has been selling pepper for the past six years now. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more pepper for sale. 

With the new profit, Ama will buy pepper in sacks for resale.

loans.use: to buy more pepper for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua produces gari (a couscous-like grain made from cassava) for sale at Enyinase. She is married to a farmer and has nine dependents. Efua uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. 

Efua will use her loan to purchase bulk cassava for the preparation of the gari.  She plans to expand her gari business with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase cassava for the gari production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize, sugar, and powdered soap for resale.

loans.name: Gezabeth

texts.es: La señora Gezabeth de 32 es soltera y madre de 2 hijos vive en una casa de Interes social desde hace 6 años trabaja en una maquiladora 10 horas diarias de lunes a viernes y como distribuidora de vales para compra de calzado de una zapateria reconocida de la localidad, para Gezabeth lo mas importante son sus hijos y  se preocupa por darles un lugar digno donde vivir ella le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casa el año pasado coloco protecciones y ahora requiere el apoyo para pintar su casa p0or dentro y por fuera y para colocar vidrios de las ventanas que se quebraron con el tiempo, es temporada de invierno y con los cristales rotos la casa siempre esta fría y la casa se moja con las lluvias y sus muebles se llenan de humedad y aparte no siente un hogar calido si no húmedo y esto puede hacer que sus hijos contraigan alguna enfermedad.
texts.en:
Ms. Gezabeth, 32, is single and the mother of two children. She lives in public housing and for the past six years has worked in a factory, ten hours a day from Monday to Friday, as well as working as a distributor of coupons for buying shoes at a well-known shoe store in the area. 

For Gezabeth the most important thing is her children, and every day she concerns herself with providing a worthy place for them to live. She has been making improvements to her home. Last year she installed protective features and now she needs help in order to paint her home both inside and out, and for replacing window glass that got broken over time. It is winter and with the broken glass the home is always cold and becomes damp with the rain. Her furniture gets all full of moisture and besides, it does not feel like a warm home but rather a damp one, and this could make her children contract an illness.

loans.use: to purchase paint and replace window glass in her home.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La señora Maricruz de 43 años es casada, vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 6 años con su hijo y su nuera ya que su esposo se tuvo que ir a Estados unidos a trabajar para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia desde hace 10  años. Maricruz trabaja como operadora de costura en una maquiladora de la localidad trabaja 10 horas diarias de Lunes a Viernes para solventar los gastos familiares del hogar, ella poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su casa hace cuatro años más o menos coloco protecciones en las ventanas  de su casa y puertas de telas, las ultimas mejoras que le realizo fue levantar la barda del frente de su casa misma con la que compartió  el gasto con la vecina para que les saliera mas económica y pinto su casa por dentro y por fuera. La señora Maricruz sabe que la única manera de ir terminando su casa es poco a poco sabe que seria imposible terminarla en un abrir y cerrar de ojos por ello es que solicita el apoy para levantar barda lateral en la parte de enfrente de su casa.
texts.en:
Maricruz is 43 years old, married, and has lived in low-income housing for six years with her son and daughter-in-law since her husband had to go to the United States ten years ago to work to improve their family's quality of life.  Maricruz works as a sewing machine operator at a local factory.  She works ten hours a day from Monday to Friday in order to meet the financial needs of her household. 

She has slowly been making improvements to her house.  About four years ago she installed bars on the windows and doors.  Her latest improvement was to build a wall in front of her house. She shared the cost with her neighbor because it would be more economical.  She also painted her house outside and inside.  

Maricruz knows that the only way to finish her house is piece by piece.  She knows it would be impossible to finish it in the blink of an eye, so she is asking for help to continue the wall in front of her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to finish a wall.

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: El señor Severino es soltero no tiene hijos, el vive en casa de su tía en la localidad de Sacaba, el señor Severino se dedica al servicio de transporte, cuenta con movilidad propia,  pero no es afiliado al sindicato de transportistas, es decir que trabaja con la afiliación de un conocido.  El sale todos los días a las 6 de la mañana para trabajar y descansa a las 6 de la tarde, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz con la institución ya que el préstamo es para la compra de un motor nuevo para su herramienta de trabajo, ya que esta es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Severino is single and does not have children. He lives in his aunt’s house in the town of Sacaba. 

Severino works in the transport service, and has his own transport, but he is not affiliated with the union, that is to say he works in association with a friend. He leaves every morning at 6:00AM for work, relaxing at 6:00PM in the afternoon. 

He is a hard working person who feels happy with the institution for providing the loan so he can buy a new engine for his mode of working because this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his transport service

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la aldea el caimito y se dedica a la produccion y venta de nacatamales, los nacatamales son muy sabrosos y se venden muy bien, para la epoca de navidad es una comida tradicional, ya tiene muchos encargados, pero tiene que aumentar su produccion, no quiere quedar mal con sus clientes y no tiene el capital suficiente para este proceso.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de los nacatamales.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa is 42 years old and lives in the El Caimito township where she devotes herself to making and selling  meat-filled tamales. The tamales are very tasty and they sell very well. It is a traditional food during the Christmas season, and she has many orders already, but she must increase production. She doesn't want to disappoint her customers and she doesn't have enough capital for this process. 

She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for making the tamales. She needs the earnings for covering household costs.

loans.use: to purchase corn meal, pork and chicken, vegetables, banana leaves, rice, olives, condiments and firewood.

loans.name: Mireya De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Mireya  vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.
Hace unos meses Mireya  desea tener seguridad en su local para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Es por esto que Mireya  está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), para ponerle verjas a su tienda de ropa americana y de esta manera llegar a alcanzar sus metas y obtener más ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.
Mireya  es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en: Mireya lives with her family in the marvelous province of Limón, marked by great cultural diversity with a predominantly black population and with important features from the indigenous Costa Rican, Afro-Caribbean, white and Chinese cultures. Each group contributes its own style to the region. This province has beautiful places with white sand, beaches and palm trees and exuberant national parks that harbor tropical rain forests and coral reefs, along with hundreds of species of endangered flora and fauna. Tortuguero National Park contains the largest stretch of protected tropical rain forest and there you can travel its canals and rivers, observe the flora and fauna, watch sea turtles laying eggs and have the chance to see over 300 species of birds including the green macaw, great curassow and toucans. Important scientific research is carried out in this area and it has become an exceptional spot for scientific and ecological tourism. For several months Mireya has been wanting to improve safety at her shop location in order to proceed ahead with her business, dedicating more time to it so that she may offer quality articles of clothing to community residents. With income derived from this business she will also provide a better quality of life to her family. For this reason Mireya is requesting a loan in the amount of 597,000 colons in order to install a security grill at her American clothing store and thus come to achieve her goals and earn a greater income to get her family ahead. Mireya is a member of the communal bank of Batán, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. They are happy because their earnings have been very good and the Bank has helped many women to work at their various businesses.

loans.use: to increase safety at her shop by installing a security grill.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, de 28 años de edad, convive junto a Michel de 27 años viven en una casa alquilada junto a sus 02 hijos; Jhon de 08 y Damaris de 01 año, a quienes estima demasiado y desean un buen futuro. Rosalina, trata de luchar contra las  adversidades del destino y  olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar, se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio. A pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir del mal momento. Hace 12 años que trabaja de forma independiente, es mas agradece a Dios, por darle esa oportunidad. Actualmente tiene un puesto de venta de ropa para todo el público en general, en efecto reconoce que lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito, radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar y por ello que recurre a los préstamos para seguir surgiendo y abastecerse de mercaderías. Con el tiempo piensa en exponer toda variedad de ropa hacia el público, según los gustos y preferencias. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, espera una vez más ser apoyada con el financiamiento para seguir surgiendo, en su banco comunal es una socia colaboradora y muy querida por el resto de  las socias. Con el monto solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará  mayor cantidad de ropa por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad de lima para adquirir la mercadería a precios módicos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 28 years old and lives with Michel, who is 27, in a rented house with their two children: Jhon who is 8 and Damaris who is 1. She loves them a lot and wants a better future for them. Rosalina is trying to fight against the hardships of her fate and forget the familial instability that afflicts her home. She is a woman of character who is very competitive with her business. Despite some setbacks along the way, she always knew how to get out of trouble.

She has been working independently for 12 years, and is thankful to God for giving her that opportunity. She currently has a stand where she sells clothing to the general public. Overall, she feels this business is having a positive effect on her, as her sales keep increasing with time. The key to her success stems from the quality and price of her products. She normally works alone, but sometimes her husband helps by selling alongside her. She is aware she still has a long way to go, and so she keeps returning to the loans to keep moving forward and to stock her merchandise. In time, she plans to sell all varieties of clothing to her customers, according to their tastes and preferences.

This will be her second loan with MFP. She hopes to once more be supported with the money she needs to keep progressing. At her community bank, she is a collaborative member and very loved among the members. With the requested amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy more clothing by traveling to the city of Lima to get the merchandise at a reasonable price.

loans.use: buy more clothing in a variety of styles

loans.name: Gustavo Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo es  cliente que  vive en casa familiar, de su hermana, el es mecánico,  soltero sin hijos. Tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, esta cambiando de lugar su taller, por eso necesita el crédito, para dar un pago por adelantado para el alquiler de una tienda ya que en la tienda funcionara su  taller de mecánica ya que es un lugar estratégico para que funcione su taller, el cliente cuenta con los equipos y herramientas necesarias para su trabajo solo estaba en la búsqueda de un lugar estratégico  y gracias al apoyo de la institución conseguirá hacer realidad su sueño de tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Gustavo lives in the family home of his sister. He is a mechanic, single, without children. He has more than three years of experience in this field. 

He is moving his workshop and this is why he is asking for a loan, in order to make an advance payment for the rent of the shop in order to carry out his mechanical work in a strategic location for his business. 

Gustavo has the equipment and tools necessary to do his work, and only was looking for a strategic place and thanks to the help of the institution he will achieve and realize his dream of having his own workshop.

loans.use: to make an advance payment for the rental of a workshop

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén de 43 años, convive con Lourdes de 35 años de edad, fruto de es amor hoy tienen 05  hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Rubén, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, es campesino y tiene variaos sembrios como: cacao y café. Viene trabajando 16 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; sus plantas más rentables son el cacao y café, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras de cuyos productos le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero, para comprar plantas de cacao y café, así incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, siente que le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,500  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará plantas de cacao y café para incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Rubén, 43, lives with his common-law wife, Lourdes, 35, and they have 5 children who all live in their own house where happiness reigns. Rubén is a man who receives a lot of benefits because he performs  his work enthusiastically.

He is a farmer and has various crops: cacao and coffee.  He has been farming for 16 years and he hires help during harvest time.  His income-producing plants are cacao and coffee for which he receives good money for each kilo from the businesses who collect crops from the farmers.  
The biggest problem of his work is that he can’t fight the insects that infest the fruit of the plants.  In the future he hopes to save more money to buy cacao and coffee plants to increase his yield.  This will be his first loan with MFP and he feels that it will help him progress in his business.  The communal bank is very appreciated by his companions since they all feel very much a part of it.  He will use the 1500 new sols to buy cacao and coffee plants to increase his crops.

loans.use: to buy cacao and coffee plants

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casado  y vive con su esposo que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el abono y herbicidas para asistir su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto ya sembrado para la explotación de este cultivo y actualmente tiene una parte en producción que necesita asistir. El quiere con esta mejorar darle a su cafetal una mejor calidad de cosecha para así obtener una mejoría en rendimiento de cosecha. El quiere generar el máximo de ganancias para el bienestar de el y su familia y mejorar su estabilidad económica cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ronald is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his spouse who is his biggest priority. 

With the money from this loan he wants to buy supplies such as compost and herbicides for his coffee plantation. 

The land has already been planted and is ready for harvesting and currently he has a section which needs looking after. He wants to make improvements to his coffee plantation and with this loan to gain a better quality of crops in order to have a better return from the harvest.

He hopes to make the maximum profits for his wellbeing and that of his family and to improve his economic stability each day. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given a loan with better terms and the rate of interest is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as compost and herbicides for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está en unión libre  y vive con su esposa e hijo de 2 mese que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El comprara abono, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra de las labores en su cafetal y así podrá darle una ayuda extra a su cafetal para producir este año. El cuenta desde varios años atrás con el terreno en producción y este año le quiere dar una ayuda extra para así generar un aumento en su producción de café. El quiere generar el máximo de las ganancias para así tener una mejor estabilidad económica y brindarle cada día a su familia un mejor bienestar de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Emiliano, 42, is married and lives with his wife and 2-month-old son, who are his main priorities. With the loan he plans to buy inputs to attend to his coffee plantation. He will buy compost, herbicides and hire laborers so that he can give his crops some extra help so that they produce well this year. He says that he has been working this land for some years and this year he wants to put in extra effort so that he can increase his coffee production. He wants to generate as much income as he can so that he can have greater financial stability and be able to give his family a better quality of life every day. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He hadn't taken out loans with other banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR made it easy and gave him a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to attend to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope, ahi vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Francisca se dedica desde hace unos tres años a la compra y venta de pescado y camaron, sus ventas las realiza a vendedores de mariscos del departamento de comayagua, tambien vende a los pobladores de su comunidad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camarones ya que tiene un varios pedidos grandes y no tiene capital suficiente para cubrir dichos pedidos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su proyecto, que es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca, 57, lives in the village of Zope with her husband and two children. For three years Francisca has been buying and selling fish and shrimp. She sells to the seafood vendors in the state of Comayagua and also to people in her town. 

She will use the loan to buy fish and shrimp because she has several large orders and doesn't have enough capital to complete them. Her goal is to keep working so that she can move forward on her plans to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 54 años, es una mujer viuda que vive en su propio hogar junto a su unico hijo Yoni de 15 años; a quien brinda lo mejor. Sus años no son impedimento para seguir luchando por el mejor bienestar de su hijo y de si misma. Saturnina es una mujer triunfante y con muchas ganas de superación, se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de su localidad, cuenta con un puesto pequeño donde viene trabajando hace 10 años en esta actividad. Saturnina vende su comida desde muy temprano ya que la gente que lo consume sale satisfechos por lo delicioso que prepara.  La venta de comida le proporciona buenas ganancias, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su hijo quien esta pendiente en los mandatos de sus consumidores. Su plan a futuro es adquirir más víveres para brindar mejor alimentación  a sus consumidores. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP; sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá más víveres para brindar mejor alimentación a sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 54, is a widow and lives in her own home together with her only son, Yoni, who is 15 years old. She gives him the best. Her age doesn't stop her from continuing to fight for a better life for herself and her son. Saturnina is a joyful woman and has a great desire to improve herself.  

She sells food in her town's market. She has a small stall where she has been working for 10 years. Saturnina sells food beginning very early in the morning and her customers leave satisfied by the delicious things she prepares. She earns good money selling food, and her son provides her with his unconditional support, helping meet the demands of her customers. 

Her plan for the future is to buy more supplies so that she can feed her customers better. This will be her 5th loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays on time, she will be able to access other loans more easily and without complications in her village bank. With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she requested, she will buy more provisions to give better food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals.

loans.name: Nelson Jesus

texts.es: Nelson Jesús, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero y  vive con sus padres actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos y herbicidas para la asistencia de su cafetal. El actualmente alquila un terreno sembrado de café en producción y necesita una pequeña mejora para poder cosechar en óptimas condiciones este año. El quiere sacarle al terreno el máximo de provecho y poder generar ganancias para salir adelante con el crédito y mejorar su estabilidad económica y a su vez establecer un ahorro para su futuro. También quiere ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nelson Jesús, 19, is single and lives with his parents. With this loan he plans to buy inputs like compost and herbicides to help his coffee plantation. He currently rents a piece of land that is planted with coffee and it needs some improvements to be able to have an optimal harvest this year. He wants to get as much from the land as he can so that he can earn money to pay off the loan and improve his financial stability. He also wants to start saving for his future, and to help his parents with their household expenses. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't ever received a loan from a bank before, but FUDECOSUR made it easy to get one, and the interest rate was much lower.

loans.use: to increase his coffee plantation's production.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba Luz tiene 56 años de edad, vive el en barrio san antonio en san lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, accesorios para damas y adornos para el hogar, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ahí le llegan todos sus clientes y amigos que tiene, los fines de semana sale a vender a las aldeas y caserios cercanos a su comunidad. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, desea tener bien surtido su negocio para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
Su deseo es que su familia este bien de salud y tengan trabajo para salir adelante.
texts.en: Alba Luz, 56, lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the city of San Lorenzo. She sells new clothing, accessories for women and home decor. Her business is located in her house, and all of her customers and friends come there to buy. On weekends, she goes out to sell in the towns and villages nearby. She will use the loan to buy new clothing. She wants to have the business well stocked for the Christmas season, when her sales are highest. Her wish is that her family is in good health and that they have jobs so they can keep moving ahead.

loans.use: to buy new women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es: Yanet, de 23 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Julio de 26 años y sus 02 queridas hijas Yoselin de 05 años y Edith de 02 años a quienes desea un mejor futuro. Yanet trabaja desde muy pequeña, sus padres le enseñaron esta labor del campo. Con el apoyo de su pareja compraron sus propias tierras donde sembraron hojas de coca y cacao. Yanet y su pareja ahora se preocupan por el futuro de sus hijos, es por ello trabajan con mucho esmero y sacrificio, sembrando cacao y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo tuvo sus frutos. Lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta su localidad, que es el lugar donde vende y el servicio de transporte de sus productos  le sale muy caro. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas plantas e incrementar su cultivo. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de cacao para su parcela.
texts.en:
Yanet, 23, lives in her own home with her partner, Julio, who is 26, and their two cherished daughters - Yoselin, 5, and Edith, 2 - whom they want to give a better future. Yanet has been working since she was very young when her parents taught her to work in the fields. With her partner's help, they bought their own land where they plant coca leaves and cacao. What she likes most about her work is harvesting the land, since she feels that the hard work has been worth it. She has been doing this for 6 years, and thinks the hardest part is getting her crops to where she can sell them, because it costs her a lot of money to transport them. With time, she hopes to save enough money to buy new plants and increase her crops. 

This will be her 8th loan with MFP and she knows that it is her responsibility to make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so. In her village bank, she is always aware of the agreements that they make. With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she requested she will buy cacao seeds for her farm.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Yuliza

texts.es: Yuliza, una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad, convive con Yoni de 36 años, junto ellos viven en casa alquilada junto a sus 02 hijos Mirne de 07 años y Araceli  de 05 años, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. Hace 04 años, Yuliza, se dedica al negocio de abarrotes, desde muy temprano empieza su labor de madre para enviar a sus hijas a la escuela y luego ir abrir su puesto de ventas donde los productos de abarrotes lo puedes encontrar a un precio económico. Yuliza es una mujer a quien  le gusta el trabajo que realiza, ella dice que es rentable, pero a veces cuando se le agotan los productos le hacen falta para poder vender a sus clientes. Pero aun así Yuliza, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar los productos de abarrotes que le hacen falta y así no quedar mal ante sus clientes. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP por lo que se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pagos. Además se siente asegurada con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda muchos beneficios. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles solicitados, piensa invertir en la compra de productos como: sacos de azúcar, fideos, conservas, verduras, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Yuliza, a hardworking, 25-year-old woman who lives with 36-year-old Yoni. They live together in a rented house along with their two children, 7-year-old Mirne and 5-year-old Araceli, who are their motive for working. For 4 years, Yuliza has been working in the grocery business. She began working as a mother very early so that she could send her daughters to school, and later so that she could open her place of business, where you can find groceries for good prices. 

Yuliza is a woman who likes the job she does. She says it is profitable, but sometimes she runs out of products to be able to sell to her clients. However, with the requested loan, Yuliza will soon be able to buy the groceries she has run out of and will not be embarrassed in front of her clients. 

This will be her third loan with MFP and because of that she promises to continue paying her loans. On top of that, she feels secure with her communal bank, which has already given her many benefits. She is thinking of putting the requested 1,500 nuevo soles towards the purchase of products like sacks of sugar, noodles, preserves, vegetables, and other goods.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, noodles, preserves, vegetables.

loans.name: Lidia Ruth

texts.es: Lidia Ruth tiene 28 años de  edad, se dedica  a la  venta de ropa  y de cosméticos de manera ambulante. No es la primera vez que solicita crédito, pues ha demostrado ser  responsable con sus cuotas, además  ella nos explica que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado con el financiamiento  ha aumentado sus mercadería y sus clientes. Lidia es una emprendedora que  tiene una gran experiencia en este tipo de negocios, y sabe identificar a sus clientes ofreciéndole variedad de productos para ellos. Lidia Ruth esta  solicitando crédito para la compra de calzado, cremas, polvos, ropa interior, prendas de oro laminado y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Lidia Ruth is 28 years old and she sells clothing and cosmetics door to door. This is not her first time to request a loan. She has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. Also, she explains that thanks to the help we have  offered with financing, her merchandise and her customers have increased.

Lidia Ruth is an entrepreneur with lots of experience in this type of business, and she knows how to identify potential customers, offering them a variety of suitable products.

Lidia Ruth is requesting a loan to buy shoes, creams, powders, underwear, gold-laminated jewelry, and clothing in general.

loans.use: buy shoes,creams, powders, underwear, laminated gold jewelry, and clothing in general to sell.

loans.name: Gaby Julia

texts.es: La señorita Gaby,  cliente de emprender esta ves se encuentra en su segunda secuencia, se dedica a la venta de frutas como manzanas, limones y ajos desde hace dos años en una calle de la ciudad de el Alto,  área de mucha afluencia en el comercio, la cliente cuenta que en el futuro piensa adquirir otro puesto y así crecer en presencia dentro del mercado y también incrementar su capital de trabajo, solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas por cantidad para surtir su puesto, ya que estas fechas tiene mucha venta, la Señorita Gaby trabaja muy duro ya que esta es su única fuente de ingreso para mantenerse, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gaby, a client of Emprender, is now in her second loan sequence.  She has been working for two years selling fruit, such as apples, lemons, and garlic, in a street in the city of El Alto, a very busy area for commerce.

Gaby hopes that in the future she can acquire another stall and so increase her presence in the market and also her working capital.

She requested the loan to buy fruit wholesale to supply her stall, since she makes a lot of sales these days.

Gaby works very hard because this is her only source of income to support herself.  She is happy and grateful for the opportunity this gives her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy apples, lemons, and garlic to sell.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de 4 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que además se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas, panes de almidón, corviches, y jugos de frutas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, como su casa está muy cerca de una escuela de la localidad tiene bastantes ventas, lleva dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar aceite, plátano, maní, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Proyecto 2003 Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo (Manta) canton, a place known for its pretty beaches that bathe the shores of this beautiful place.  The majority of the residents here are very hardworking and work in maritime jobs.

Here we met María.  She is 24 years old and married, and has a four-year-old daughter from this relationship.  Her husband is a fisherman.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are granted so quickly.

She is a very good mother and housewife who also works preparing and selling snacks and fast food such as turnovers, cornbread, "corviches" [a dish made from green bananas and fish], and fruit juices, among other things.  She works every day from 8:00 until 5:00.  Since her house is very close to a neighborhood school, she has many sales.  She has been in this business for two years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies to prepare the food.
 
Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida, de 42 años, es una mujer  trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Mario de 50 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la vida de Zenaida, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar es su querido pueblo de Santa Rosa, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor de trabajar arduamente y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que con mucho esmero y sacrificio siembra cacao y barbasco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que después del arduo trabajo que tiene es el hecho de vender sus frutos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con la plaga de insectos que podrían afectar su producción. Mas adelante Zenaida, comprará abono y fertilizantes para hacer el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos y así no afecten a sus productos. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP; por ello espera su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal está muy contenta ya que son solidarios y responsables. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará abono y fertilizantes para hacer el mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 42, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her partner Mario, 50, and her four beloved children, who are the reason for all her efforts.

In Zenaida's life, her beloved town of Santa Rosa is a very pleasant place to work.  From the time she was little her parents taught her to work hard, and now she has her own land on which, with a lot of care and sacrifice, she grows cacao and barbasco [a native plant].  What she likes most about her job is harvesting her land because in that way she feels that after the hard work she has the work of selling her products.  She has been doing this work for 10 years and she considers that the hardest part is not being able to fight the menace of insects that could affect her production.

In the future Zenaida will buy manure and fertilizer to take the necessary care of her crops and in this way not affect her production.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP, for which she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her work plans.  She is very happy in her communal bank because they are supportive and responsible.

With the 1,500 PEN she will buy manure and fertilizer to care for her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Nieve

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos, pero dos de ellos fallecieron, sus  dos hijos que aun tiene ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una nieta que es como su hija la cual tiene 15 años de edad y estudia en colegio.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres además de productos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su nieta le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupada de sus clases y tareas. Tiene más de 5 años con su negocio y  gracias a su tienda a salido adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres y productos para regalos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace más de 8 años  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyecto 2003 [Project 2003] meets every 15 days in the district of Jaramijo (Manta). The location is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coast of this lovely place. Here, the majority of the inhabitants are hard workers and make their living by fishing. 

In this place we meet Rosa who is 59 years old. She is separated and had four children from the relationship, though two of them have passed away. The two children she still has are adults and independent. She lives with a granddaughter who is like a daughter to her. She is 15 years old and studies in school.

Rosa has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, and vegetables in addition to office supplies and stationery. She works everyday from 6:30am to 9:00pm, and sometimes until much later. Her granddaughter helps her in her work when she is not busy with her classes and homework. Rosa has had her business for more than five years and thank to her store she had gotten ahead. 

She will use this loan to supply her store more. She is going to buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables and gifts. She has been in the communal bank for more than eight years and she likes it because the group is very united and trustworthy. 

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and to grow her business more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergents, vegetables and gifts.

loans.name: Gianina

texts.es:
Gianina tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Cartagena, en la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Desde hace unos meses que Gianina necesita remodelar y ampliar su hogar, para asi tener un cuarto de pila. Pero no ha podido ya que se le dificulta hacerlo por sus propios recursos economicos.

Es por eso que Gianina está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para la compra de materiales de construcción, asi darles un techo digno a su familia y darles mejores condiciones de vida.

Gianina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Gianina is 27 years old.  She lives with her family in the community of Cartagena, Guanacaste province.  The economy of Guanacaste province is primarily based in livestock farming, although beekeeping and aquaculture is also practiced in the region. 

For several months, Gianina has needed to remodel and expand her home so that she has a laundry room.  However, it has been difficult to complete the project with her personal resources. For this reason, Gianina is requesting a loan of ¢597,000.00 (five hundred and ninety-seven thousand colones) to purchase construction materials and provide her family with a decent roof and better living conditions.

Gianina is a member of “El Encanto de Pital”, a part of the Community Credit Enterprises network.  This is her first loan, in one of 150 EDESA partner organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her home.

loans.name: Maria Emelda

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la comunidad del el caimito y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Maria vive con sus dos hijos, es viuda su esposo fallecio hace dos años.
Maria tiene muchos deseos de superarse, ahora le toca todo sola, pero tiene muchas fuerzas para trabajar y salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos, lacteos, enbutidos y refrescos, desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de navidad.
Su deseo es que sus demas familiares esten bien, todos viven en los estados unidos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old widow, she lives in the El Caimito community and she engages in selling basic necessities. She runs a corner shop in her own house, where she lives with her two children. Her husband died two years ago.
Maria strongly wants to improve herself: right now she has to do everything on her own, but she is strong enough to work and to keep on providing for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy general products such as basic grains, dairy products, sausages and drinks. She wants to stock up her shop for the upcoming Christmas season.
Her wish is for all of her relatives, all residing in the United States, to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy general products such as basic grains, dairy products, sausages and drinks.

loans.name: Las Responsables Group

texts.en:
Maribel is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables 1, 3 & 6 (The Responsible). She makes her home here in a simple structure with three of her six children and their father. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and doing business.

Maribel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for seven years, starting with her own loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing rice, beans, flour, sugar, canned food, and other goods. She is running a Colmado, a small grocery store. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. 

This group is located in one of the Bateyes from La Romana.  All these members are mainly Haitians. Bateyes are rural area surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, flour, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Jacqueline es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas y ordenadas, ella estaba en otro banco hasta que con otras socias crearon este banco ya que está más cerca de su casa. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, tres mayores y dos de 12 y 9 años de edad, tres viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y legumbres, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados. Tiene más de 13 años con su negocio y  gracias a su tienda a salido adelante y con esto ha ayudado a sus hijos en sus obligaciones, ella empezó su negocio con un crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres y otros víveres.

Su meta es ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Proyecto 2003 Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo (Manta) canton, a place known for its pretty beaches that bathe the coastline of this beautiful place.  Here the majority of the residents are very hardworking and work in maritime jobs.

Jacqueline is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the president of the same, and she likes it because her companions are polite and organized.  She was in another bank until she and other members started this one because it is closer to her house.  She is 43 years old and married, and from this relationship she has five children, three older ones and two 12 and 9 years old; three live at home and study in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a driver. 

She has a grocery store in her house.  There she sells all types of household necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and vegetables.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later.  Her children help her in her business when they are not busy.  She has had this business for more than 13 years, and thanks to her store she has gotten ahead and so has helped her children in their duties.  She started her business with a loan she received from the bank.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, detergent, vegetables, and other provisions.

Her goal is to see that her children are good professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent, vegetables, and other provisions.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena integrante del grupo del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 9 años. Además trabaja de manera dependiente en una fábrica.
La mercadería que vende generalmente es de acuerdo a la temporada del año y durante todo el año también se dedica a vender ropa interior. 
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Arica, al norte de Chile. Su hija vive en ésta ciudad, por lo que aprovecha de viajar tres veces al año para surtir su negocio con ropa y productos de bazar, entre llaveros accesorios para dama y niños. Comenta que los precios para comerciantes son muy convenientes. 
El horario que utiliza para su negocio es totalmente flexible, ya que distribuye sus tiempos de acuerdo al horario de su trabajo dependiente.
Además cuenta con un gran número de clientes, quienes realizan sus pedidos, cuando María Elena le corresponde viajar para comprar su mercadería.
Con el crédito comprará ropa exclusiva y al por mayor, aprovechará de visitar a su hija para Año nuevo y comprará su mercadería.
Una de sus metas son independizarse e instalarse con un local establecido, en lo posible tener un bazar o una boutique.
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus sueños son prosperar en su negocio.
María Elena está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio e incrementarlo.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía y apoyo del grupo del Banco comunal, del cual forma parte. Comenta que es un grupo muy comprometido y responsable. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
