María Elena is a member of the communal bank “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” of Talca.  She has sold new clothing for 9 years and also works as a clerk in a factory.  She generally sells clothing according to the season and she sells underwear throughout the year.

She buys the merchandise in Arica, a city in the north of Chile.  Her daughter lives there and she takes advantage of that to travel to Arica three times a year to supply her business with clothing and bazaar products such as women’s and children’s key chains.  She says that the prices there for merchants are very good.
Her work schedule is totally flexible since she fits it around her hours as a clerk.
She also has many customers who give her orders and María Elena fills them when she travels to buy the merchandise.
She will use the money to buy exclusive clothing wholesale and will visit her daughter for New Years when she buys the merchandise.
One of her goals is to be independent and set up a permanent stand and possibly to have a bazaar or a boutique.  She lives together with her husband and her dreams are to prosper in the business.
María Elena  is very happy and appreciative for the help offered her by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business and expand it.  She also feels very comfortable with the company and the assistance of the communal bank of which she is a member.  She says that it is a very committed and responsible group and  the trainings have helped her organize the accounting in her business.

Talca is in the Maule region, located in the center of the country.  It is the commercial and cultural center of the region since it is the most important of the Chilean central valley.   There is a curious reference in Chile about Talca, the phrase “Talca, Paris and London”.  Some say it originates with the English saying, “Talca looks like London” because of the thick fog that frequently covers the city in the winter, as in the capitol of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy exclusive clothing wholesale

loans.name: Kely Johana

texts.es: Leidy es una joven quien a sus 19 años de edad ya es madre de un bebe de apenas tres meses de nacido, con el animo de brindarle a su hijo todo lo necesario, la joven Leidy inicia con su propio negocio de venta de mercancía por catalogo tal como perfumes y lociones corporales desde hace aproximadamente un año y medio gracias a un familiar quien le enseño todo lo relacionado con esta actividad. Con el animo de mejorar sus ventas y con estas conseguir los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento familiar, la joven Leidy requiere de la compra de mercancía para ofrecer un mejor surtido a sus clientes. El sueño de la joven Leidy es ver crecer a su hijo y tener su propio almacén en un centro comercial reconocido de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young woman who at 19 years of age is a mother of a baby just barely three months old. 

With the intent of giving her child everything it needs, young Leidy is beginning her own business selling merchandise from a catalog such as perfumes and body lotions. A relative taught her everything about this activity about 1-1/2 years ago. 

With the objective of improving her sales and securing the necessary income for supporting her family, young Leidy needs to buy merchandise to have a better display for her customers. 

The dream that Leidy has is to watch her child grow up and to have her own shop in a well known mall in the city.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and body lotions

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en la localidad de Comumpiari, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Alicia, desde muy pequeña gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron el cuidado de animales en especial a los gallos de navaja; ahora ella en su chacra a parte de tener cultivos tiene a sus gallos de navaja que en cada feria o fiesta de su localidad llegan a comprarle ya que están entrenados y muy fuertes. Alicia sabe que tiene que estar cuidando a sus animales, ya que pueden morir de cualquier enfermedad que ataca a los animales. La gente que le conoce, le llega a comprar los gallos ya que son muy buenos en la pelea. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que gracias a la venta de sus animales puede solventar con los gastos de hogar. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo que le afecta son las enfermedades que pueden causarle a sus animales. Con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar más animales para luego venderlos a un precio adecuado. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por el cual asegura fielmente cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago. Además se siente fortalecido y en confianza con su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado de 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará animales en especial gallos.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 38-year-old single mother of three children. She lives in the town of Comumpiari, located in the beautiful Ayacuchana rainforest. There she has her own house. 

Thanks to her parents, since she was very small they taught her animal husbandry, in particular for fighting cocks. Now she has fighting cocks in addition to her crops on her small farm. During every holiday or fair in her town people come to her to buy her fighting cocks because they are trained and very strong. Alicia knows she must care for her animals as they could die from diseases that attack animals. The people who know her come to her to buy her fighting cocks because they are very good fighters. 

She likes her business because thanks to the profits she makes she is able to cover her household expenses. She has spent 30 years in this business and her biggest problem is the diseases that her animals can get. 

With loan she has requested she will be able to buy more animals that she will later resell at an adequate price. This will be her third loan with MFP and as such she assures that she will faithfully comply with her payments. She also feels supported and trusted by her communal bank. She will buy animals with the 3,000 nuevos soles she has requested, in particular, fighting cocks.

loans.use: to buy fighting cocks.

loans.name: Lizeth Gabriela

texts.es:
Lizeth tiene 38 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Cartagena, en la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.

Desde hace dos años que Lizeth inicio su negocio de ventas ambulantes de casa en casa por medio de catalogo, para asi sacar adelante a su familia y tener más ingresos incrementando su clientela para tener mejores condiciones de vida. 

Es por eso que Lizeth está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para la compra de de mas artículos para su comercio, para también obtener ganancias para ampliar su negocio.

Lizeth es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Cartagena y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 38 years old, and lives with her family in a community called Cartagena in the Guanacaste province.  The economy of Guanacaste is mainly founded on livestock, although they also practice bee-keeping and fishing in the region.

It was two years ago that Lizeth started her business selling from catalogs from door to door as a street vendor.  She does this in order to move her family ahead in life, and to earn more income by growing her customer base, so as to have better living conditions.

It is for this reason that Lizeth is requesting a loan for the amount of ¢597,000.00 (five hundred and ninety-seven million colones).  This is for the purchase of more items for her business, so as to be able to generate more earnings to grow her business.

Lizeth is a member of the Cartagena Communal Bank, and this is her first loan. The communal bank is one of the 150 member organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica.  Lizeth is continuing to grow on a personal and financial basis, as well as actively participating in the communal bank in her community.

loans.use: to buy more items for her catalog sales business.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de  16 y 10 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es en una gran esposa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar trabaja en una fábrica en la vía a Manta. Realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual tiene una lancha con la cual se dedica a la pesca, él se desplaza en su lancha a alta mar en las noches y no regresa sino hasta el otro día con el producto de la pesca para luego entregar el pescado  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar y ellos  llevan a distintas ciudades para ser comercializados. El también compra en Guayaquil materiales de pesca para vender a sus compañeros y con esto él se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas y otros materiales para la pesca además de combustibles para la lancha. Lleva 9 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado.
 
Su sueño es comprar un barco más grande para que su esposo.

En la foto está la socia con su hijo, el niño de atraz de ella es hijo de otra socia.
texts.en:
The village bank Proyecto 2003 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This is a place known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the shoreline of this lovely location. Most of the people who live here are very hardworking and make their living from the sea. 

Here we met Rosa, 37, who is married and has two children, ages 16 and 10, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a great wife because she helps her husband with their household expenses by working in a factory on the highway to Manta. This loan will be for her husband, who has a boat that he uses to fish. He goes out on the high seas at night and doesn't return until the next day with the fish which he later sells to the merchants that carry them off to different cities to be sold. He also buys fishing materials in Guayaquil which he sells to his fellow fishermen in order to earn a little extra money. 

This loan will be used to buy nets, ropes, hooks, bait holders and other materials including gas for the boat. She has been in the village bank for 9 years and lives it because the loans have always helped her. Her dream is to buy a bigger boat for her husband. 

In this picture, Rosa is with her son, and the child behind her belongs to a different member of the group.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, hooks, bait holder, gas and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia nacida en la ciudad de La Paz, vive en la zona de San Antonio,  casada con el señor Rene  de ocupación  chofer, tiene la actividad de elaboración de tejido de ponchos el cual los realiza a pedido y también se dedica a administración de vehículo, que su esposo maneja,  el cual le genera mas ingresos, tienen 3 hijos de 16, 14 y  9 años de edad todos estudiantes, el dinero del crédito la cliente lo requiere para  realizar el mantenimiento del vehículo como ser cambio de las alfombras y el mantenimiento de los asientos, ya que por el uso que le dan se gasto mucho, la Sra., Julia es una persona muy trabajadora que junto a su esposo se dedican a trabajar para llevar el sustento a sus hijos, quienes son su motor para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Julia, who was born in the city of La Paz, lives in the San Antonio area. She is married to Rene, who is a driver by profession. She knits ponchos, which she makes to order. She also coordinates the maintenance of a vehicle that her husband drives, which brings in more income. They have three children, ages sixteen, fourteen, and nine; all three are students. 

Julia needs the money from this loan to perform vehicle maintenance, such as replacing the carpets and repairing the seats, which get very worn out from so much use. Julia is very hard-working, and she works together with her husband to support their children, who are their inspiration to get ahead.

loans.use: to perform vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Trinidad

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de comida el cual atiende con el apoyo de su esposo,  ellos  realizan  banquetes para cualquier tipo de evento  y nos  comenta  que  sus  clientes  han ido  incrementado  de  manera  satisfactoria, es por  ello que en esta  ocasión requiere  ampliar su  negocio extendiéndolo, realizando  la  construcción para  la parte  de  enfrente del  mismo  ya  que  considera  que  es   muy  pequeño , ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad de  que  sus  clientes  tengan mayor  espacio  y una mejor  comodidad  cuando  van a  su negocio
texts.en: María has a business selling food that she tends to with help from her husband.  They cater banquets for all kinds of events and she comments that her clientele has been growing satisfactorily.  Because of this, she wants to enlarge her business extending it by building on to the front of it because she considers it to be too small.  She sees in the loan the possibility for her customers to have more space and comfort when they come to her business.

loans.use: to make her storefront bigger.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La señora Filomena tiene tres hijos y  vive en la zona de alto Pampahasi que esta ubicado a treinta minutos del centro de la ciudad en la casa de sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de ají molido, mote cocido, chuño y tunta remojados y otros como ser huevos criollos y quesos, tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado  de la zona  donde sale a vender todos los días. Sus hijos mayores se encuentran en edad escolar y el menor se queda con ella en su puesto de venta.  Filomena anhela poder ahorrar lo suficiente para algún día poder comprar una casa propia. En esta oportunidad filomena solicita el préstamo de dinero para el aumento de su capital de trabajo con la compra de ají, mote y tunta por mayor para poder almacenar y así sacar de poco para hacer coser o remojar para su posterior venta, La Sra. Filomena es muy trabajadora y se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Filomena has three children and lives in the Alto Pampahasi zone located thirty minutes from the center of the city in her parents’ house.  She sells ground chili, cooked corn kernels, dehydrated potato and soaked dehydrated potato and others like eggs and cheese.  She has a stand in the local market where she goes to sell every day.  

Her older children are school aged and the youngest one stays with her at her sales stand.   Filomena hopes to save up enough to buy her own house some day.  

On this occasion, Filomena requests the loan of money to increase her working capital.  She will buy chili, corn kernels and dehydrated potatoes at wholesale to warehouse and gradually take it out to cook and soak for subsequent resale.  Filomena is very hardworking and feels grateful toward the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ground chili, corn kernels and others.

loans.name: Elizabeth María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 17 y 4 años de edad, los tres estudian en Universidad, colegio y jardín de infantes. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a  confeccionar todo tipo de ropa y trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares.  También se dedica al comercio, vende artículos para el hogar (ventiladores, planchas, colchones, sabanas, entre otras cosas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 en sus dos ocupaciones, para vender sus productos ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana y  también vende en su casa donde tiene su taller de costura, lleva más de 10 años con su taller y un poco menos dedicada al comercio.

Este nuevo crédito lo va invertir en ventiladores, colchones y planchas para la venta y telas y otros materiales para la costura. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad de recibir ayuda a través de los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto 2003” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jaramijo (Manta) Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the residents here are very hardworking and engaged in tasks related to the sea.

We met Elizabeth, 41, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 17 and 4 years old.  The three attend University, secondary school and Kindergarten.  Her husband’s a driver.

She has a small sewing workshop where she’s been making all types of clothing on order for private customers for several years now.  She’s also a merchant.  She sells items for the home (fans, irons, mattresses and sheets, among other things).  She works every day from 6am until 10pm in her two occupations.  To sell her products she goes out three days a week and also sells from home which is where she has her sewing shop.  She’s had the shop for over ten years and has been in commerce for a little less than that time.

She will use this new loan to buy fans, mattresses and irons to sell and to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because of the opportunity to receive help through the loans.

Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a store downtown where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy fans, mattresses, irons, fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 23 años, convive junto a Teodosio de 30 años y fruto de esa relación tienen un pequeño hijo; Henry de 02 años, a quien le brinda amor y desea un buen futuro. Ángela, trabaja arduamente desde hace 07 años, en aquellos años ella se dedicaba a la agricultura, en una pequeña parcela, donde solo le servía para que sostener a su unidad familiar. Hoy tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en donde le va generando buenas ganancias económicas, desde luego, que ya tiene dos rubros diferentes, en las cuales pueda generar otros ingresos extras con respecto a su fuente principal que es su tienda de abarrotes. Ella para llegar a su idea de negocio, así misma que lo lograría siempre y cuando, le tome con mucha firmeza a su trabajo, es por ello que su negocio trata de estar lleno de productos con la finalidad de que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con el producto que se le otorga. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su pareja y su punto de venta está localizado en su misma casa. Sus planes a futuro es incrementar sus productos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y el de sus clientes potenciales. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete en seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos, como en anteriores oportunidades. Además se siente agradecido con su banco comunal por el buen clima organizacional que existe. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles; piensa invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, para que así pueda abastecer a su tienda de abarrotes con la seguridad de captar mayor clientela y aumentar su margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Ángela, 23, lives with Teodosio, 30; they have a two-year-old son, Henry, who she loves and wants a good future for.

Ángela has worked hard for seven years.  During that time she worked in farming on a small parcel that only sufficed to feed her family.  Today, she has a grocery store where she’s earning good economic profits.  Of course, since she now has two lines of work that can generate extra income aside from her main source of income which is the grocery store.

She came to the idea of her business and knew that she’d attain it as long as she took on the work firmly and this is why she always strives to have the store full of products so that her customers will feel satisfied with the products she provides.  In general, she works on her own but sometimes her spouse helps her out and her sales point is located at home.  Her plan for the future is to increase her products to improve her family’s and her potential customers’ quality of life.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she commits to continue making her respective payments like she’s done in past opportunities.  She feels grateful toward her communal bank for the good organizational climate it has.

She will use the 2000 new soles to buy larger amounts of merchandise to stock her grocery store sure of capturing a wider clientele and increasing her sales margin.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Robert Ivan

texts.es:
Robert es una persona humilde, tiene un carácter muy fuerte, pero así mismo es alegre y muy trabajador. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en San Gabriel Provincia del carchi al Norte de Ecuador.

Robert trabaja en la crianza de chanchos, inició hace algunos años, empezó criando chanchos y luego conforme fueron creciendo se los fue vendiendo y la mejor manera de ganar era saliendo a las ferias libres y comprando y vendiendo los chanchos. Ahora necesita incrementar su negocio es por eso que realiza el tercer crédito con Fodemi, va a invertir en la construcción de un corral grande y mejor que el actual ya que ahora tienen un pequeño y en malas condiciones, también piensa comprar crías de cerdos para criarlos y sacarlos a las ferias. Este negocio ayuda a Robert ya que es su única fuente de ingresos económicos para mantener a su familia y darles el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener un terreno propio donde se pueda sembrar, seguir creciendo con el negocio, tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Robert is a humble person with a strong personality.  Even so, he’s cheerful and very hardworking.  He lives with his wife and two children in San Gabriel, Carchi Province in northern Ecuador.

Roberto works raising pigs, a business he started several years ago.  He started raising pigs and as they grew he’d sell them.  The best way to earn profits was to go to the free livestock markets to buy and sell pigs.  Now, he needs to increase his business and this is why he’s taking out his third Fodemi loan that he will use to build a larger, better corral than the one he currently has which is too small and in poor condition.  He also plans to buy litters of piglets to raise and take to market.  This business helps Robert because it’s the only source of income he has to raise his family and to provide schooling for his children.

His dream is to own his own piece of land where he can farm, to continue growing with his business and to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to build a larger, better corral and also to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es: Norma Elena tiene 35 años de edad, su actividad económica es una  pulpería que la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación es una emprendedora que ha iniciado con mucho esfuerzo su propio negocio. Este negocio le ha permitido con las ganancias que obtiene apoyar a su familia y sacar a sus dos hijos adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Norma Elena está solicitando crédito para poder invertir en su inventario lo cual comprara granos básicos, aceite, pasta de diente, desodorante, huevos, entre otros productos derivados, esto permitirá que sus clientes la visite por su variedad de producto que le ofrecerá.
texts.en:
Norma Elena is 35 years old.  Her economic activity is a grocery store located at home.  She is an entrepreneur who has started her own business with much effort.  This business’ profits have made it possible for her to support her family and move her two children forward with much effort.

Norma Elena is asking for a loan to invest in stock inventory.  She will buy basic grains, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and eggs, among other products which will cause her customers to visit her thanks to the wide variety of products she’ll offer.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nelly Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 meses de nacido. El marido trabaja en una fábrica.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos, comida rápida y bebidas como gaseosas, batidos de frutas, energizantes etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que vende en su casa. Lleva en este negocio  un año y empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar gaseosas, energizantes y víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva un año en el Banco comunal y le gusta ya que gracias al crédito puso su negocio que le permite ganar algo.

Su sueño es tener un buen trabajo.

En la foto está la socia con su hijo.
texts.en:
The “Proyecto 2003” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jaramijo (Manta) Canton.  This place is known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this beautiful place.  Most of the residents here are very hardworking and engaged in tasks related to the sea.

We met Nelly, 21, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a four-month-old son.  Her husband works in a factory.

She is a very good housewife who in order to help her husband cover household expenses prepares snacks, fast food and beverages like soft-drinks, blended fruit drinks, energy drinks, etc. to sell.  She works every day from 8am until 3pm and sometimes even later since she sells at home.  She’s been in this business for a year and started it with the first loan she got from the bank.

She will use this loan to buy soft-drinks, energy drinks and foodstuffs to prepare her food.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and she likes it because thanks to the loan she’s able to earn a bit of profit from her business.  Her dream is to have a good job.

She appears in the photo with her son.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, energy drinks and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Brith

texts.es: Brith, de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija Ángela de 08 años. Juntos residen en su propia casa ubicada en la localidad de Comumpiari. Brith, recuerda que todo lo conseguido es gracias al esfuerzo y perseverancia que tiene, para ello tuvo muchas etapas en su vida desde sufrimientos, derrotas,  y victorias- Es así que hace 06 meses comenzó a vender productos como: insecticidas; y desde que empezó le va bien con sus ventas y ya tiene ganado una cantidad considerable de clientela. Sus proveedores le dan a un precio módico para que así sus clientes este contentos y satisfechos, en ocasiones tiene dificultades ya que no le alcanza dinero para que pueda comprar muchos insecticidas. Por lo general lo compran sus vecinos que trabajan en la chacra; para que sus cultivos estén bien cuidados. Normalmente ella trabaja por cuenta propia. Su punto de venta se encuentra en su misma localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su tienda, con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos como también de captar mayor clientela. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete en seguir pagando de manera puntual y oportuna. Además asegura sentirse cómodo con su grupo comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre ellos. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de insecticidas para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Brith, 25, is a single mother; she has an 8-year-old daughter, Ángela.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Comumpiari.  

Brith recalls that everything she has she’s gotten thanks to her effort and perseverance.  She had to go through life phases of many sufferings, defeats and victories.  

Six months ago she started selling products like insecticides and since she started she’s been doing well with sales and has acquired a good number of customers.  Her suppliers give her modest prices so that her customers will be happy and satisfied.  Occasionally she has difficulties because she doesn’t have enough money to buy many insecticides.  In general, her neighbors who work in the fields buy from her so that their crops will be well cared for.  She normally works on her own.  Her sales point is located in her own locality.  Her future plan is to expand the store to improve income and capture more customers.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she commits to continue paying punctually and opportunely.  She assures that she feels comfortable with her communal group because they are all very mutually supportive.  She will use the requested money to buy insecticides to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy insecticide.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan es cliente distinguido de la institución, es una persona  muy  trabajadora  que  se preocupa   día  con día  por  sacar  adelante a  su  familia, es por  ello  que desea comenzar un negocio de  venta  de  comida, para   lo cual  ya   cuenta  con una  traila donde iniciara con su proyecto,  pero  nos  comenta  que  le  hace  falta la rotulación de la misma, ve  en  el  crédito la posibilidad  de  obtener  mayores  ingresos que le permitan  tener una excelente  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: Juan is a distinguished client of the institution.  He is a very hardworking person who strives daily to move his family forward.  Because of this he wants to start a business selling food.  He already has a trailer that he’ll use to start this project but he comments that he still needs signage on it.  He sees in the loan the possibility of obtaining higher income that will allow him to have an excellent economic stability.

loans.use: to pay for signage on the trailer.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: La señora Daniela es cliente antigua que vive en la  ciudad de La Paz es casada y no tiene hijos  dependientes la señora Daniela  se dedica a la venta de café en un lugar estratégico de la zona el tejar se levanta a tempranas horas de la madrugada para ir a vender sus productos ya que a esa hora es donde mas demanda tiene, ella vende  de lunes a domingo el dinero del crédito  lo  invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de su casa y además  esta muy feliz de obtener un crédito con la institución, esta es su única fuente de ingresos por lo que se siente agradecida con la institución por la oportunidad que  le brindan y le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniela is a longstanding client living in the city of La Paz.  She’s married and has no dependent children.  Daniela sells coffee in a strategic spot in the El Tejar zone.  She rises at dawn to go sell her products because that’s the time when demand is highest.  She sells from Monday through Sunday.  She will use the money from the loan to buy building materials and supplies to do some home improvements.  She is very happy about getting the loan from the institution.  This is her only source of income so she feels grateful to the institution for the opportunity it’s given her and to help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 11 años y un bebé  de 4 meses el último, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Vende en su local pues tiene unas cabinas telefónicas y allí logra realizar sus ventas, allí mismo vende helados, útiles escolares,  tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00. Tiene 4 años con su local y las ventas de Avon tres años, estos productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, helados, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.

En la foto está la socia con dos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Comunal Proyecto 2003 communal bank meets every two weeks in the Jaramijo (Manta) canton.  This is a place known for its beautiful beaches that bathe the coasts of this lovely place.  Most of the population here are very hard-working and devoted to the sea-related businesses.

This is where we meet 36 year old Gloria.  She is married and has three children; ages 16, 11, and the last is a four month old baby.  The two oldest children go to elementary school and high school.  Her husband is a driver.

She is a housewife who sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) in order to get her own income.  She sells at her place; she has some telephone booths.  That is where she manages to make her sales.  That is where she also sells ice cream, school supplies, and telephone cards and recharges.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  She has had her place for four years, and she has been selling Avon for three years.  She leaves these products on credit, and she collects every week.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, ice cream, and telephone cards and recharges.  She has been in her communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to continue growing in her business.

Gloria is in the photo with her two children.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, ice cream, and telephone cards and recharges.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.es:
Arnold, tiene 38 años de edad, casado con tres hijos de 14, 13 y 6 años de edad, vive en el Dorado Santa Bárbara.
Arnold, hace 15 años que se dedica al cultivo de café, hace sus viveros luego los siembra,  cuenta con dos manzanas cultivadas, mas otros terrenos que fueron heredados por su padre, siembra café de variedad paca y catuaí. Lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local. Su familia también se dedica a esta actividad. Este producto actualmente es muy rentable.  
A solicitado 3 prestamos a ODEF, con ellos a podido mejorar sus cultivos. Actualmente va invertir en siembra de vivero de café, donde pagara mano de obra y fertilizantes. Su meta es mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Arnold, age 38, is married and has three children; ages 14, 13, and 6.  He lives in Dorado Santa Bábara.

Arnold has been growing coffee for 15 years.  He makes the seed beds, and then he plants them.  He has two “manzanas” (a manzana is just under half of an acre) and other land that he inherited from his father. 

He grows the “paca” and the “catuaí” varieties of coffee.  He sells the wet parchment coffee in the local market.  His family also devotes itself to this business activity.  This product is currently very profitable.

He has requested three loan from ODEF.  He has been able to improve his crops with those loans.  Now he will invest in planting the coffee nursery, pay labor costs, and buy fertilizers.

His goal is to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to plant the coffee nursery, to pay labor costs, and to buy fertilizers and manure, etc.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es: Lauro de 62 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Tomasa de 65 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Para Lauro, la vida es un regalo, ya que le ha brindado muchos caminos por elegir. Ahora él se dedica por entero al cultivo de cacao, en donde le esta yendo de la mejor manera y se siente contento con el trabajo que está realizando. Regularmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero por lo general en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, para que le puedan agilizar la extracción de su producto de forma eficiente y eficaz. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. En el futuro anhela extender su chacra en grandes hectáreas, con el propósito de que produzca en grandes producciones y de mayor calidad. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos. Además agradece la confianza que le está otorgando su grupo comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento continuo de su sus plantaciones de cacao; comprando fertilizantes y contratando personal para que lo ayuden a sacar la maleza de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Lauro, 62, lives in his own house along with his wife Tomasa, 65, and their three beloved children, whom he wants to offer a better quality of life.  For Lauro, life is a gift because it has offered him many roads from which to choose.

Now he devotes himself completely to growing cacao, which is going in the best possible way for him, and he feels happy about the job he is doing.  He regularly receives help from his family, but generally at harvest time he has day laborers who can help him speed up the harvest of his product efficiently and effectively.  Normally he sells his product in the distribution centers in his community.  In the future he hopes to expand his farm into large hectares, with the goal of producing harvests that are bigger and of better quality.

This will be his third loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his respective payments faithfully.  He also is grateful for the trust that his communal bank is giving him.

With the 3,000 PEN he will invest in ongoing maintenance of his cacao fields, buying fertilizers and hiring personnel to help him weed his fields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, tiene 30 años de edad, casada desde hace 13 años, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad quienes están estudiando, vive en el Dorado, Santa Barbara.
Yolanda tiene 14 años de dedicarse a cultivar sus parcelas de café, la zona donde vive es productora de café y desde niña tiene la experiencia.
Sus cultivos han mejorado, pues ella ha solicitado cuatro préstamos a ODEF, para darle un buen mantenimiento y sacar buenas cosechas, más ahora que es un negocio rentable, con este préstamo actual va invertir en la siembra de vivero de café y en compra de fertilizantes. Lo vende en pergamino húmedo en el mercado local de la zona. Todo su esfuerzo a sido para sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 30 years old, married for 13 years and has two children who are 13 and 11 years old attending school; she lives in El Dorado, Santa Bárbara.  Yolanda has been farming coffee for 14 years.  The zone she lives in is coffee-producing and she’s had this experience since childhood.

Her crops have improved for she has requested four ODEF loans to provide them with care and produce good harvests more so now that it’s a profitable business.

She will use this current loan to invest in her coffee nursery buying fertilizer.  She sells it in damp parchment in the local market.  All of her effort is to move her family forward and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 27 años de edad, convive con Richard de 29 años y tienen una hija; Melady de 04 años; juntos viven en su propio hogar. Maritza, inicio su trabajo hace 05 años en cultivo de cacao; junto a su pareja  desde muy temprano van a trabajar al igual que sus vecinos ya que los pobladores de su comunidad se dedican al cultivo de cacao. Maritza ofrecía su producto de cacao a menor precio, a sus diferentes clientes, con respecto a las demás competencias.  Ella generalmente se dedica a ofrecer su producto, ya que a veces tiene que quedarse en casa al cuidado de su pequeña hija, mientras que su pareja se va a la chacra. Sus planes es abrir una tienda para tener a su hija mientras que su pareja se va a trabajar en la chacra. Con el préstamo solicitado empezara a abrir una pequeña tienda, así podrá comprar productos de abarrotes. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP, y de todas formas promete seguir pagando las seis cuotas pactadas, además confía en que llegará muy lejos con su grupo comunal. Con el dinero solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando productos de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Maritza, 27, lives with Richard, 29, and they have a daughter, Melady, 4.  Together they live in their own home.  Maritza began her work growing cacao five years ago.  She and her partner go out to work very early, as do their neighbors, since the residents of their community work in cacao production.  

Maritza was offering her cacao product retail to her different customers, with regard to the other competition.  Generally she works offering her product, since sometimes she has to stay at home to care for her young daughter while her husband goes to the farm.  Her plan is to open a store to have her daughter while her partner goes to work on the farm.

With the requested loan she will begin to open a small store so she will be able to buy grocery products.  This will be her first loan with MFP, and in any case she promises to continue making the six agreed-upon payments.  She also trusts that she will go far with her communal bank.

With the requested money of 1,500 PEN, she will invest in buying grocery products such as rice, sugar, and vermicelli, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and vermicelli to start her new business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena esta solicitando un préstamo ya que ha tenido problemas con el techo de su casa, esta en malas condiciones y cuando llueve a tenido problemas de humedad y con la instalación eléctrica de la casa; es por eso que solicita el crédito y reparar el techo y así estar mas tranquila porque aparte de ya no tener problema con la humedad y la electricidad, esta protegiendo su familia de las enfermedades.
Doña Maria Elena trabaja en limpieza de una casa particular y  su esposo como velador de una compañía, ya que tiene un hijo estudiando en la universidad. Desean que el patrimonio de su hijo este en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Elena is applying for a loan because she has had problems with the roof on her house. It is in bad condition, and when it rains she has problems with moisture and with the house’s electrical system.

She is applying for the loan to repair the roof and, thus, live more peacefully so that she will no longer have problems with moisture or electricity. This will protect her family from illness.

Doña Maria Elena works cleaning a private house, and her husband works as a watchman at a company. They have a son studying at the university. They want their son’s inheritance to be in good condition.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 46 años, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde hace 2 años intensifica sus labores ganaderas vendiendo animales como vacas y toros en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad y la comisión de sus ganancias se ven en el precio que  vende de acuerdo a las condiciones de los animales que adquiere, así mismo vende la leche de sus vacas después de ordeñarlos por las mañanas paralelo a esto cultiva la papa, quinua trigo y  maíz que en cada cosecha también los vende al por mayor en el mercado de abastos de su ciudad, en estas tareas siempre recibe la ayuda de su  esposa ya que esto aporta bastante a la economía de su hogar, uno de los planes de  Pedro es  sembrar pastos y forrajes para alimento de los animales que piensa adquirir en el futuro a fin de tener un establo ganadero. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Pedro de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para sus sembríos de alfalfa. .
texts.en: Pedro is 46 years and is known for being a hard worker.  He lives in his own house in Huachac with his wife and their 2 children.  Two years ago he began to intensify his agricultural efforts, selling cows and bulls at the local markets.  He also sells the milk from his dairy cows as well as grows potatoes, corn and other crops which he sells after each harvest at the wholesale market in his city.  His wife helps him in all of his efforts, which help support their home.  Pedro is planting food for the animals he wants to acquire in the future, once his business is more established.  This is his second loan with MFP, and he likes being a part of the communal bank because all its members are very responsible people and work closely together.  He commits to making punctual payments.  With this loan Pedro will purchase natural fertilizers for his alfafa crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.es: Jackqueline, es una mujer emprendedora de 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia; ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Ella realiza varias actividades durante el día, desde las primeras horas del día, sale a vender los productos de primera necesidad, que tiene en su casa. Pero su verdadera pasión; que aprendió desde muy niña es la agricultura. Desde que conformó su familia, sembró maíz, cebada, alverja, habas y quinua. Los cuales comercializa en la ciudad, le va muy bien, tanto así que también compra las cosechas de sus vecinos agricultores. Del mismo modo tiene vacas de las cuales vende leche. Como buena comerciante siempre está pendiente de los precios porque de eso depende sus ganancias, de esta manera ella  ve los frutos de su trabajo que  siempre le genera ganancias para el bienestar de su familia, su deseo es  poder producir en gran escala los granos y ser una comerciante mayorista, pues su secreto es vender lo que ella misma produce. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Jackqueline, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus sembríos de alverja.
texts.en: Jackqueline is an enterprising woman.  She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own house, located in Huachac.   Jackqueline works at various activities during the day.  In the early morning, she runs the small shop which is located in her house, selling every day items like grocery basics.    But her real passion, which she learned when she was a young girl, is agriculture.  From the time she has had her own family, she has grown corn, beans, barley and other crops which she sells in the city.   The business has been going well.  She purchases the harvests of her neighbors to sell for them, and she also keeps dairy cows and sells the milk at the markets.     Like any good business person, she is always checking the latest prices as her income depends on this.  In this way she is able to generate income to improve the well being of her family.   She would like to be able to grow her expand so that she could run a wholesale business, selling what she actually grows.   This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She is happy to be a part of the communal bank as its members are very responsible and work closely together.  She commits to repay her loan in timely payments.  With this loan, Jackqueline will purchase natural fertilizers for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase natural fertilizers

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
La vivienda del señor José Gilberto se filtra el agua cada vez que llueve y lo que la humedad ha provocado que sus muebles estén ya en malas condiciones y partes de las paredes de su casa se estén deteriorando. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo y así tendrá mejor protección en la casa y su salud. Ya que es divorciado y sus hijos ya están casados tiene su propia familia. 
Don José Gilberto trabaja como chofer de un camión de carga de una compañía de trasportes, este el ingreso que obtiene y con el cual planea pagar este crédito, ya que desea mejorar su patrimonio y que pronto será de uno de sus hijos.
texts.en: The home of Jose Gilberto has a roof that leaks water every time it rains, and the humidity has damaged his furniture and parts of the walls are deteriorating.    Jose is requesting a loan to fix his roof so that it can better protect his home and his health.  Jose is divorced and his children are now married and live with their own families.  He works as a truck driver, and will use the income from his job to repay the loan.   He would like to fix his home which will soon belong to one of his children.

loans.use: to make the roof of his home water proof.

loans.name: Kiana

texts.en: Ever since she was a little girl growing up in the upper Ninth Ward, Kiana has wanted to be in fashion. In high school, she dreamed of opening a women's clothing boutique. Kiana has eight years of retail experience, including managing a store. In May, 2011, her dream finally came true when she opened "Sidity" in the Esplanade Mall in Metairie, Louisiana. The name "Sidity" is slang and is defined by the Urban Dictionary as "uppity, high class, bourgeois." Kiana's store, Sidity, is true to its name. The store is filled with classy, stylish yet sexy dresses, separates and accessories – all of which are priced reasonably. Kiana is always studying magazines and catalogs, keeping up with fashion trends and watching what celebrities are wearing. Her mom heard about Kiva on a local radio station and told Kiana to look at the KivaNOLA.org website. Kiana will use her Kiva loan to buy more inventory and to fix up the store. Her dream is to open up a second Sidity in Uptown New Orleans on Magazine St. If you're ever in the New Orleans area and want to be part of "High Sidity" (read high society), stop by Kiana's store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and paint and to fix lighting in the store

loans.name: Estrella Del Mañana (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Estrella del Mañana está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, trabajos que les permiten ayudan a mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad se Azogues en la provincia de Cañar, patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Angelita, tiene 46 años, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 21, 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segunda hija trabaja y ayuda económicamente y su ultima hija  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, también cuida de un sobrino desde que tenía los 3 años de edad hoy tiene 15 años y estudia en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María Angelita se dedica a la venta de pinchos (carne en palito), esta actividad la realiza hace 9 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne, salchichas, papas, verduras y pinchos de madera para la elaboración de los pinchos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.  

El señor que está en la foto con chompa ploma y camisa crema es esposo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Estrella del Mañana” (Star of the Morning) communal bank is comprised of five women and one man.  They work at different business activities.  Their work allows them to help improve the financial situations of their households.  They live in the city of Azogues in the Cañar province, the site of the architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people are kind and gentle. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

María Angelita is one of the members of this group.  She is 46 years old, divorced, and has three children; ages 24, 21, and 14.  Her first daughter is married and lives independently.  Her second daughter works and helps financially.  Her last daughter goes to the city high school.  She also has been taking care of a nephew since he was three years old.  His is now 15 and goes to high school.  She does not have her own house, so she rents where she lives.

María Angelita sells “pinchos” (meat on a little stick), and she has been doing this for nine years.  She works Mondays through Saturdays from three in the afternoon until eight at night.

This is her first loan in the communal bank, which a friend invited her to join.  She will use the money from the loan to buy meat, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, and small wooden sticks to make the pinchos.

Her dream is to have her own house.

The man in the photo with the gray jacket and cream colored shirt is the husband of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy meat, sausages, potatoes, vegetables, and small wooden sticks to make pinchos.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Estrella esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual puso invertir en su negocio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa usada de temporada de invierno, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de ropa. 
Doña Estrella se a dedicado al comercio y su esposo es albañil trabaja en una constructora entre los dos han sacada a delante sus tres hijos que tiene y formando un patrimonio segura.
Desea mejorar los su negocio y tener mas ganancias y ingreso a su familia.
texts.en:
Estrella is grateful for the help provided to her with the previous loan, which she used to invest in her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy used clothing for the winter season, since her customers are asking her for this type of clothing. 

Estrella dedicates herself to her business, and her husband is a mason who works for a construction business. Between the two of them, they have helped their three children get ahead and are building up a secure financial foundation. 

She wants to improve her business and have more earnings and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica esta solicitando esta crédito con nosotros porque se dedica a la venta de ropa y le esta haciendo falta comprar algunas pacas de ropa ya que únicamente tiene ropa de verano y desea en invertir en comprar de frio ya que es la que se vende mas ahorita lo que son bufandas, sudadera pants, chamaras  y al surtirse tundras mas clientes y podrá tener un ingreso mejor.
Por las mañanas hace la limpieza de una casa ya que al estar separada tiene que solventar los gatos de la casa por si sola, tiene 2 hojas una ya se caso y la otra aun vive en la casa y pronto se recibirá de la universidad quien es su mayor orgullo.
texts.en:
Verónica is requesting a loan because she sells clothes for a living and lacks sufficient inventory.  She currently has only summer clothing and wants to invest in cold-weather clothing, since scarves, sweat pants, and jackets are selling most right now.  If she stocks up, she will have more clients and may earn more income.

She works as a house cleaner in the morning to meet her household expenses, for which she is solely responsible since her separation.  She has two daughters, one of whom is married and the other who will soon be graduating from the university.  This is Verónica's greatest source of pride.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Longinos

texts.es:
El señor Longinos esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros para comprar materia prima; porque el se dedica a la carpintería y le esta haciendo falta madera para terminar los pedidos de sus clientes.
El señor Longinos y su esposa son originarios de Coahuila ya tienen tiempo residiendo aquí en la ciudad donde ya han empezado a formar un patrimonio para sus hijos, tienen 3 hijos los cuales aun se encuentran en etapa escolar y por los cuales el señor Longinos se esfuerza día a día en darles lo mejor posible por eso el crédito es muy importante ya que es la única fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Longinos is asking for a loan from us in order to purchase raw materials. He is a carpenter and doesn't have enough wood to finish his clients' orders.

Longinos and his wife are from Coahuila. They have been living for a while here in the city, where they have already started to create an inheritance for their children. They have three children, still school-aged, for whom Longinos works hard day after day, in order to give them the best he can. This is why the loan is very important, since he is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, namely wood

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Olga es socia del banco comunal Rosa Rojas, vive en la ciudad de Paute lugar que tiene un clima cálido, lugar propicio para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores y de una gran variedad de frutas, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y muy carismáticas, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Olga tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 14, 10, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos siguientes hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como operador de maquinarias pesada, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Olga se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 3 años y vende su mercadería solo días de ferias, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Rosa Rojas communal bank. She lives in the city of Paute, which has a hot climate and is a propitious place for the cultivation of the most beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruit. Its people practice farming and raise animals. They are kind and very charismatic people, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Olga is 36 years old. She is married, and this union has produced 4 children, who are 2, 4, 10, and 14 years old. Her oldest son is in secondary school and her next two children are in primary school. Her husband works as a heavy machinery operator. They own the house in which they live.

Olga sells all kinds of clothing. She has been doing this work for 3 years. She sells her merchandise only on market days. In her home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years, and she will use her new loan to purchase clothing to supply her inventory.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Julia Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Julia es socia del banco comunal Rosa Rojas, vive en la ciudad Paute lugar que tiene un clima cálido, lugar propicio para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores y de una gran variedad de frutas, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y muy carismáticas mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Julia tiene 44 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 26, 24, 22, 18 y 14 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo trabaja y ayuda  económicamente y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Julia se dedica a la agricultura y cuida una hacienda del sector, trabajo en el que se encuentra hace 22 años, en su casa trabaja en la cría de cuyes, cerdos y pollos.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.
 
Su meta es tener más pollos para la cría.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Rosa Rojas communal bank.  She lives in the city of Paute, a place that has a warm climate and is suited to the cultivation of beautiful flowers and a variety of fruits.  The inhabitants work in agriculture and in livestock.  They are noted for being friendly and very charismatic, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Julia is 44 years old and the single mother of five children, who are 26, 24, 22, 18 and 14.  Her two oldest are married and live independently.  Her third son works and contributes financially, and her two youngest are high school students.  They own the house in which they live.

Julia works in farming and takes care of a house in the area, work she has performed for 22 years.  In her own home, she raises guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.

This is her fifth loan with the communal bank and she is going to invest proceeds in the purchase of chickens.  Her goal is to have more chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Rosa Rojas, vive en la ciudad Paute lugar que tiene un clima cálido, lugar propicio para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores y de una gran variedad de frutas, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y muy carismáticas mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Blanca tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de un niño de dos años de edad. Vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa es propia. 

Ella trabaja en una plantación de flores hace un año, labora de lunes a sábado todo el día. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes.
 
Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para continuar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un negocio estable como una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Rosa Rojas communal bank. She lives in the city of Pauta, which has a hot climate, and is a propitious place for the cultivation of the most beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruits. Its people practice agriculture and raise animals. They are kind and very charismatic people, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Blanca is 29 years old. She is a single mother of a two-year-old boy. She lives in her mother's house, and she shares household expenses with her. Her mother owns the house.

She has worked on a flower plantation for one year. She works Monday through Saturday, all day. At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs.

This is her fourth loan with her communal bank, and she is going to use it to purchase chickens to continue with this business.

Her goal is to have a stable business like a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier tiene 36 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa desde hace 16 años, tiene 4 hijos, reside en la comunidad de La Peña en el Municipio de Santa Bárbara.
La actividad a que se dedica Don Javier es la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra y producción de café. Tiene mas de 16 años de dedicarse a la caficultura, los conocimientos los obtuvo de sus padres ya que ha sido el patrimonio familiar.
La comercialización del café la realiza en pergamino húmedo a personas intermediarias que le compran toda la producción en la comunidad, evitando con esto tener que desplazarse a otros lugares para realizar la venta. 
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo de 6000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y  abonar dicho cultivo. 
El espera obtener una buena cosecha y aprovechar el atractivo precio que mantiene el café en el mercado nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
Javier, age 36, has been in a common-law marriage with his wife for 16 years.  He has four children.  He lives in the La Peña community in the Santa Bárbara municipality.

Javier is a farmer.  Specifically, he plants and produces coffee.  He has been growing coffee for 16 years.  He got the knowledge to do this from his parents as it has been the family heritage.  He sells the coffee as damp beans to intermediary people who buy all of the production from the community.  This way they avoid having to travel to different places to make their sales.

He is currently requesting a loan for 6,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and manure for his crop.  He hopes to get a good harvest and take advantage of the good, sustained price of coffee in the national and international market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Aleu

texts.en: Aleu is a 40-year-old married man with three children. He has been engaged in the farming business for over ten years. He is a very industrious and patient father. He works hard to provide for the necessities of his family. Aleu is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business. In the future, he hopes that his business will expand to provide good living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for his farm business

loans.name: Melando

texts.en: Melando is an honest and dedicated man. He is married and has four children. He cultivates farm land to plant rice as a source of income. He started his business 15 years ago and supports his family through farming. His last harvest was worth PHP 12,000 and he would like to increase his profit. To accommodate his wish, Melando is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to prepare the farm. He is 44 years old and hopes to acquire more income for the betterment of his family’s lives and for the improvement of his business as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir has been working his one hectare of rice fields since he was 18. He is grateful for the 26 years of patience and sacrifice he has made to earn a living. He is married and has seven children.

He would like to educate all his children because he doesn't want them to suffer what he has experienced. So he wants to improve his rice production so that he can have abundant harvests every year. He has tried his best to increase his profit. In this situation, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides which are vital to the success of his farming.

This loan will serve as his hope in achieving his plans to improve his family's living conditions as well as his business, which will enable him to earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: 03.1.65 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghệ has a service business building. She is requesting a loan to purchase a machine to restrain concrete when they ceil the ceiling or when She makes something by concrete, she use this machine to fix the thing.

Nghệ is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 65 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 

In 2010, Nghệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nghệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Nghệ has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Nghệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nghệ hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a  restrain concrete machine.

loans.name: Agacito

texts.en:
Agacito is 51 years old and married with three children. His primary source of income is from rice farming. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice from his field. Last season, he earned PHP 10,000 and did not have enough profit to support the necessities of his family. He felt sad about that, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to develop his business and provide more income. 

He is determined to provide for the needs of his family so he is working patiently on his business. In the future, he knows that he can produce enough profits for the betterment of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to develop his business

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en: Thouk is 56 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two school age children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She sells fish in the market to generate income to support the family. Her husband is a sub village leader. In order to increase her family income, Thouk is requesting a loan of $1,000 to raise capital in her business in order to buy more fish to resell at the market to get more profit. By doing so, her family's economy will be better and can support her daily living. In the future, she would like to build a kitchen and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell at the market

loans.name: 04.10.9 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Thúy operates a manufacturing business sewing clothes.  She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth in order to offer a tailor-made and clothing repair service.

Thúy is 32 years old.  She is married with two children.  Thúy is the group leader of the 04.10.9 Nam Ngạn Thanh Hoa Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Thúy’s first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Thúy has been involved in this business for five years.  The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With the profit from her business, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en: Sreypov is 29 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a cloth weaver and her husband is taxi driver.  Sreypov is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk to weave at home.  In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business, build a new house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk to weave at home.

loans.name: 06.05.09-Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Bào operates a retail business selling groceries and a variety of household goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase groceries to sell.

Bào is 46 years old and she is married with two children.  Bào is the group leader of the 06.05.09-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  Bào lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Bào joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women in order to improve her business.  Bào has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Bào has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Bào faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Bào hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is 60 years old.  She is a widow and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a cloth weaver and her daughter is a garment worker. Nget is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk to weave at home.  In the future, she would like to expand her weaving business, build a new house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase silk to weave at home.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget is 39 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two daughters in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a garment worker and her husband is a construction worker.  Both of her daughters are garment workers as well.  Nget is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.  The new motorbike will enable her to easily go to work on time.  In the future, she plans to run a poultry farm, build a new house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: 06.06.05-Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Tài operates a manufacturing business making wine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to make wine to sell.

Tài is 43 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Tài is the group leader of the 06.06.05-Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Solidarity Group, which consists of seven members.  Tài lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tài joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women in order to improve her business.  Tài has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Tài has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Tài faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With the profit from her business, Tài hopes for her business will thrive and to remodel her house.  She also hopes for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make wine to sell.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn is 32 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She works as a cleaner at Panhasastra University, which is located in Phnom Penh city.  Her husband is also a staff member at Panhasastra University.  Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Korn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.  In the future, she would like to improve her house and support her children until they earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise for sale

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is a patient and hardworking man. He is a farmer who grows rice in his one-hectare field. Upon maturity of his crops, he sells to traders and this allows him to earn at least PHP 20,000 each harvest season (April and November). He has five children that attend school. Dionisio is proud that through the income from his farming activities he is able to provide for their school needs.

The profits from the last crop were used for the family's expenses and that is why Dionisio lacks funds to sustain his crop growing. He is now asking for loan of PHP 25,000 to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farming. He hopes that Kiva lenders will entrust him with a loan and he also promises to utilize it well for the improvements of their lives too.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds and seven bags of UREA (fertilizers) for his farm

loans.name: Tip

texts.en: Tip is 69 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and three grandchildren in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She and her husband are farmers.  Her grandson is a construction worker and her granddaughters are garment workers.  Tip is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her granddaughters to drive to work.  In the future, she would like to improve her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her granddaughters to drive to work.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy is 39 years old.  She is a widow and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is a rice farmer.  It has been necessary for four of her children to stop their studies in order to find jobs.  They are employed at a garment factory and earn about ten dollars a day to support the family.  Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Savy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.  In the future, she would like to run a small breakfast store from her home to generate more income to support the family.  In addition, she would like to build a kitchen and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business that Romel inherited from his parents. He finished high school and is now married with three children. His goal in life is to provide a good education for his children. According to him, education is the only legacy he could pass on to his children. So, Romel works untiringly on his farming business so that he can yield better harvests and achieve his goal.

Romel decided to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides to ensure the proper growth of his crops. He will also pay for laborers who will help him transplant the rice seedlings. Romel would like to keep growing rice as long as he is strong enough to do farming activities and someday improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides and to pay for labor fees

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn, a 44-year-old farmer, is married and resides with her husband and eight children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Yorn's husband is a palm juice and palm sugar vendor, while three of their children are employed, two daughters at a master suki soup restaurant in Phnom Penh, and her son a construction worker.

Since they work far away from home, they spend much money on transportation. Therefore, Yorn is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, they can save some money for their family, and the motorbike can be used in the family as well. In the future, Yorn would like to build a new wooden house and support her children in their pursuit of higher studies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: 06.05.08-Đông Vệ Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
