Lý is applying for a loan to purchase materials to maintain her refreshment bar. (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food) She operates a food stall/restaurant, selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for five years.

She is 47 years old and and is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Lý is the group leader of the 06.05.08-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2011, Lý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lý hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar. (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food…)

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Ms. Hao is 52 years old and has two grown children. She is managing a wood workshop that makes family furniture such as tables, desks, beds, etc.  She has run this kind of business for five years and creates a stable income for her family. 

Joining in our credit program in 2007, she finds that a micro-financial program is very suitable for her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more wood as material for manufacturing.

loans.use: to buy more wood as material for manufacturing.

loans.name: 1.1.10 Đông Hải Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. Huệ has been involved in this business for eight years.

Huệ is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a five-member group, the 10 Đông Hải solidarity group. 

In 2010, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish and shrimp to resell.

loans.name: 05.01.27 Điện Biên Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food such as processed seafood, sugar, salt... to resell.

Bình is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children..
She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 27 Điện Biên solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2009, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bình has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main harship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food such as processed seafood, sugar, salt... to resell.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo is 31 years old and and it has been four years since he got married to Cristaline. They already have four children who are in elementary school. Angelo inherited a 1.5 hectare of ricefield which he is cultivating now to serve as his primary source of income. He plants and harvests rice for future merchandise. He also raises hogs and chickens in his backyard and sells them in times of need. Angelo would like to improve the general living condition of his family but he has insufficient funds to buy inputs for his farming business. He would like to apply fertilizers and insecticides to his crops that will help them become more productive. In this regard, he is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

In the future, Angelo would like to earn consistent profits from his farming business to pay for future expenses including expenses leading up to a college education for his children.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his farming business, such as fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old, married and has seven children. Erlinda has managed her farm business of planting of rice for almost 34 years. Her husband is a farmer, her partner in life, and partner in managing their farm business. Last crop season, Erlinda earned minimal income from her crops because they were hit by the previous typhoon.
With her determination to minimize her labor cost in farming, Erlinda and her husband are also doing farm activities to lessen their farm expenses. Erlinda always wishes to get high yield from her crops to uplift her family's living. She is improving her expertise in managing her farm.
With the costly farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides) needed in farming, Erlinda wants to borrow a loan of P40,000 to buy farm inputs to use in her farm.  She hopes to get a high yield from her crops and uplift her family's living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and insecticides) to use in her farm.

loans.name: 05.01.28 Điện Biên Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, a 50-year-old married mother of two, lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. The leader of a three-member group, the 28 Điện Biên solidarity group, Lan has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for five years. Her main hardship is a lack of capital.

In 2009, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having repaid three previous loans, she is requesting a new loan to purchase vegetables to resell. With her profit, Lan hopes for success in her business, academic success for her children, and the opportunity to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a farmer who lives in Roma Norte in the province of Cagayan, together with his wife and two children. He has been growing rice for more than 10 years now. He plants and harvests the rice until maturity and sells them to local traders in the village where they live. He needs to improve his crop production so that he can meet all the needs of his family, especially for his children's allowances and tuition fees. As of now, he had insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides use in farming. According to him, crops can produce abundant harvest if fertilizers and pesticides are applied. 

In the future, Alexander would like to earn good income to meet his goal in raising his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc is 27-years-old with 4 children who are at school age. Her main business focuses on making pork paste.  She started this business 6 years ago and it creates good income for her to manage family life. Being a client of our credit program since 2007, she  has used loans to expand her business. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more new pork products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more new pork products to sell.

loans.name: 03.08.07-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Tý has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase more medication to resell. Tý has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Tý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tý is 28-years-old and she is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

In 2010, Tý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tý has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Tý hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to buy more land for her own.

loans.use: to purchase more medication to resell.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Sour, 33, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sour raises pigs and her husband is a chef for wedding parties. 

Sour is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase fertilizer and grow rice on her plot of farmland. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to send her children to a good school. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and grow rice.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men is 31-years-old with 2 children who are at school age.  Her main business activity is making pork paste and sell. This business has been run for 5 years and creates good revenue. Participating in our credit program in 2007, she has received 5  loans and invested effectively in her business. For a new  loan cycle, she wants to have 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more pork as material for production.

loans.use: to buy more pork as material for production.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian has been managing his one-hectare rice field since he got married to Juliet 10 years ago. Rice farming is the only source of income that his family relies on. He only earns a yield twice a year during the month of April and November. According to him, it was tiresome to be involved in farming, but he had no other choice but to do this activity and he was proud enough to be a farmer. He only finished a high school level of education and his goal now is to continue educating his four children up to a collge education so that they can earn a degree and seek good employment someday.

As of now, he wants to further develop his business so he is asking for an additional capital of P20,000 to buy three bags of rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes that he can improve his crop production and will save enough income for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Vannak, 27, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Vannak bakes bread to sell and her husband is a construction worker. Vannak is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer machine to produce sugarcane juice to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to purchase a new trailer to transport the sugarcane machine. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane squeezer to produce sugarcane juice.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is 49-years-old with 4 children. All of them are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens for  meat. Her farming has been strongly expanded for 10 years  and she gets good profit form this. Joining in our program in 2007, she has used most loans  for raising livestock. For a new loan cycle, she requires a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Las Responsables 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Celia is one of the members from the group Las Responsables 2, 4 & 5 (The Responsible). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her 4 children and their father. She is a hardworking woman and helps her family by bringing in extra incoming.

Celia is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and growing her business. She has had her business for 8 years, starting with her own saving after worked in different jobs. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing shoes. She sells her product by walking and from her home.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to buy cloths and shoes for her children, so they can have a good Christmas. This group located in one of the Bateyes from La Romana, all this members are mainly Haitians. Bateyes are rural area surrounded by sugarcane fields.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. Weaving is a traditional professional business. Her husband, Son, is a farmer. She is asking for another loan of $500 to assist in her husband’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide for maintenance of his farm. 
The couple has been married since 1978 and have six sons and two daughters. Four are married and live outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other two attend school. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Thok

texts.en: Thok, 43, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Thok sells Cambodian noodles and her husband is a farmer. Thok is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport noodles to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to raise pigs. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport noodles to sell.

loans.name: Et

texts.en:
Et (in the photo), age 40, is single. She lives with her parents in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Et grows and sells small trees and flowers at home. She wants to expand her business. Hence she is asking for a loan of $1,200. She will use the loan to grow small trees and flowers by buying sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.use: To grow small trees and flowers by buying sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarou

texts.en: Sarou, 28, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Sarou sells groceries and her husband is a construction worker. Sarou is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work at his construction site. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to buy dessert to sell beside selling groceries. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.name: 03.11.115.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Hải works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Hải  has been involved in this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Hải  is 23-years-old and she is married with 1 children.

Hải  is the group leader of the 03.11.115.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. Hải lives in Thieu Hoa district, Thanh Hoa Province.

In 2010, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hải  has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Hải  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hải  hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rejasa Group

texts.en:
In Bali it has become commonplace for housewives to raise pigs at home to supplement their husband's income. Apart from farming, another thing that can help meet the needs of daily life is to raise livestock, especially pigs. There are several obstacles faced in developing the business, such as limited knowledge of business management as well as limited access to capital. To overcome these problems they decided to join into one group so it's easier to communicate among members of the group and more easily get funding. 

Ni Wayan, 30, is head of the Rejasa group and runs a pig breeding business. To grow the business, Ni Wayan invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be used to buy three piglets and pig feed. In a period of five months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The profits gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Kimhong

texts.en:
Kimhong, 36, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Kimhong sells fish and her husband is a security guard of a private company. 

Kimhong is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to rent a stand at the market to sell fish. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Ang (pictured above) is a scarf weaver, while her husband, Ros is a construction worker. They have been married since 1979 and have three sons and four daughters. Five of the children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are garment workers. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ang is asking for a loan in the amount of $500 in order to purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for her scarf weaving business. She will also use a part of the loan to set up one more loom.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials (cotton threads) for her scarf weaving business and set up one more loom.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en: Panha, 25, resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Panha is an electrician for a hotel. Panha is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, his family is able to generate more income and decrease expenses from public transportation. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to rent a stand at the market for his wife to sell groceries. This will be his first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Все дети взрослые. Муж врач-кардиолог работает в больнице. Мухарам имеет магазин на центральном  рынке «Панчшанбе» приезжают из всех районов города и области. Она занимается купле- продажей конфет, сладостей и шоколадов. У неё широкий ассортимент сладостей разные виды конфет популярных фирм. В бизнесе она сама занимается, а иногда помогает невестка. Для подготовки подарков на Новый год Мухарам хотела бы получить займ для покупки сладостей и конфет и пополнить оборотный капитал. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Muharam is married and is a loving mother of three children, all of whom are adults.  Her husband is a cardiologist and works at a hospital.  Muharam has a store at the central "Panchshanbe" market, where people from all city and regional districts come.  She is involved in buying and selling candy, sweets and chocolate.  She has a wide assortment of sweets and various types of candy of popular brands.  Muharam is involved in this business herself, and her daughter-in-law sometimes helps her.  To prepare New Year's presents, Muharam wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of sweets and candy and increase her working capital.  She relies on your help and thanks you for your help and kindness in advance.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and candy

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is a rice farmer, while her husband is an electrician. They have been married for almost twenty years and have three children: one is a garment worker and the other two attend school. They live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophal is applying for another loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for her son who is a garment worker to get to work.  

Photo: Sophal is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to get to work.

loans.name: Seyeir

texts.en: Seyeir, 24, is married and resides with her husband, two children and her parents in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers in Phnom Penh city. Seyeir requests a loan of USD 800 to buy groceries to resell when she stops working at the factory. In the future, she would like to run  a store in the super market, build a new house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell.

loans.name: Vien's Group

texts.en:
Vien is 41-years-old with 2 children who are school age. Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetable and also focuses on livestock raising. She's had this business for 5 years and the total income from this activity  is considerable. Being a client of our credit program, she is always in good repayment status. Currently, she   wants to have a loan of 4,256,000 Vietnam dong  to buy food for  pigs. She  hopes to  build a bio gas system
 

Bang is 44-years-old. She is is a boss for providing constructional service. She wants to borrow a  loan of 4,256,000  Vietnam dong to invest in buying more construtional tool that serve for her business

loans.use: to buy food for  pigs. She  hopes to  build a bio gas system.

loans.name: Koemlun

texts.en:
Koemlun (pictured above) is single. She now runs an ice coffee shop with her sister and also sells fast food at the same time. In addition, Koemlun’s sister runs a business selling and repairing cell phones. 

Koemlun is asking for another loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy additional cell phones for her sister to resell and she will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in her business of selling fast food.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phones for her sister to resell and she will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in her business of selling fast food.

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
To increase their businesses, the Pangkung Liplip Indah group continues to borrow from MUK. They feel comfortable with having the loan because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. Ni Kadek, the treasurer of the group, 28, has two children. Her first daughter, 10, is in the fourth year of elementary school, and her second child is still a toddler. Her husband works as a farmer on his own land. 

After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Kadek took out another loan to purchase two superior piglets and sell as fattening pigs. Currently the price for one superior piglet is 500,000 Rupiah (IDR). All the profit from this business is going to support her children's education. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en:
Cham (in the photo) is 47-years-old and her husband, Kin, is 50-years-old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons whom are blacksmiths.  

Cham is a weaver. Additionally she also buys nets and some cotton and silk fabrics from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces. 

Cham is applying for her first loan in the amount of $800 to purchase additional nets, cotton and silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets, cotton and silk fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is 54-years-old with 4 children who are grown. Being a farmer, he focuses on raising chickens for meat. He's been in this work for 10 years and earns 5,000,000 Vietnam dong per month from this. Joining in our credit program in 2007, he used the loans to buy food and also repair the house. Currently,  he wants to have a loan of 9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for  chickens.

loans.name: Yulchiboy

texts.ru: Юлчибой проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Его сын находится в России. Сам он занимается растениеводством. В этой области 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Yulchiboy lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 47 years old, married and has two children. His son works in Russia. Yulchiboy himself is a farmer. He has been farming for more then 20 years. Yulciboy is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Chinbat, 51, is a teacher at a driving school. He has been doing his job for 16 years and he lives with his family in the common which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

His living apartment was built in early of 1970. Lately it has became old and difficult to live in because no renovations have been made since it was built. Therefore he is planning to make the renovations to his apartment before the coming spring. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the necessary building materials to make a renovation to his rooms.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to make a renovation to his rooms.

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math, pictured above, is 57 years old, and his wife, Asiyas, is 52 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five daughters--two are married and live outside the family home, one has full-time employment, and the other two attend school.   

Math and his wife are fishermen and sell the fish that they catch in the local market. Math is asking for a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase additional nets and to repair a boat motor.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets and repair a boat motor

loans.name: Darkhantuya

texts.en:
Darkhantuya, 45 sells childrens' clothes in the supermarket called “Tumen Plaza” which is located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and her son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar. 

She has been running her business since last year and her daily sales volume has increased. Darkhantuya plans to expand her business through increasing the working capital. Initially she needs to purchase the new styles of, and large numbers of, kid's clothes from her supplier. It is beneficial for her business future and her family’s income. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the kid's clothes for expanding her business working capital.

loans.use: to purchase childrens' clothes for expanding her business working capital.

loans.name: Thom

texts.en: Thom is 36-years-old with 2 children who are school age. She is running business that focuses on buying and selling scrap products. She has run this kind of business for 5 years and has good  income from this. Participating in our credit program in 2008, she used loans as capital for expanding her purchasing activity. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 4,256,000 Vietnam dong to buy more  scrap products for selling

loans.use: to buy more  scrap products for selling.

loans.name: Farrukhjon

texts.ru: Фаррухчон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Он старается улучшить жилищные условия семьи и усердно работает. Фаррухчон занимается ремонтом автомобиля и является мастером автомашин. Он  кузовщик. У него много клиентов, которых он с радостью обслуживает. На данный момент он нуждается в покупке некоторых инструментов, которые облегчат его работу. С этой целью Фаррухчон просит вас о помощи в этой покупке. Он хочет получить займ для покупки инструментов. Он надеется на вашу доброту и заранее благодарен вам за вашу щедрость. Спасибо большое!
texts.en: Farrukhjon is a hard-working and kind man. He is married and the responsible father of two children. He tries to improve the living conditions of his family and works assiduously. Farrukhjon repairs cars and is an automobile expert. He is an auto body repairman. He is happy to serve his many clients. He currently needs to buy some tools that will facilitate his work. Farrukhjon needs your help to make this purchase.  He wants to get a loan to buy tools. He hopes that you will be kind and thanks you in advance for your generosity. Thank you very much!

loans.use: To purchase tools for car repair.

loans.name: Momakiz

texts.ru: Момакиз 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она занимается шитьем и вышивкой чехлов. В основном она занимается изготавливанием седла. Эти видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа тканей, ниток и иголок.
texts.en: Momakiz is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. She does sewing and embroidering of covers. Mainly she makes the saddle. She has been in this business for twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads and needles.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda, the woman in the photo, is age 42 and sells lotuses. She buys them from fellow villagers and transports them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Savath, is age 43 and is a motor-taxi driver. They have been married since 1987 and have one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one works for a restaurant in Phnom Penh, and the other is in school. They are living in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chenda is asking for a loan in the amount of $200 to replace the wooden stilts of her house. The wooden stilts have been damaged by termites. Chenda's house is risking collapse.

loans.use: to replace the wooden stilts of her house

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa tiene 43 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Tempate, en la provincia de Guanacaste. La economía de esta provincia de Guanacaste se fundamenta principalmente en la ganadería, aunque también en esta región se practican la apicultura y acuacultura.
Desde hace unos meses atrás María Rosa tiene el deseo de hacer algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su hogar.

Es por esto que está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de 300,000.00 (trescientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción para los arreglos de su casa. Así le dará una mejorar calidad de vida a su familia y tendrán un techo  bajo el cual puedan vivir.

María Rosa pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Tempate, una de las 150 empresas socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y nos indica que este préstamo la tiene muy feliz y está muy agradecido con la Empresa por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
María Rosa is 43 years old. She lives with her family in a community called Tempate in the province of Guanacaste. The economy of Guanacaste is based primarily on ranching, although in this region people also practice beekeeping and aquaculture. For several months, María Rosa has wanted to make some improvements to her home's infrastructure.

This is why she is asking for a loan of 300,000 colones to purchase construction materials for the repairs to her house. In this way she will improve her family's quality of life, and they will have a roof under which they can live.

María Rosa belongs to the Tempate communal bank, one of the 150 EDESA communal banks in Costa Rica. She tells us she is very happy about the loan and she is very thankful to the bank for all the help they have given her.

loans.use: to improve her house

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной замужем и мать троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Её трудолюбие помогло ей, открыть свой собственный бизнес и стать успешным предпринимателем. Она  занимается купле- продажей женской, детской и мужской одежды. Более 10 лет она кредитуется в «ИМОН Интернешнл» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. С помощью ранних займов она расширила бизнес, и на данный момент имеет три точки на рынке «Панчшанбе». Гулсуной хотела получить займ для покупки дополнительного товара с целью увлечения оборотного капитала. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulsunoy is married and is a mother of three children.  She is a very hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  Her love of hard work helped her to open her own business and become a successful entrepreneur.  Gulsunoy is involved in buying and selling women's, children's and men's clothing.  She has been obtaining financing from "Imon International" for over ten years and has a good credit history.  She expanded her business with the help of earlier loans and currently has three retail outlets at the "Panchshanbe" market.  Gulsunoy wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of additional merchandise in order to increase working capital.  She is grateful to you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia believes that obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal. Lilia’s goal in life is to provide a better way of living for her children. She works hard and does her best to gain income to sustain her children's needs. Lilia runs a rice-farming business. She is 49 years of age and married to a policeman. She and her husband are blessed with three children, the fruit of their love. Lilia is lucky because her children are kind and loving. Even though there are obstacles encountered by her family, she is strong enough to face them and strives to move on. Lilia wishes to avail of a loan of 40,000 pesos to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm. She hopes to maintain the business and gain higher income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a journalist. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Tam has been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of her house for the past five years. She sells noodles. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business, to buy more furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meats. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, bowls, chopsticks and meat for her food stall.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда арендует небольшое помещение, где готовит национальные блюда (манту, плов и шашлык) для торговли. Этим видом деятельности она занимается восемь лет. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее 8 детей. Она берет кредит для расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Mavluda leases a small space, where she cooks national dishes (manta, plov and shish kabob) for sale.  She has been involved in this business for eight years.  She is 46 years old, married and has 8 children.  Mavluda is requesting this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to lease a space and purchase furniture

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is a 38-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a painter. Nhung earns a living running a grocery store which she has done for 11 years. 

Nhung would like to take loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables, such as spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of vegetables such as, spinach, garlic, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 45-year-old widow with two daughters. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Twenty-one years ago, Be established a stall to sell candies and breads in the local community. She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of candies and breads to sell.

She hopes that this will both enable her to attract more customers, and help her to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more candies and breads to sell.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 51 years old and single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hanh has been running a food stall for six years. She sells noodles for people in the local community. She intends to take a loan to buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and meat to expand her business and to meet her customers' demand. 

She hopes that through this loan she can earn more money through her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy furniture, bowls, chopsticks, and meat

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is 53 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by operating a cafe in front of their house.

Quyen is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase coffee and a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. Quyen also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and a greater range and quantity of soft drinks to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу 34 года, замужем, воспитывает двух детей. После замужества,  Канымбу долгое время была домохозяйкой и ухаживала за детьми. 3 года назад, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Канымбу начала свой бизнес в торговле хозяйственными товарами и посудой.  Взяв в аренду торговое место на рынке, Канымбу и ее муж приложили все усилия для развития бизнеса и добились успехов – они смогли приобрести времянку для своей семьи. На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Канымбу обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, в бизнесе - Канымбу хочет открыть свой собственный  магазин.
texts.en: Kanymbu is 34 years old, married and is raising two children.  After getting married, she has been a homemaker for a long time and took care of the children.  In search of an income source for her family, Kanymbu started her own business of selling household products and dishware three years ago.  Having leased a retail outlet at a market, she and her husband put all of their efforts toward developing the business and achieved results - they were able to purchase a temporary house for their family.  Today, the merchandise selection is limited, and this is why Kanymbu requested a loan in the sum of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  Purchase of goods will allow her to expand merchandise assortment, increase the number of customers and increase sales.  In the future, Kanymbu wants to open her own store.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City.  He is 44 and has two children.  Dung earns a living by running a coffee shop.  He also runs a business selling household equipment, in particular water pipes, from the door of his house. He has done this for the past 11 years.

Dung would like to borrow money to expand his current business by buying a greater quantity and variety of water pipes and other household items. He hopes that this will enable him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy water pipes to resell

loans.name: Jim

texts.en:
Jim is a farmer in Eldoret town in North Rift Kenya.  He is 33 years old and works in a tea factory within the locality.  In addition, he has been practicing poultry farming for the last 6 years and selling his poultry produce to the local market.  He is married and has two children, aged 9 and 4.

Jim has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost his poultry business by buying a generator and a solar panel for lighting his poultry farm.  He says these will help in feeding the birds at night and bring warmth during the cold seasons.   He says the income from his poultry project be channeled toward the education of his children.

Jim says the farmer's main challenge is the high costs incurred in treating the birds.

loans.use: buy a generator and a solar panel

loans.name: Yeb

texts.en:
Yeb, 40, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and her husband is a carpenter. Her two children are students.

Yeb requests a loan of USD 1200 to purchase wood to produce tables, chairs and beds. In the future, she wants to run a new business, remodel her house, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy shoes materials

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia has been operating her home-based variety store for 10 years. Aside from her retail business, Evelia has run a hog-raising business since 2006. She is happily married and has been blessed with four grown-up children. Her children are all settled and living separately with their families.

Evelia aims to continuously earn more income to sustain her family's needs. She is glad that her business is growing. According to her, through the income generated by her retail store and hog-raising business, she was able to put her children through school. Evelia has been borrowing additional working capital since 2004. Since, Evelia has had a good track record and has been able to reach her 14th cycle. She really wants to improve and increase her sales because she would like to save for emergency purposes. Evelia is able to earn about 15,000 pesos a month. She utilizes her income to meet their daily needs and maintain her hogs. In this situation, she would like to request a loan of 30,000 pesos to purchase volumes of merchandise for her variety store. She hopes to obtain her requested loan so that she can improve their living condition and maintain her variety store.

loans.use: to purchase volumes of merchandise for her variety store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya.   His main interest is in tea and dairy farming. He has been active in farming for 10 years and currently sells his produce to the local markets, with milk going mainly to the hotels.

David has requested for a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says this will give a boost to his farming income and enable him to provide an education to his children.  He reiterates that he wants to add thee more dairy cows in five years and remains hopeful that his business will continue to grow.

He notes that the fluctuation in milk prices is the major challenge he faces.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy  cow

loans.name: Phoan

texts.en: Phoan, 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, a business area of Thai and Cambodian people. She is a farmer and raises pigs. Her husband is a gardener. Phoan requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to use additional income to expand her pig raising business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 45, is widow and lives with her two children in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and raises ducks. One of her children works in Phnom Penh  and another one helps her raising ducks. Sambo is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to open a new grocery store in order to generate more income for supporting her family. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery seling business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Khalife

texts.ru:
Халифе  - 53 года. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, в 1996 году ее семья  начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Начатое со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, благодаря упорному труду Халифе, на сегодняшний день приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также, Халифе возделывает землю с картофелем и зерновыми культурами, получая прибыль от урожая в сезон продаж. 
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Халифе обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Часть доходов от кредита Халифе вложит в откорм скота, часть – в ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Khalife is 53 years old. In 1996 by searching for a source of funding for the family her family started their own business in the livestock and cropping. Starting the business with an amount of 10,000 soms (KGS) and through Khalife's hard work today the business brings about 10,000 soms per month from the sale of milk and dairy products. Also Khalife tills the land with potatoes and grain making a profit from the sales during the harvest season.

For further development of her business Khalife has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening. Part of the proceeds of the loan Khalife will invest in fattening cattle and the other part in home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 year old a married woman with four children all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for two year.
Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: To

texts.en:
To is a 44-year-old married woman with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To and her husband have been running a business for nearly twenty years that makes the paper ornaments that are burnt as offerings on religious and ceremonial occasions in Vietnam. She intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, papers and glues to make a larger number of ornaments. She hopes that this will enable her to better serve her existing customers and meet the higher level of demand that occurs at the end of the year. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her current business and save additional amounts for reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials, paper and glues to make ornaments

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang, 56, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Two of her children are garment workers. Heang requests a loan of USD 300 to buy an ox to plow her rice field. In the future, she plans to grow rice twice a year, build fence around the house and support her youngest son to study until he gets Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase an ox  to plow her rice field

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a father of two children ages three and two and lives with his family in their home area in Kitale, Western Kenya. He has been in farming for five years and currently employs one farmhand and produces maize, beans and milk for the local market. He also trades in livestock for additional income.

Isaac has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance him a loan of 62,400 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the increase in income will go into servicing the loan before he embarks on expanding his farming through his savings. He is optimistic the living standards of his family will also improve.

However, he notes the challenge in feeding animals is quite significant.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan, for two years. Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar, milk, and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Hiloliddin

texts.ru: Хилолиддин проживает в районе Гиссар. Ему 22 года. Холост. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Hiloliddin lives in the Gissar region. He is 22 years old, he is a bachelor. He makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He has been in this business for four years. Hiloliddin is taking out a loan to buy large horned cattle.

loans.use: to buy large horned cattle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer aged 54 and married with seven children ages between 32 and 10 years old. He has been in farming for 28 years and fully relies on the income from his current production of milk, maize, tea and vegetables sold to the local market.
Daniel has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry, so that he can venture into poultry farming too. He adds that the improvement in anticipated farming income with the new venture will help him change his family's living standards. He plans to boost his dairy business too in the future.

He notes the high cost of feed as the major challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Egamnazar

texts.ru: Эгамназар трудолюбивый добрый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Более 15 лет Эгамназар занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает овощи, такие как лук, морковь, репку и картошку. Эгамназар хочет получить хороший урожай и для этого ему необходимо обрабатывать землю и посеять семена. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он планирует использовать займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и топлива. Эгамназар надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Egamnazar is an industrious good man. He is married and is a responsible father of three children. Egamnazar grows crops for more than fifteen years. Mainly he grows vegetables such as onions, carrots, turnip and potatoes. Egamnazar wants to get a good harvest and for this he must cultivate the land and sow the seeds. With this goal he is asking for a loan of $2,000 USD. He plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and fuel. Egamnazar hopes for your help and mercy. Thank you very much!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en: Yom, 38, is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer and runs a poultry farm. Two of her children are garment workers. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Yom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, they can save some money from transportation expenses and support their family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home, renew her house and support her youngest son to study until he gets Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad always ensures that her family will not have financial shortages and takes care of their needs. She is 55 years old and married with five children.  Felicidad has been engaged in her rice-farming business for over 35 years. Her only desire is to uplift their living standard and grow her farm business. Due to the high cost of seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides that will be used in farming, Felicidad decided to borrow a loan of 30,000 pesos to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers, and herbicides for plant care. Felicidad hopes that she will be able to avail of the loan. It was a big help for her to maintain her business and continue generating income. In the future, Felicidad will be successful in her business and as a borrower as well.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow, fertilizers, and herbicides for plant care

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has been operating a business selling food from a stall in South Sudan for four years. Joice is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has six children. Catherine owns a clothes shop which has been in operation for the last twenty three years. She started the business from her personal savings. Besides this, she owns a hotel and supplies fish.
She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more lessos - african cover clothes tied around the waist by women - and hotel furniture. She looks forward to owning a big hotel despite the challenge of seasonal weather, price fluctuations and some clients not paying on time. Catherine will use the extra income from the loan to buy office utensils.

loans.use: To purchase more lessos and hotel furniture.

loans.name: Noeda

texts.en:
Noeda believes that even a woman can do a man's work. At her age she is still doing farm activities like planting and harvesting. Noeda is married with five school age children. She manages a rice farming business to generate income and provide for her family's needs.

Noeda’s priority in life is to prepare her children for college level education. That’s why she keeps on working hard - she knows that the only treasure that she can give to her children is education. Noeda is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for other labor costs. She plans to improve her techniques in farming to increase her productivity and yields.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for other labor costs.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru:
Анаре 32 года, замужем, воспитывает дочь дошкольного возраста. 
Анара  занимается животноводством, которое она начала в 2005 году, использовав для этого начальную сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Анары, на данный момент ее хозяйство, насчитывающее 1 голову нетели  и 1 бычка, дает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и кормов. Доходы Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Anara is 32, married, and is raising a daughter who is of pre-school age. Anara has her own livestock business, which she started in 2005 with a starting capital of 25,000 somi (KGS). Thanks to Anara's hard work and persistence, her farm, which began with one heifer and one steer, is generating a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS) from the sale of milk and dairy products. Aiming to further develop her business, Anara has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional cattle and feed. Anara plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into increasing her number of cattle, and dreams of building a new home for her family someday.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina is 32 year old a married woman with four children, all of them in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for five years.

Rrjina is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bobomurat

texts.ru: Бобомурат женат и имеет четверых детей. Он трудолюбивый человек. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и вложил все свои силы и знания. Бобомурат выращивает лук, кукурузу, рис и арахис. В бизнесе помогают ему жена и дети. Они вместе дружно работают на благосостояние семьи. Бобомурат также занимается скотоводством. Он начал свой бизнес с откармливания овец, а теперь занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. Бобомурат запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и закупа скота. Он надеется на вашу щедрость и благодарен вам за это!
texts.en: Bobomurat is married and has four children. He is a hard-working man. He has been in cultivation of crops for more than fifteen years and invested all his strength and knowledge. Bobomurat grows onions, corn, rice and peanuts. His wife and children are helping him with the business. Together they are working for the family's welfare. Bobomurat is also engaged in cattle breeding. He started his business with the fattening of sheep, but now he fattens large horned cattle. Bobomurat is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 somoni to buy seeds, fertilizer and livestock purchase. He hopes for your generosity and thankful to everyone!

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and cattle.

loans.name: Ro

texts.en: Ro, 53, is widowed and resides with her son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a fish vendor. Her son is employed at the factory. Since the factory is far away from home, Ro is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and purchase a small store in the market to sell fish and renew her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 28 years old and a married woman with two children. One child is in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei south Sudan for one year.
Nasira is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: 03.1.85 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nâng operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Nâng is 58 years old and she is married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 85 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Nâng lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nâng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Nâng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nâng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old a married woman with four children; one of them is in school. She's had a business of selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally is married, and resides with her husband and seven children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She sells porridge at home. Her husband is a construction worker. Four of her children are employed at a garment factory. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work. In the future, she would like to sell Khmer noodle, build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelors degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags of maize to prepare the kenkey [dumplings].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more dresses and panties for sale.

loans.name: Senh

texts.en: Ms. Senh is 63 years old with five children who are grown up. Being a cake maker, she has run this kind of business for ten years. Every day, she sells cakes in wholesale and retail. Joining our credit program in 2007, she uses loans to buy more tools that serve her cake making process and also material. For the new loan cycle, she wants to buy rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of eaters during the Tet holiday.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients to meet the demand of eaters during the Tet holiday.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Sirozhidin

texts.ru: Сирожидин более 7 лет занимается откармливанием скота. Он очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Сирожидин имеет дружную семью, и его сыновья помогают ему в бизнесе, а жена занимается домохозяйством. Сирожидин старается хорошо ухаживать за скотом чтоб они набрали хороший вес для того чтобы он смог продать их за  выгодную цену. Мясо основное блюдо населения и он сможет продать откормленный скот под праздники за хорошую выгоду. Сирожидин хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Sirozhidin has been raising cattle for over seven years. He is a very hard-working and goal-oriented person. He has a tight-knit family. His sons help him in the business, and his wife is a homemaker. Sirozhidin tries to take good care of his cattle so that the animals would gain more weight and he could sell them at a good profit. Meat is a staple product, and with the upcoming holidays he will be able to sell his well-fed cattle at a good price. Sirozhidin would like to receive a loan to buy more cattle and expand his business. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kind  assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is 32 years old.  She has four children who are of school age.  She is a hairdresser and is now managing a small hair salon, which has been in business for 10 years.  This work generates stable income and enables her to manage her family life.   

Cuc joined SEDA’s credit program in 2009 and took out a loan, which she used for raising poultry.  At this time, she would like to invest in the hair salon and is requesting a loan of 9,632,000 VND to buy more hair care products to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more hair care products to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more charcoal and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: The grocery shop above is owned by Ama. She is married and has four children. Some of the items in the grocery shop are soaps, spaghetti, cooking oil, and tins of milk. Her business is three years old. Ama uses her income to support her partner to take care of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase more types of groceries to bring variety into the shop. She plans to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to purchase other types of groceries to bring more variety to the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to operate her day care center.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en: Ms. Thiet is 38 years old with three children who are of school age. She  has a shop selling rice. She started this business ten years ago and can earn a stable income from it. She used her previous loans to buy more raw rice seed to store and produce rice. Currently, she wants to buy more rice to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice, aged 36, is married to Monica. They are blessed with four children aged between six and fifteen years. Maurice runs a hotel and a retail shop that have been in operation for seven years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He will use the funds to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other supplies for the shop. Maurice hopes to own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, and flour.

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en: Pisey, 42, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, and her son is a construction worker. Because the motorbike is too old and breaks down too often, Pisey is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi. By doing so, her husband can earn more money from his transportation service because his motorbike is new and comfortable. In the future, she plans to run a food store next to the factory, build a new house, and send her youngest son to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run as motor taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, breads, ingredients and other basic needs for her retail store.

loans.name: Sempeyan

texts.en:
Sempeyan, aged 33, is married to Kiparu. They are blessed with three children. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for the last two years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 2,000.

This is her first loan with KADET ltd. She will use the funds to buy stocks of sugar, cooking oil, and flour for resale. She hopes to start a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru:
Уулкан 41 год, вдова, воспитывает четырех детей.  Уулкан работает санитаркой в местной больнице, но из- за низкой заработной платы, она , в качестве дополнительного заработка, занимается животноводством. Стартовав с покупки одного жеребенка, Уулкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее 2 лошади и 20 баранов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух голов лошадей. Доходы Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в дальнейшем - накопить средства на оплату образования для детей.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 41 years old, widowed and is raising four children. She works as a nurse in the local hospital but due to the low salaries to medical workers she also supplements the family's income by raising livestock. Uulkan started her livestock business with the purchase of a foal and has now expanded her herd to include two horses and 20 sheep. 

To further expand her business Uulkan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS). She plans to use the money to purchase two more horses for her herd and plans to use the profits from this expansion to buy more animals and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicken cuts and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to enable her to fry in larger quantities for sale.

loans.name: Rakaita

texts.en:
Rakaita, aged 43 is married with three children ages between 18 and 24 years.She makes necklaces and earrings which she has been doing for 11 years.The business earns her a monthly income of Kshs.11,000.

This is her first loan  with KADET ltd. She will use the funds to buy more beads. She hopes to own a curio shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy beads for making necklaces and earrings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase bags of maize to make kenkey  for sale.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolormaa, 38 years-old sells diary products such as cow milk and yogurt in the market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for over 12 years. She lives with her husband and her son in the common which is located in the suburban district. Now she already has her own permanent customers and they say that they have no doubt in her sales, she always sells the best diary products.

At this time, Bolormaa is taking a loan in order to increase her working capital in order to expand her business.  It will be beneficial for her business future. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing a large amount of diary products.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional types of groceries in order to bring variety to her customers.

loans.name: Idirisa

texts.en:
Idirisa is a middle-aged man who is married with three children aged ten, six and two years-old. Two of them are  attending school. He lives in Shurugwi, Gweru town where he works as a Policeman. Idirisa is also doing a poultry business and has been doing this for the past six years now. He has borrowed once before from Kiva partner Microking and has now asked for a repeat loan in order to buy 300 chicks and 10 bags of chicken feed. He is requesting a loan of $1,200.00

The main challenge he faces is that chicks are easily affected by diseases such as newcastle which usually leads  to death. He sees himself having a plot and having a bigger project with 1,000 chicks supplied to a larger market. The loan would certainly improve Idirisa’s life style . He intends to buy a residential stand in Shurugwi, Gweru with the income generated from the business.

loans.use: to buy 300 chicks and 10 bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of different kinds of shorts, blouses, shirts and pants for kids and adults for her clothing business.

loans.name: Yason

texts.en:
Yason is 49 years old and married to Hellen. They have seven children.

He has been in this business for the last three years and from it he earns a monthly income of Kenyan shillings 40,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Kenyan Shilngs 15,000.  He was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by  a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more sewing machines and  textile materials.  His dream is to expand and open more tailoring shops.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and textile materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 20 metres of school uniform material, 12 metres of seat covers and form rubber.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarsaikhan, 46 years-old, sells livestock meat to her customers. She and her husband drive around and buy the meat from the suppliers in the countryside for a lower price. She has been doing this business for many years and they have a lot of loyal customers, which make the business mutually beneficial.

A month ago, she decided to increase her sales volume in order to make a bigger profit. Therefore, she has made an order of livestock from her suppliers. She is going to sell them to the customers in cities. Since the winter is coming, this kind of trading is profitable. She is requesting a loan to cover the expanses of her advance orders.  This loan will be very important in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the fees of her advance orders for meat.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is a resident and a farmer of Kitale, Western Kenya where he lives with his wife.  He has has been practicing farming for the last three years and sells his products of maize and beans to the local market .He also runs a carpentry workshop for additional income.

Dancan has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo in order to help him buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and to buy poultry at 10,000 KES.  He says the dairy cow will provide milk for family consumption as well as income to meet other basic needs besides food.  He plans to expand the dairy business to five dairy cows in five years.

He faces the challenge of food shortages.

loans.use: to buy poultry and to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жительница района Шахритус. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем. Имеет одного ребенка. Она предоставляет услугу. У нее имеется чайхана, то есть столовая. Кроме того она занимается растениеводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Dilbar lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 51 years old, married and has one child. Dilbar manages a "chaihana", a Tajik teahouse. She has also been farming for more then six years. Dilbar is taking out this credit to purchase fertilizer and fuel for the upcoming planting season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict, aged 29 years-old is an unmarried man who sells milk by use of a bicycle. He has been doing that for five years.The business earns him a monthly income of Kshs.14,000.

This is his second loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd. and he has successfully repaid the previous loan.  He will use the funds in order to buy milk and a new bicycle for his milk supply business  .Benedict hopes to buy a pickup for supplying milk in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more maize to enable her to make  large quantity of kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Evergreen Ladies Group

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Letween from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe . She is single with one child. She also cares for one dependent who is still going to school. Letween runs a services business of tailoring ladies' wear. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenges faced are competition and the market as the market is becoming crowded. Letween has requested a loan of $400.00 in order to buy tailoring materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to complete the building of her house allocated by the local Authority. In the future, Letween plans to own a tailoring factory with industrial machines.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ganzul

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganzul is 29 years old and lives with her family in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. She operates a meat stall in the market. Since 2007, she has been running her business. Initially she started with just one stall. Now she owns three stalls. She has many regular customers. 

Ganzul always tries to expand her business day by day. She has a plan to have a big butcher shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Therefore she decided to increase her working capital. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase a large amount of livestock meat from her suppliers at a low price.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of livestock meat.

loans.name: The Eschol Brook Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Teddy from Norton, Harare. He is married and has two children.  Teddy runs a retail business selling books and stationery. The business has been in operation for 2 years.  He says the main challenges he faces are the high cost of stationery during school days and the low demand during school holidays. 

Teddy has requested a loan of $400 to buy diaries, bibles and academic books for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve the general welfare of his family. In the future, Teddy plans to be the major supplier of books to all the schools in his Norton community.

loans.use: to buy stationery and bibles to resell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells gari, bananas and groundnut at Brasi Elmina.  She is married and has 2 children.  Her husband is a driver. She helps the to pay the utility bills as a way of assisting her husband.  Her loan will be used to buy a variety of fruits and bags of gari to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy fruits and gari

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Vendors -B Group

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Maureen from Machipisa, a high-density suburb in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is married and has one child who attends school.  Maureen runs a retail business selling fruits and vegetables.  Her business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenge she faces is the unavailability of some produce due to seasonal changes. 

Maureen has requested a loan of $400 to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay rent on time.  In the future, Maureen plans to have a fresh produce shop in the city center.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ok Mufaose Vendors -A Group

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Raphael from Machipisa, Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. He is married and has two children, both are attending school.  

Raphael runs a services business selling fruits and vegetables.  His business has been in operation for 3 years.  He says the main challenge he faces is the loss of products due to the unavailability of proper storage for perishables. 

Raphael has requested a loan of $400 to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.  He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, Raphael plans to own a piece of land so that he can grow the produce himself.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cooking oil, flour and rice

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 57-year-old mother who loves to sell pork and chicken barbecue in their village. This is her way of gaining income for their daily living while her husband cultivates their farmland. They live in a village with their two children. Through their patience and sacrifices, they survived poverty and educated their children. At this time, their children are already married and have their own family.

Tessie aims to continue and improve the business to earn and save more income for their future. She is asking for additional capital of P13,000 to buy pork, chicken heads and intestines, liver and seasonings needed for making barbecue. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken heads and intestines, liver, and seasonings needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Абдусамад предоставляет услугу, он в основном занимается развозкой пассажиров. В этой области Абдусамад имеет богатый опыт. Он берет кредит для ремонта своей машины.
texts.en: Abdusamad lives in the Khujand region. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. Abdusamad works in the service sector, he is a taxi driver. He has a loat of experience driving passengers. Abdusamad needs this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Meoliole

texts.en:
Meoliole is 37 years old, married to Naomi. They have five children.
