He buys  cattle, rears them and resales them when market prices are high, His business has been operating for the last 10 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 13,000. He is applying for his third loan of Kes 50,000. He paid the previous loan on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds  to buy more cows for  rearing and  resale, he plans to start large scale livestock rearing business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of hides and skin for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, aged 32, is married and blessed with one child, aged two. He practices dairy farming which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

This is his first loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the loan funds to buy cattle feed, hay, and deworming medicine for the cattle. He hopes to be a large scale dairy farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy cattle feed, deworming medicine, and hay

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: This time Mrs.Tuul wanted to increase her working capital (inventory) such as baby clothes for the business' expansion. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase a large numbers of baby clothes from her supplier. In addition, she used her previous loan successfully and paid it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase a large numbers of baby clothes from her supplier.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 31 years old, married to Esther. They have three children.

He operates a general retail stall for the last 6 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 8,500. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 30,000. He paid the previous loan on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy chicken, potatoes, sugar, and wheat flour. He dreams to buy a plot and build residential houses and a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, chicken, wheat flour, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Abla Mawuto

texts.fr:
Abla est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un dépanneur. Elle a 1 enfant.
Abla travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2011. Elle coiffe et vend des mèches pour tous clients dans son atelier. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Abla a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Abla voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a repairman. She has one child.

Abla has been working as a hairdresser since 2011. She does hair and sells hair extensions for all types of clients in her workshop. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Abla requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Abla would like to expand her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: 03.09.117.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Thúy is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.09.117.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. Thúy lives with two dependents in Thiệu Hóa district, Thanh Hóa province

In 2010, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Marichel engages herself in selling fruits and vegetables in her village to supplement her husband's income. She is 29 years old and has one school-age child. She aims to improve their status of living and to become financially stable to educate their child and to give him a better life.

In this regard, she plans to improve her business and to make it a viable source of income. Because of insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P13,000 to buy eggplant, cabbage, bitter-melons, tomatoes, squash, onions and bananas to sell in their villages. She believes that she can improve the business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, bitter melon, tomatoes, squash, onions and bananas to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to Lucy. They have five children.

John has been in the butchery business for the last two years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 19,000. He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan funds to buy stocks of sheep and goats for his butchery.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sheep and goats for butchery.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old and married to Mercy. They are blessed with four children between the ages of three and twelve. For the past year, he has been in the business of buying and reselling milk. This business earns him a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use this loan to buy more milk to sell. George hopes to buy a motorbike to supply his milk to a broader customer base in future.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: 03.12.118. Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mười works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Mười is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.12.118. Vạn Hà  solidarity group, which consists of three members. Mười lives with two dependents in Thiệu Hóa district, Thanh Hóa City, a countryside region.

This is Mười's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main harship that Mười faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mười hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 03.08.120.thiệu Toán Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is 31 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 03.08.120.Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives with 1 dependent in Thieu Hoa district, Thanh Hoa province, a countryside region.

In 2010, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardships that Hương faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to buy land of her own for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard working mother, who aims to become financially stable and give her family a better future. She is now 51 years old and has two adult-age children. She owns and manages a general store to generate income, while her husband manages their rice farming business. She has operated this business for almost ten years and usually earns a profits of PHP 7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their basic necessities.

Margarita planned to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers needs, but due financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, breads, shampoos and candies to sell in her store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and make her dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, oils, soaps, breads, shampoos and candies to sell.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 44 years old and a single mother of one child who is 22 years old. She runs a food stall that has been in operation for 12 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 15,600.

This is Serah's second loan with KADET ltd and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the funds from this loan to buy food stocks such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil. Serah hopes to open a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy food stocks such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the grinding mill and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 22-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Khouloud and her husband find it really hard to cover their expenses because of life costs even though they’re both working. Khouloud's husband has been working as a freelance constructor since 2005. As for her, she has her own home business where she sells artisan clothes and scarves. 

Khouloud is requesting a 1,100 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her inventory of clothes and related accessories. This will allow her increase her sales after making special offers on her products. In the future, she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru:
Рыскан 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей.  После распада Советского Союза, Рыскан начала свой бизнес в полеводстве – выращивании кукурузы и пшеницы. 
Стартовав с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Рыскан  смогла развить хозяйство, приносящее около 10,000 сом в месяц. На сегодняшний день, Рыскан заготовила 10 тонн кукурузы и 15 тонн пшеницы, выращенную продукцию Рыскан планирует реализовывать на центральном рынке города Узген.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений. Доходы Рыскан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение площади обрабатываемых земель.
texts.en: Ryskan is 41 years old, married and is raising two children. After the fall of the Soviet Union she became a farmer, and grows corn and wheat for sale. Ryskan originally started with 10,000 som (KGS) and steadily improved her farming business, which now yields about 10,000 som monthly. Currently Ryskan has 10 tons of corn and 15 tons of wheat to be sold at the markets of Uzgen city. TO expand her business further Ryskan has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase seeds and fertilizer. The profits from this expansion Ryskan is planning to invest into purchasing more land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
To overcome poverty, Renalyn owns and manages a general store in her village, while her husband manages their rice farming business. They endure the hardships and difficulties they encounter in life because they want to educate their two children and give them a bright future. With her husband, they have planned to improve their sources of income so that they can satisfy their needs and support the education of their children.

To work out their plan, Renaly is requesting for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar and soaps to sell in her store. Through this loan, she believes that she make improvements in her business and hoping that she will be successful in carrying them out.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, oils, sugar and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old and is married to Martha. The couple has three children. For the last four years, Edward has been working as a carpenter and he earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his fourth loan. Edward has repaid his previous loan on time.

Edward is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy timber and more grooving, planing, and joining machines and to help educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase timber and carpentry machinery

loans.name: 03.08.04-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Bê works in agriculture farming, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Bê is 60 years old and she is married with five children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 030804-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and has two dependents.

In 2010, Bê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bê has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bê has been involved in her business for five years. The main hardship that Bê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Bê hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: John Kivuku

texts.en:
John is 47 years old and is married with eight children ranging from 12 to 25 years old. For the past three years, he has run a motorcycle transportation business. John also runs a butcher shop to earn more income. His major business challenge is the high cost of gas for his motorbike. John describes himself as a talkative and social man. 

John is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike and meat for his butcher shop. He hopes to own more butcher shops in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and supplies

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is a 50-year-old Lebanese man. He is married and lives with his wife, one parent, and four children. Two of the children are still studying, and the other two are working. Despite all the difficulties and pressures of life that he faces, Afif is devoting his life to his children and sacrifices greatly for their education. He has been working in security for a local company for the past five years. Today, he needs to borrow $2600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his children's educational fees. He’s sure that being knowledgeable will help them to achieve better job positions. In the future, he plans to collect much more money to enhance their life.

loans.use: to pay his children's educational fees

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Vuth, 45, is married and resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker. His wife runs a food store at Ta Moa mountain resort. Vuth requests a loan of USD 1000 to invest with his aunt to run a junk shop. In the future, he would like to own the junk shop himself, build a new wooden house, and send his children to a good school.

loans.use: to invest in a junk shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 36, is married to Evans and is blessed with one child. She runs a butcher shop, which she has operated for 11 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 59,000.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD, and she has successfully repaid the previous loans. She will use the funds to buy a motorbike for transporting the meat to a wider range of customers. Grace hopes to open a chain of butcheries.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy scrap metal to sell and hand-driven carts (Mkokoteni) to rent

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Modou  est récemment entré dans le commerce. Malgré son âge  il fait la navette entre son village d’origine ou il se ravitaille et d’autre régions ou il écoule sa marchandise. Il est marié et subvient aux besoins de sa famille.
Avec le crédit  il va acheter des légumes pour aller le revendre dans d’autres régions ou ses denrées se fond rares voire très chères.
Dans le futur il prévoit de vendre aussi des intrants agricoles et d’élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Modou has recently become a retailer. Despite his age, he takes the shuttle from his hometown, where he buys his goods, to other regions where he sells them. He is married and supports his family.

With the loan, he will buy vegetables that he will resell in other regions where these foods are scarce and can even be quite expensive. In the future, he plans to expand his business, and sell agricultural inputs too.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in order to resell them in other regions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks of sugar, flour, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 35 years old and married to Alice. They have two children.

He has been in the carpentry business for the last 11 years and he earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. He is applying for his fourth loan of KES 100,000. He paid his previous loan well and on time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more timber and build a permanent business premises of his own.

loans.use: To buy timber for making furniture, glue for joinery, and sandpaper.

loans.name: Rose Mwikali

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and married to a farmer. They have six children, four sons and two daughters, aged 11 and 12 years and up. She describes herself as a quiet and social woman. For the last four years, she has been selling t-shirts, trousers, and shirts to frequent customers. In addition, sometimes she runs a grocery store to increase her income. She faces the challenge of having inadequate funds to add a new stock of shoes to her business. She will use the requested loan of KES 10,000 to buy more shoes. Rose looks forward to running a cereal shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy new stocks of shoes

loans.name: Matayian

texts.en:
Matayian, 33, is married to Toiyanet and blessed with three children between the ages of six and 11. He runs a motorbike transport business that has been in operation for eight years and earns him a monthly income of KES 4,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to repair the motorcycle. He hopes to educate his children and start a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for her flea market

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru:
Бактыгул  27 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей 7 и 4 лет.  Бактыгул работает в местной сельской управе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Стартовав с покупки двух коров на кредит в сумме в 60,000 сом (KGS), Бактыгул  смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее 3 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 бычка и 5 лошадей и приносящее около 5,000 сом в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров, для повышения продаж молока и молочных продуктов. Доходы Бактыгул планирует вложить в постройку удобного сарая для скота.
texts.en: Baktygul is 27 years old, married and has two children, who are 4 and 7 years old. She works at the country office and supplements her salary by raising livestock. Baktygul has started her business by purchasing two cows with a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). The business flourished and Baktygul now has three cows, two calves, one bull and five horses, with the monthly profits of 5,000 som. In order to further develop her business, Baktygul has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy two milk cows and have higher profits from dairy sales. She is planning to use the profits to build a better barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, 49, is married to Abel who is a teacher. They are blessed with six children. Hellen runs a retail shop that has been in operation for ten years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 24,400.

This is her eighth loan with KADET and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy more stocks of cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and flour to sell. Hellen hopes to educate her children and own a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Komborero Group

texts.en:
Ledwin is a 42-year-old lady who is married with three children aged 22, 15, and 10 years. Two of the children are still at school. She also has three other dependents, her brother's children, with whom she stays.

Ledwin is into a business of buying and selling clothing items, including ladies' wear and shoes. She buys her goods from South Africa. She has been in business for 5 years, and she has two permanent employees. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes for resale as well as to pay for bus fare. Ledwin says the main challenges she faces in the business are high transportation costs, competition in the market, and unpredictable currency exchange rates. In the next 5 years she is planning to regularize her business venture as well as to move into the central business district of Masvingo, which will enable her to increase and diversify her range of products. With the income generated from this loan, her disposable income will increase and she will be able to financially manage her family well.

loans.use: to buy clothes  and shoes  resale

loans.name: Doussou Ba

texts.fr:
Mme Doussou  est une dame qui habite à environ 16 km de la ville principale dans un petit village très animé par le petit commerce. Elle est mariée et soutien de famille
Elle a monté son commerce depuis plus de quinze ans maintenant
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des denrées alimentaires manquants à sa boutique : du riz, du lait du sucre etc.… 
Mme Doussou est une brave femme qui participe à l’éducation de ses enfants puisqu’’ elle leur paie la scolarité.
Pour ses projets futurs elle aimerait faire du maraichage.
texts.en:
Doussou is a woman who lives in a small village that is bustling with small-scale retail businesses. She lives about 16 km from the region's main town. She is married and supports her family. She started her business over 15 years ago.

With the loan, she is going to buy foodstuffs that are missing from her shop: rice, milk, sugar, etc.

Doussou is a good woman who plays a role in the education of her children by paying for their education. With regard to future projects, she would like to take up small-scale truck farming.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs: rice, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Henrietta F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from one of the secondary schools in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. These teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan from their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

Henrietta the leader of this group. Fifty-year-old Henrietta was born in Lunsar. She is married to a teacher and the couple has three children who are in college. Henrietta has been a teacher for thirty-one years now. She has requested for this loan in order to pay her children's college tuition.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition for her children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large quantities of cigarettes, sweets, milk, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables: sorrel, onions, cassava

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, rice, and other items in bulk

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur was able to broaden her assortment of goods, obtain new customers, and raise her income.  With the revenues from her previous Kiva loan, she renovated her house. With the help of her second Kiva loan, Aynur is planning to widen her assortment of goods by adding winter fabrics. She dreams of opening a small shop with different kinds of fabrics and dressmaking supplies.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Ndunda

texts.en:
Ndunda, 45, is married to Monica and they are blessed with three children. He sells ice cream and also owns rental houses that have given him a monthly income of KES 15,000 for the last seven years.

This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD, and he has successfully repaid the previous loans. He will use the funds to install electricity in the rental houses. He hopes to build more rentals in future.

loans.use: to install electricity in his rental houses

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas, 27, is married with three children. He sells poultry and goats, which he has been doing for three years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 9,000.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the funds to buy more poultry and cows to sell. Nicholas hopes to be a large-scale poultry farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy poultry, goats, and cows

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Mme Binta  fait du petit commerce depuis 20 ans .Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des légumes.
Avec le crédit elle va acheter des choux, des navets etc. 
Avec  le bénéfice moyen qu’elle gagne elle réussit  quand même  à payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Binta has had a small business for 20 years. She is married and a mother with a family. Her work involves selling vegetables. With this loan, she is going to buy cabbages, turnips, etc. 

With the so-so profit she makes, she is nevertheless able to cover the cost of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell at the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, and rice

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a greengrocer who lives in Malindi. She began her business 15 years ago when she opened a stall where she sold tomatoes and oranges. Sidi learned of Milango from her friends and joined the organization to access funding.

Sidi is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase grocery stock such as tomatoes, onions, oranges, and other items. The extra income from her loan will help her to meet her family's needs. In the future, Sidi looks forward to opening her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and oranges to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 25 years old and is single. For the past five years, he has run a butcher shop. John earns a monthly income of 8,500 KES. 

John is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to buy meat to sell. In the future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck to transport his meat.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 42 years old and is a single mother with two children. For the past eight years, she has run a textile business. Naomi earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her third loan. She has repaid her previous loan on time.

Naomi is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of textile products to sell to her customers. In the future, she hopes to buy land for her family.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 55 years old and married to Rael. The couple has five children. For the past 20 years, James has been a farmer and he earns a monthly income of 2,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan.

James is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy more farm equipment and machinery.

loans.use: to buy farm machinery and equipment

loans.name: Resiato

texts.en:
Resiato is 38 years old. She is married to Maisokante and the couple is blessed with four children. For the past two years, Resiato has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Resiato is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD to buy stocks of sugar, rice, and maize flour. In the future, she hopes to educate her children and open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 62, is a widowed mother of three children. She sells water, which earns her a monthly income of 4,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy another water tank. She hopes to start a water bottling company in the future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a resident of Malindi and has a poultry farming business which has been in operation for the last year. She started the business from a stock of 100 chicks.

Dorine is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to pay for poultry feed and to purchase more chicks. She looks forward to opening a nursery school in the future. The main challenge she faces is the high cost of feed and transportation. Dorine will use the extra income to restock her retail shop.

loans.use: to pay for poultry feed and to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan, 36, is married to Faith and they have four children.

He has been in this business for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Jonathan is applying for his first loan of 10,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 45, is married to James. She has been in this business for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of 6,250 Kenyan shillings (KES). Lucy is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to purchase more cereal products for sale and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cereal products for resale.

loans.name: Olimboy

texts.ru: Олиму 37 лет, живет в сельской местности. Работает в колхозе старшим чабаном, пасет большое стадо овец и коз всего населения села и своё стадо также вместе с ними. Более 20 лет занимается откормом мелко-рогатого скота и постоянно держит скот дома, т.к. это занятие является основным источником доходом сельского населения. Ему в этом деле помогают младшие пастухи, а в своём хозяйстве за скотов присматривает жена Хафиза и сыновья. Корма у Олима достаточно, он получает его вместо зарплаты из колхоза, так что в этом нет никакой проблемы. В нашей организации работал несколько лет назад и сейчас снова был привлечен, так как являлся пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en: Olim is 37 years old, and he lives in a rural area.  He works as a senior shepherd at a collective farm and watches over a large herd of sheep and goats for all of the village residents, and his own herd is also with him.  He has been involved in fattening up small livestock for over 20 years and always keeps livestock at home because this business is the primary source of income for the rural residents.  Junior shepherds help him with this business, and his wife, Hafiza, and sons watch after the livestock in his household.  Olim has plenty of fodder because he receives it in place of a salary from the collective farm, so there is no issue with the fodder at all.  He has worked with our organization several years ago and started working with us again now because he is a punctual client.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk in order to produce a larger quantity of food for sale.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina, 33, lives in Ijevan with her family: her husband, three school-aged children and her parents-in-law. After graduation from Ijevan College, where she got her accountancy qualification, she married, so she didn’t work in her specialty.

Since 2010, Irina has rented a workshop where she bakes various confectioneries. Irina fulfills private orders and she has many regular costumers as her products are always very delicious and high quality. Irina’s husband helps her as much as possible and thus they provide for their family.

Irina is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy a new stove and ingredients for her production. Before the New Year’s holidays, she always has a lot of orders and a new stove will help her to bake better confectionery.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and ingredients for her production.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 33, is a single mother with two children.

She has been in this business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of 33,800 Kenyan shillings (KES). Naomi is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.

Naomi hopes to use the loan to buy stocks of sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and milk for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and milk for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, milk, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Callen

texts.en: Callen, 38, is a widow with one child. She describes herself as patient and a woman with morals. She sells food, especially french fries, in a busy place for the last two years. Her business faces the problem of the increased price of ingredients. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase potatoes to be used for making french fries. In the future, Callen hopes to run a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for making fries.

loans.name: Ole

texts.en:
Ole is 38 years old, married to Naiberu. They have three children.

He has been in the farming and cattle business for the last 5 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 50,000.  

Ole is applying for his third loan of Kes 80,000.  He paid the previous loan well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more cows for sale and other cows for farming.

loans.use: to buy more cows for sale and other cows for farming.

loans.name: Lakaya

texts.en:
Lekaya is 45 years old, married to Susan. They have 8 children.

He has been in the livestock business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of kes 69,000.  He is applying for his third loan of Kes 80,000.  Lekaya paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more livestock for sale.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Keteko

texts.en:
Keteko is 39 years old and married to Susan. They have seven children.

He has been in the livestock business for the last 8 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 7,000.  He is applying for his third loan of Kes 50,000.  He paid his previous loan well and on time.  Keteko was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more cows, goats and sheep for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buying dried and raw fish in large quantities.

loans.name: Kuya

texts.en:
Kuya is 34 years old and married to Nemama.

He has been in the seed business for the last 3 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more planting seeds for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more planting seeds for sale and to expand his business.

loans.name: Tankua

texts.en:
Tankua is 49 years old, married to Nemarer. They have three children.

He has been in the livestock business for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 24,000.  He is applying for his third loan of kes 40,000.  He paid the previous loan well and in good time.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more cows and sheep for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cows and sheep for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 30 years old and lives in the town of Zana, in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 2 school age children. For the past year, Aisha has managed her hardware selling business. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more supplies for resale, and will help Aisha generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  Aisha also hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 29 years old, married to George. They have one child.

She has been in the plastic container selling business for the last 20 years and earns a monthly income of kes 10,000.  She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She plans to use the funds to buy more plastic items for sale.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items for sale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 38-year-old married woman with two children who attend school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for three years. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and married to Joseph.

She has run a general store for the last 4 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000.  She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the loan  to purchase more household items for sale and open up another shop to sell the same.

loans.use: to purchase more household items for sale.

loans.name: Ezekiel Okoth

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 30 years old, single and has no children.  He describes himself as a humble, ambitious and God fearing.  

He makes and sells detergents for cleaning.  Ezekiel has been in this business for the last five years and has one employee.  His business faces a challenge of inadequate raw materials for making detergents.  He will use the loan Kes 20,000 to buy mixers, colors and rolls to be used in the making of detergents.  Ezekiel hopes in the future to run a soap manufacturing company.

loans.use: to buy mixers, colors and rolls to be used in the making of detergents.

loans.name: Joyce Mwangangi

texts.en:
Joyce is 60 years old. She is married and has five children ranging from 20 to 35 years. She describes herself as a submissive woman. 

She runs a store where she has sold kale, cassava and charcoal for the last 11 years. Her business faces a challenge of inadequate funds to restock. 

She will use the KES 10,000 to buy more potatoes and cassava. Joyce hopes to expand her store in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past nine years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells cloths. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Ruth to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. 

Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for five years. Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has been working as a human resource manager in one of the local malls since 2009. At the same time, he hopes to carry on his education in order to reach higher positions. 

For that reason, he has big and serious responsibilities to care for. Today, he wants to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his own educational fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to graduate and achieve his master’s degree.  

In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and maybe open his own business.

loans.use: to pay his own educational fees until graduation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old, single and the mother of three children.

She has been in the grocery business for the last year, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 5,000 .She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy fruits, cabbages, onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Concentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONCENTIDAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: viyuteria, macramé, costura de busos, venta de cosméticos, venta de pasteles, tienda, serigrafía, repostería, venta de mantas, venta de comida. 

La señora Lidia  indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de los promotores. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta pasteles que trabaja hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de harina, azúcar, etc.), que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializara de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que no existen mucha papelería.
texts.en:
The "Concentidas" communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo Center. It is composed of eleven members and is managed by a board of directors, of which Lidia is the secretary. The communal bank's members have a variety of businesses. Among them, we have: costume jewelry, macrame, making sportswear, cosmetics sales, cake sales, a store, screen printing, pastry making, blanket sales, and food sales. 

Lidia says that two cycles ago they joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of the facilitators. Currently she has a business making and selling cakes, which she has done for years, learning the work from a previous job. 

The loan she is requesting now is for increasing her merchandise by purchasing flour, sugar, etc., which she will get in La Paz. After making the items, she will sell them as a street vendor (without a fixed stall). This work permits her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she is single and lives with her parents. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that there isn't a lot of paperwork.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and child. Her husband is the one taking care of the family and covering their expenses. 

As for Randa, she has owned a café where she serves hubble-bubble  (water pipes or hookas). People like to meet at her place to enjoy their time and have fun. 

Today, she needs to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the necessary supplies for the hubble-bubble since ten years. She notes that this will satisfy her customers and therefore allow her to get a higher income. In the future, she plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary supplies for the hubble-bubble.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 38-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years. 

Viviana is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 35-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children. 

Suha is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase cleaning products for trading purposes. 

Suha is looking to improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products for trading purposes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 39 years, is a single mother of one child. She has been doing tailoring for five years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is her first loan term with KADET Ltd .She will use the funds to buy textiles to make clothes for sale. Mary hopes to start a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To purchase textiles.

loans.name: Liceth

texts.es: La señora Liceth es comerciante de ropa de niños. El crédito que requiere  es para aumento de capital ya que comprara más ropa de niños y así tener más variedad y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año para incrementar sus ingresos. Liceth es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa en anticrético  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz. Liceth es cliente de Impro desde Julio de 2010 y esta es la segunda vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Liceth is a merchant who sells children’s clothing. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy more children’s clothing. This will enable her to have more variety so that she can take advantage of the year-end festivities to increase her earnings. Liceth is single and has two children. She lives in a rented house in the September 14th District in the city of La Paz.

Liceth has been a client of IMPRO since July 2010 and this will be the second time that her loan will be referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell during the year-end season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are currently in school. For the past eight years, Jane has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize and beans for resale and will help Jane to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for four years.

Ana is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. she will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Amal is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do home maintenance with an aspiration to improve her family's living conditions. 

Due to cultural issues the man in the photo is Amal's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintainace

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and married to Kibe.

She has been into her business for the last 12 years, from which she earns a monthly income of 27,100 KES. She is applying for her fifth loan of 40,000 KES. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Mary hopes to use the loan to buy a dairy cow and to open up a milk-selling depot in the nearby trading center.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for breeding

loans.name: Dyala

texts.en:
Dyala is a 21-year-old lady from Al Haashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Dyala is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase clothes for trading purposes. 

Dyala is looking to open a shop to sell her products in.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for trading purposes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 47 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, where she raises and sells chickens. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for resale and will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her business. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up more structures for poultry.

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa del Carmen tiene 34 años de edad,  es una madre trabajadora que junto a su esposo a sacado a sus hijos adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Rosa es una mujer emprendedora que con el apoyo de su esposo a emprendido su propio negocio que es un taller de reparación de bicicleta, esto inicio para poder generar ingresos para la familia.  Este negocio de repacion de bicicleta es muy utilizado por sus cliente por lo tanto necesita tener variedad de producto para brindarle  un buen servicio. Rosa  está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar capital trabajo que es lo principal dentro del negocio los cuales comprara son: cadenas, llantas, pedales, zetas, parches, marcos de bicicletas  entre otros.
texts.en: Rosa del Carmen is 34 years old. She is a hard-working mother, who together with her husband has expended great effort to help her children get ahead. Rosa is an entrepreneurial woman who with her husband's support has started her own business, a bicycle repair shop. She started it so she could generate income for the family. This bicycle repair business is visited often by its customers, and because of this, she needs to have a variety of products so she can offer them good service. Rosa is requesting a loan to use for working capital, the most important need for her business. The items she will buy are chains, tires, pedals, seats, repair patches, and bicycle frames, among others.

loans.use: to buy chains, tires, pedals, seats, repair patches, and bicycle frames, among other items.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra.  Eugenia esta casada con  el señor Jorge y viven la ciudad de La Paz tienen  dos hijos que están en la edad  escolar, la cliente vende comida  y su esposo trabaja  en la   en una empresa publica,  juntos trabajan sacrificadamente  para salir adelante   y de esta manera lograr sus objetivos que tienen en la familia el crédito  que solicito lo invertirá en la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de la casa donde viven ya que se acerca la época de lluvia y desea pronto refaccionar su casa, la Sra. Eugenia se siente feliz por ser beneficiado con el crédito, ya que con este crédito la  Sra. brindara mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia is married to Jorge, and they live in the city of La Paz. They have two school-age children.

Eugenia sells food, and her husband works for a public agency. They both work hard and make sacrifices to get ahead and to achieve the family's goals.

She will use the loan she asked for to buy construction materials for repairs on their house because the rainy season is coming and she wants to make the repairs quickly. Eugenia is happy to have the loan because she can use it to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her home

loans.name: Chepkoech

texts.en:
Chepkoech is a resident and a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.  She is 20 years old and married with one child, age 3.  

She has been a farmer for 2 years and produces tea and milk for the local market.

Chepkoech has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to venture into poultry farming.  She wants to buy poultry birds.  She adds she will use the income to improve the livelihood of her family buy providing other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Jesukpego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Hélène Fifamey est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène Fifamey est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Hélène Fifamey a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Hélène Fifamey est mariée à un plombier du nom de Toussaint. Le couple a sept enfants dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Hélène Fifamey vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Hélène Fifamey vend depuis trois ans de la nourriture (pâte de maïs et de la sauce) à son domicile. Hélène Fifamey s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Hélène Fifamey sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUKPEGO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group JESUKPEGO is comprised of three persons who are friends. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, Hélène Fifamey, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Hélène Fifamey is 52 years old and lives in Benin. She halted her studies in primary school. She is married to a plumber named Toussaint. They have seven children, some of whom are in school. Three of the children remain in their care. Hélène Fifamey lives together with her husband and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To cover the various family expenses, Hélène Fifamey has been selling food (cornmeal mash and sauces) for three years out of her home. Her supplies come from a city in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customer and to increase her sales and her income, Hélène Fifamey and the other members of the group JESUKPEGO are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and some sauce condiments

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a father of one and has been in active farming for 4 consecutive years in Kitale, in western Kenya.  His farm currently produces tomatoes, maize, beans and milk with the help of one farmhand.  Timothy is aged 38.

Timothy has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhdi Kilimo to help him set up a greenhouse where he will grow tomatoes. He says the greenhouse will enable him to produce quality product and more than double his farming income due to all-seasons production.  He adds the improved income will ensure his family is financially secure.

Timothy however lists lack of capital, high cost of production due to costly outputs and low market prices as some of his major challenges.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse where he will grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 55, has been in farming for 12 solid years within her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is married with 5 children of whom four are in school.

Gladys has requested a loan of 50,000 KES.  She intends to use 20,000 KES to construct a dairy cow's pen and the remaining 30,000 KES to boost her milk retail business by buying milk container cooling equipment to ensure that no waste is incurred and that no milk goes bad before delivery to the market.

Gladys laments of poor roads network and high costs of inputs.

loans.use: To construct cow pen and to buy milk cooling containers.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca, 25, is married with 4 children.  Two attend school.  She has been a farmer for 8 years and produces maize, milk and beans for the local market.

Jesca has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to venture into the poultry business.  She says the poultry business has good markets almost all year, unlike other farming businesses.  She adds poultry business is not influenced by insufficient rainfalls, like other farming businesses.

She however notes the lack of rainfall and high costs of inputs as major challenges to farmers.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Philice

texts.en:
Philice has been in active farming for two years and she produces maize, beans and milk. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of two and nine.  Two attend school.

Philice has requested a loan of 41,600 KES, with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says this will improve her farming income and help her uplift her business.  She adds the experience she has in the dairy industry will help ensure that her business runs with minimal costs.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is the father of one child, age 5, and has been in mixed farming for three years. He produces tomatoes, maize, and milk for the local market. To earn additional income, he also runs an entertainment joint with pool table games and a retail shop.

Andrew has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. The acquisition of an additional dairy cow will boost his farming income and enable him to acquire more land, which has been a limitation for him to achieve the farming volume he wants.

He notes unreliable rains and high costs of inputs as additional challenges to farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is aged 42 and married with 2 children aged 23 and 18, both still schooling. He has been in mixed farming for 20 years and currently runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He produces coffee, tea, bananas and milk, which he sells within the local markets.

Michael has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy a chuff cutter, which he says will help ease the feeding and reduce the waste on dairy feeds. He will also add another dairy cow to help him enjoy the economies of scale. He adds that the two acquisitions will definitely boost his farming income.

He laments the difficulties encountered in accessing capital and the high interest rate charged by financial institutions, which add to the challenge posed by insufficient rains and animal diseases.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana integrante del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Se dedica a la preparación de churrascas (masa de pan, pero cocinado en una parrilla), además prepara colaciones para almorzar, las cuales consisten en ensaladas con carne, atún o pollo. 
Trabaja en la producción de comidas, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que la preparación de la masa la realiza en la cocina de su casa y las vende en un carro que habilitó con una parrilla y un mesón. Su horario de trabajo es de 5ºº a 9ºº de la tarde, cuenta con un buen número de clientes, ya que su puesto lo ubica cerca de la calle, por lo que aprovecha esta situación de concurrencia peatonal, facilitándole sus ventas.
Con el crédito comprará los insumos para su producción de alimentos, entre harina y carbón.
Una de sus metas a largo plazo, es instaurar su negocio en un local establecido e instalarse con una amasandería.
Susana vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad, ambos estudian y le ayudan a su madre en la instalación de su carro y también venden colaciones en sus respectivos lugares de estudio. 
Su sueño a nivel personal es estudiar la carrera de cocina internacional, ya que le gustaría perfeccionarse en su negocio.
Una de las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se debe a que le proporciona cierta independencia económica.
Susana está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio, además comenta que aprovechado todas las instancias de capacitaciones, por lo que se siente también muy motivada. Por otro lado, el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y comprometido.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Susana is a member of the "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" (Walking Toward the Future) communal bank in the city of Talca.

She makes churrascas (a type of tortilla cooked on a grill). She also makes light meals for lunch; these are salads with beef, tuna or chicken. She has been working in food production for three years. Susana says that she makes the dough in her kitchen at home, and she sells the churrascas from a cart that she fitted with a grill and a counter. Her daily schedule is from 5:00 until 9:00 in the evening, and she has a good number of customers since she places her stand near the street. She can therefore take advantage of the pedestrian traffic, which makes it easier to make sales.

She will use the loan to buy food production supplies, including flour and charcoal. One of Susana's long-term goals is to move her business into a local shop and set up a bakery.

Susana lives with her husband and their two children, who are 18 and 19 years old. Both children attend school and help their mother with her cart. The children also sell lunches at their respective schools.

Susana's dream for herself is to study international cooking since she would like to perfect her work. One of her motivations to continue with the business is that it gives her a certain amount of economic independence.

Susana is very happy and grateful for the support from Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. She also says that she attended all the training sessions, and because of them she also feels very motivated. The communal bank that she is part of is also very united and committed.

Talca is in the Maule region, which is located in the center of the country. It is the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, so it is the most important city in Chile's Central Valley. In Chile there is a curious reference to Talca in the phrase "Talca, Paris and London". Some of the stories about this saying state that it comes from a statement originally made by an Englishman, "Talca parece Londres" (Talca looks like London) because of the abundant cloud cover that is frequently over the city in winter, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour and charcoal for making foods.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda es una mujer de 62 años, que después de haber salido pensionada de una empresa se dedicó al negocio de confecciones en el año 2003, oficio que aprendió desde sus 16 años de edad y despues cuando trabajó de operaria, en una importante empresa de ropa masculina. En su taller elabora toda clase de prendas de vestir, especialmente ropa industrial y en cada época diseños especiales como los disfraces del carnaval; sus principales clientes son empleados, empreas, vecinos   En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, correderas e insumos de confección, para responder a solicitudes de conjuntos de blusa y pantalón femenino, multiusos, y juegos de ropa de cama, con diseños de la época navideña. Lo cual hace que esta inversión sea exitosa y que garantice la ampliación de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda is 62 years old. After retiring with pension, she opened a tailoring business in 2003. Hilda learned to sew when she was 16, and later worked as a textiles worker in a major men's clothing factory. 

She makes a variety of clothing in her workshop, including industrial uniforms and seasonal clothing like Carnaval costumes. Her customers are industrial workers, businesses, and neighbors. 

Hilda is currently applying for a loan from Kiva. It will be her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy fabric, spools, and sewing supplies that she will need to fulfill customer orders for matching women's blouses and slacks, multipurpose uniforms, and Christmas-themed bed linens. She hopes this investment will be profitable and expand her working capital.

loans.use: To buy fabric, spools, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ovidio Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Ovidio  tiene como actividad la de artesano en construcción de botes, ya que  los botes que fabrica los realiza de madera y de forma manual, estos botes los vende para ser utilizados  para la navegación en el lago Titicaca, esta trabajo lo realiza juntamente con su esposa, juntos realizan diferentes trabajos, el momento de la visita se encontraba pintando el barco, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de madera para cubrir la demanda actual que tiene ya que en época de vacaciones mucha gente se va al lago y las personas que trabajan con estos botes tienen mucha demanda y le piden al Sr. Ovidio que fabrique estos botes en cantidad, el Sr. Ovidio es una persona muy trabajadora, por su experiencia realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad.
texts.en: Ovidio makes a living building hand-made wooden boats. He sells these boats for use on Lake Titicaca. He does the work alongside his wife, doing different tasks. At the time of the picture he was painting a boat. This business is the main source of income for Ovidio and his wife, and they are requesting the loan to purchase wood so they can meet their current demand. During the vacation season a lot of people go to the lake, and the people who make these boats are in demand, so Ovidio is asked to build boats in bulk. Ovidio is a hard-working person and thanks to his experience he produces high-quality work.

loans.use: to purchase wood to build boats.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Eugenia trabaja como técnico en operaciones en una empresa de comunicaciones de la ciudad de La Paz.  El crédito lo requiere para el pago de estudios de música de su hijo.  Maria Eugenia  es divorciada y tiene cuatro   hijos.  Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  de Callampaya  de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito en una entidad financiera y al enterarse del programa de Kiva, ella desea que su solicitud de crédito sea evaluada y financiada a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Eugenia works as an operations technician for a communications company in the city of La Paz. The loan she is requesting will pay for her son’s musical studies. Maria Eugenia is divorced and has four children. She lives at her parents’ home in the District of Callampaya in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from a financial institution and participated in the Kiva program. She wants her loan request to be evaluated and funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's musical studies.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is from Samtredia. He is 50 years old, married and lives with his family: wife – Iamze and two daughters (25 and 21 years old). Gia works as a construction worker in the village. Iamze leads the agricultural business of the family: a dairy farm with two cows and one calf. Iamze produces cheese and sells it locally to dairy product retailers. 

Gia requested credit for purchasing construction materials for expansion of the cattle-shed. After the family has a bigger cattle-shed, they won’t sell calves and will raise them to have more milk for dairy production. It will increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed expansion.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es: Prudencia, es una mujer trabajadora de 57 años, vive en compañía de su hija en su casa propia; ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde hace 40 años, se mostró independiente, pues la agricultura actividad que desempeñó desde niña, fue la mejor manera de generar ingresos. Las tierras de cultivo que heredo de sus padres le sirvieron para sembrar papa, maíz, trigo, arveja, cebolla que  luego de pasar por el tiempo de su cosecha, los vende al por mayor o lo lleva al mercado. “Depende si el precio es bueno”, afirma, además comenta que su hija es la que siempre le ayuda en calcular las ganancias y en todo lo que se requiera para la siembra y la cosecha. Pero como a no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes, contrata peones para los trabajos que requieren de esfuerzo físico, adicionado a esto también cría animales que compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad. En su granja tiene toros, ovejas y cerdos. Con las ganancias puede alimentarse hasta la espera de la nueva cosecha. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Prudencia, de recibir su apoyo. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra más ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en: Prudencia is 57 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives with her daughter in her own home, located in Huachac.  For 40 years she has supported herself, and she has worked in agriculture ever since she was a young girl.  It was the best way to earn a living.  The farm land she inherited from her parents served her for farming potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, and onions, that she sells in bulk or takes to the market to sell.  "It depends on if the price is good", she says, and also added that her daughter helps her calculate the earnings and everything required for planting and harvesting.  But since she is not as strong as she used to be, she hires laborers for the jobs that require physical effort.  In addition to this, she also raises animals that she buys and sells every weekend at the local livestock market.  On her farm she has bulls, sheep, and pigs.  With her earnings she can feed them until they are about ready to harvest again.  She belongs to the Little Bees community group, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is happy to be part of her community bank because its members are responsible people who show a lot of solidarity.  For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments.  Prudencia will invest the loan money in the purchase of sheep to have more livestock.

loans.use: buy more sheep

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza de 63 años, es una mujer valerosa, pues hace algunos años enviudó y vive con una de sus hijas y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia; ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. A pesar de su avanzada edad, ella continúa trabajando por el bienestar de su familia. Durante toda su vida se dedicó a la siembra y cosecha de papa y maíz, estos productos los lleva a la ciudad más cercana a su zona; con la finalidad de vender al por mayor y menor  de acuerdo a las oportunidades que se le presenten, de esta manera tiene los recursos que necesita. Pero paralelo a esto cría pollos y tiene algunas ovejas en su granja, que todos los días atiende y los fines de semana los vende  a sus vecinos que solicitan siempre, en especial sus pollos. Conocen que ella los cría con mucha dedicación y cuidado en su alimentación y eso es un punto a su favor, por ello tiene clientes fijos. Desea seguir dedicándose a las tareas agrícolas  hasta donde sigan dando sus fuerzas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “abejitas” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta de  ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Eliza, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su sembrío de papa.
texts.en: Eliza, 63, is a courageous woman who became a widow some years ago. She lives with one of her daughters and two grandchildren in her own home in the town of Huachac. Despite her advanced age she continues to work for the well-being of her family. She has made a living all her life on planting and harvesting potatoes and corn, products she takes to the nearest city to sell at wholesale and retail depending on the opportunities that present themselves. In this way she makes what she needs to get by. Along with this work she also raises chickens and a few sheep on her farm, animals she tends to every day. On the weekends she sells the livestock, especially the chickens, to her neighbors, who are always requesting them. They know Eliza tends to her animals with a lot of dedication and care and feeds them well, so she has regular customers. She wants to keep making a living in agriculture as long as she can. She belongs to the "Abejitas" ("Bees") group, and this is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She feels content to be part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and stick together, so she promises to make her payments on time. Eliza plans to use the loan to purchase natural fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maudiel Marina

texts.es: Maudiel Marina tiene 27 años de edad,  su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos lo cual no tiene mucha competencia, ya que en su zona no hay muchas personas que se dediquen  a estén  tipo de negocio, por lo que este negocio le ha sido muy factible y tener ingresos para la familia. Maudiel tiene el apoyo de su esposo que es cadete de moto taxis de la zona este tipo de trabajo genera poco ingresos, pero ambos luchan para sacar a su familia adelante. Maudiel está solicitando crédito para poder abastecerse de cerdos y por tener producto para esta temporada que es muy buena.
texts.en:
Maudiel Marina is 27 years old. Her business involves butchering pigs. She does not have much competition since there are not many people in her area who engage in this type of business. Therefore, her business is feasible and allows her to generate income for her family. Maudiel has the support of her husband who works as a motorcycle taxi driver in the area. However, this type of work generates little income. Both of them strive to move their family forward.

Maudiel is requesting a loan to acquire pigs so that she will have product on hand since this season is very good.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 54 years old. He lives in the village of Chagan-Chkvishi, West Georgia. Mamuka is married and lives with his family: wife – Leila, a 14-year-old daughter, mother (retired) and younger sister. Leila works as teacher in the village. Mamuka is leading the agricultural business of the family. They have five milk cows and ten calves. The family sells dairy products at the local market. Also they have two pigs and sell, on average, 20 piglets per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pension of Mamuka’s mother.

Mamuka requested credit for construction of a new cattle-shed, as the old one is almost ruined, as it was old. The new cattle-shed will be bigger and Mamuka will be able to raise more calves instead of selling them, in order to increase the amount of milk cows in the farm. The family will get more milk and sell more dairy products. It will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed construction.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor de 47 años, es una mujer valiente. Hace poco enviudó y sola cuidó de sus 3 hijos, a los que todos los días alimenta en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Huachac. Desde que sufrió la pérdida de su esposo tubo que afrontar las responsabilidades del hogar junto a sus hijos, que en ese entonces eran unos niños y con el tiempo han solidificado sus esfuerzos, tanto así que hoy tiene varias cabezas de ganado vacuno y ovino a parte de ello cuenta con algunos terrenos donde cultiva hortalizas, papa y quinua, los cuales después de cada cosecha, vende muy bien. Cuenta que algunas verduras más las que le compra a sus vecinos, los ofrece a la capital del país. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es revisar que sus terrenos de cultivo  estén con sus plantaciones saludables, ya que esto garantiza una buena cosecha  y por consiguiente buenas ganancias, lo que cosecha lo llevara en los próximos meses al mercado de su ciudad.
