loans.use: to buy root crops and vegetables

loans.name: Rosmery Susan

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Rosmery; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía como chompas, guantes, chalinas, y hace unos meses ella realiza muñecas de trapo, llamitas, osos con lana de alpaca, la socia esta exportando a paises como Inglaterra, España y desea seguir creciendo la socia tiene su pagina web y mediante este medio ha publicado sus trabajos y le compran los clientes que desean adquirir uno de sus trabajos, la socia tambien trabaja con su conyugue y amiga en la fabricación de busos, pantalones entre otros. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la confeccion y elaboracion de las muñecas de trapo y de los ositos y llamas, a la socia tambien le gustaria invertir el credito en la compra d euna maquina recubridora.
texts.en:
The member is Rosmery.  She continues to buy and sell handmade sweaters, gloves, and scarves.  A few months ago she also began making ​​rag dolls, toy llamas, and teddy bears with alpaca wool.  She is exporting her products to countries like England and Spain and would like to continue growing her business.  Rosmery has a website through which she advertises her products and through which clients can purchase her goods.  

Rosmery also works with her spouse and friend in the manufacture of pullovers, pants and more.  She wants to invest in the purchase of materials for making rag dolls, teddy bears and toy llamas.  She would also like to invest in a specialized sewing machine for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy materials for the manufacture of rag dolls, teddy bears and llamas on a specialized sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 46 años está casada con Custodio, hace 25 años. Con él tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo cuidan a 2, por ser menores de edad. Está familia vive en una casa propia en la provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva Central).  María es una mujer que hace de todo. A su edad continua con las fuerzas necesarias para dedicarse a ala agricultura. Gracias a la administración y organización de su comunidad ha obtenido terrenos de cultivos donde siembra café y plátanos. “La cosecha de café es buena, llevamos por sacos los granos a la cooperativa. La venta es segura”, comenta. 
Del mismo modo, cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Sus clientes son los pobladores de su comunidad, personas conocidas y fieles al negocio. Lleva pocos meses en esta actividad y asegura que le va muy bien.
A pesar de ello, no descuida sus cultivos, a los que tiene que abonar constantemente y limpiar de la mala yerba. En estas labores recibe el apoyo de su esposo y si el trabajo es intenso tiene que contratar personal para agilizarlo. Ella ansía ampliar su producción de café, por la rentabilidad. Así, más adelante piensa adquirir terrenos, ya sea mediante compras o arrendamientos. Con su ayuda, ella accedería a su préstamo número 5 de MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el  pago de las cuotas. “Aroma de café”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente satisfecho por el trabajo desplegado.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos y productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de abarrotes y otro porcentaje lo destinará al pago de personal para limpiar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old and has been married to Custodio for 25 years. Together they have 7 children, of whom only 2 are still underage and in their care. This family lives in their own house in the province of Chanchamayo (in the central jungle).  María is a woman who does everything. At her age, she still has the necessary energy to work in agriculture. Thanks to the management and organization of her community, she has obtained farmland where she grows coffee and plantains. "The coffee harvest is good, and we take the beans in sacks to the cooperative. The sale is assured," she comments. 

At the same time, she also has a business selling groceries and basic necessities. Her customers are the inhabitants of her community: people she knows, who are loyal to the business. She has done this work for just a few months, and she states that it is going very well for her. 

In spite of this work, she does not neglect her crops, which she has to fertilize constantly as well as removing weeds. In this work, she receives support from her husband, and if the work is intense, she has to hire workers to make it easier. She wants to expand her coffee production because of its profitability. Thus, in the future, she would like to acquire more land, either through purchase or rental. With your help, she will take out her 5th loan with MFP. She gives her word that she will be punctual with her payments. "Aroma de café” ["Aroma of Coffee"] is the name of her communal bank, and she feels satisfied with the work it carries out.

She will invest the money in buying supplies and basic products to stock her store, and will also use a percentage of it to pay workers to clean up her fields.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Susana Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es una mujer casada, su esposo es minero y juntos tienen dos pequeños niños, uno de 3 años y el mayor de 8, todos ellos viven en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada al sur del país, lugar que disfruta a diario del Océano Pacífico, debido a que se encuentra a pocos metros de Camaná. Reyna es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que disfruta escuchar música durante sus tiempos libres; como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Reyna más disfruta es el “Lomo Saltado”.	

A Reyna le hubiese gustado estudiar para poder convertirse en una costurera, pero debido a distintas situaciones ella no pudo lograrlo y es por eso que desea que cuando sus hijos sean grandes, pueda brindarles lo necesario para que estudien lo que deseen. En la actualidad Reyna, entusiasmada por su esposo, se dedica a la venta de golosinas en una de las calles de Camaná, en donde trabaja aproximadamente 10 horas diarias, esto le permite poder tener entre 28 y 30 clientes a su vez esto le genera un ingreso diario de S/.50 y si hay mayor afluencia de público ella puede ganar hasta S/.70. Ella piensa que tiene buen número de clientes porque brinda un buen trato a sus clientes y es muy rápida en la atención de los pedidos.

Gracias al préstamo Kiva, Reyna podrá comprar más golosinas a un menor precio y una mayor variedad de sus productos. Ella piensa que esta oportunidad la ayudará mucho ya que sus clientes siempre están solicitándole más y nuevos productos. Con el incremento que logre en sus ventas desea poder comprarse otro triciclo y también llenarlo de golosinas para sus ventas, esta idea de negocio le permitirá poder generar los ingresos necesarios para poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna is married with two children, ages three and eight. Her husband is a miner. They live together in the city of Camaná, located in the south of the country. This region is blessed by the Pacific Ocean, which is quite close to Camaná. Reyna is a hard-working woman who enjoys listening to music in her free time. It is well-known that Peru has the most delicious food in the world, and one of Reyna's favourite dishes is "Lomo Saltado".
Reyna would have liked to study and become a seamstress, but due to a series of events she was unable to do so. For this reason, she wants to be able to offer her children everything they need so that they can study whatever they want. Reyna, thanks to her husband's encouragement, sells candy on one of the streets of Camaná. She works approximately ten hours a day, and she has about 28 to 30 customers a day. This generates her a daily income of 50 Nuevo Soles. If there are more people around she might earn up to 70 Nuevo Soles. She feels that she has a good customer base because she treats them well and she provides fast service.
Thanks to this loan from Kiva, Reyna will be able to buy more candy at a better price, and have a greater variety of products. She thinks that this opportunity will help her greatly, since her customers are always asking for more products and for new products. With this increase in her sales, she wants to buy another stall to fill with candy for sale. This will allow her to generate the necessary income in order to buy a plot of land to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy candies to sell.

loans.name: Heidi Patricia

texts.es:
Heidi es una joven microempresaria de 33 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años es cliente de nuestra institución,y ha adquirido varios préstamos que le han servido en el desarollo de su actividad. Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar un vehículo que le permite llevar su mercadería hasta sus clientes , teniendo más facilidades para movilizarse y llevar  la mercadería que distribuye:ropa, tennis,perfumes, y otros articulos para las necesidades de sus clientes.
 Generalmente en sus viajes la acompaña su pequeña hija de tres años, y de esta forma no tiene que dejarla al cuidado de otras personas,aunque el proximo año podrá matricularla en el kinder y así estarán más cómodas y felices en sus ocupaciones, y Heidi tendrá más facilidad para hacer su trabajo. Su hijo mayor también la ayuda mucho cuando no tiene que ir a la escuela, pues sale con ella , y lleva la mercadería a los clientes y realiza los cobros , bajo la supervisión de su mamá.
 Junto a sus hijos y su esposo, Heidi se ha estado desarrollando como una mujer empresaria , muy trabajadora y esforzada, espera poder tener su casa propia y que su negocio siga creciendo para beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Heidi is a young 33-year-old entrepreneur. She is married with two children.
She has been a client of our institution for eight years, and has taken out several loans which have helped her to develop her business. With her previous loan, she was able to buy a vehicle for transporting her merchandise to her customers. This gave her more mobility for transporting her merchandise: clothing, tennis shoes, perfume, and other items to cover her customers' needs.
Her little three-year-old daughter normally goes with her on her trips. This way, Heidi doesn't have to leave her in someone else's care. Next year, her daughter will be in kindergarten; this will make it easier for both of them. Heidi's oldest son helps out a lot when he doesn't have school. He goes with her, brings merchandise to the customers, and takes payments under his mother's supervision.
Along with her husband and children, Heidi has been growing as a businesswoman. She is very hard-working. In the future she hopes to have her own home, and she hopes that her business will continue to grow for the benefit of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as tennis shoes, perfume, clothing and other personal care items.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Maritza es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” grupo conformado por 12 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales. Maritza tiene 44 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos ya que están en etapa escolar, ella cuenta  con un negocio la cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en la elaboración de joyas donde llevan más de 03 años, este negocio nació a raíz que su esposo había aprendió las técnicas para elaborar joyas, ya que trabajaba ayudando a dichas elaboraciones, pues con los deseos de contar con un negocio propio iniciaron, actualmente importan sus productos a distintas provincias del Perú, gracias a  su negocio a podido mejorar su vivienda y brindarles educación a sus hijos. A futuro a Maritza le gustaría instalar en su vivienda una bodega donde ofrezca productos de primera necesidad. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando plata por mayor  y así poder entregar sus pedidos a tiempo. La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” están muy agradecidos con el crédito brindado.  María, Elsa y Elide  no pudieron estar presentes por motivo de trabajo,  adjuntamos la fotografía de Isabel.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the "Gotitas de Amor" ["Little Drops of Love"] Communal Bank. The Bank's 12 members have various jobs. Maritza is 44, married, and has four children, two of whom she still supports as they are school-aged. She has a business where she works with her husband, making jewellery. They have been doing this for over three years. They were able to start this business because her husband learned jewellery-making techniques in a previous job. They wanted to have their own business, and now they import their products from all over Peru. Thanks to this business they have been able to improve their home and offer their children an education. In the future, Maritza would like to open a store in their home in order to sell basic staples. She requested this loan for investing in her business, buying silver wholesale in order to complete their orders on time. The "Gotitas de Amor" Communal Bank members are grateful for this loan.
María, Elsa and Elide were not able to be present because of work commitments. Isabel's photo has been inserted.

loans.use: to buy silver.

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en: Samiah is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of five children. Samiah trades in perfumes and makeup. She is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase perfumes and makeup products for trading purposes. Samiah is operating from her home and she is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can expand her consumer base.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and makeup products for trading purposes

loans.name: Elena Mercedes

texts.es: Elena con su credikiva,  compró telas e insumos y fabricó camisas blancas y elegantes que tenia encargadas, para que sus clientes asistieran a las fiestas programadas.  A ella le fue y bien porque vendió y reinvirtió, su desafío ahora,  es lograr tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder  a los pedidos de su clientela en las fiestas de Diciembre, pues ellos están en fila y Elena, programándose para hacer la compra de materias primas e insumos con su nuevo credikiva,  al que esta aplicando nuevamente, pues sabe que si invierte en los pedidos de sus clientes, como lo planea,   su negocio tendrá mas éxito.  El mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Son buenos los créditos , sigan prestando para poder seguir trabajando con plata mas cómoda. Muchas gracias “
texts.en: Elena used her previous Kiva loan to buy fabric and tools. With them, she made elegant white shirts which her customers had ordered for upcoming festivities. It went well for her, because she was able to sell and re-invest. Her challenge now is to have enough working capital to respond to her customers' orders during the December holiday season. They are lining up, so Elena plans to buy basic materials and tools with this new Kiva loan. She knows that, if she invests in her customers' orders as planned, her business will be more successful. She has the following message for Kiva lenders: "These loans are good. Please keep lending so that we can keep working with funds more easily. Thank you very much."

loans.use: to buy basic materials and tools

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia de 21 años, es una madre joven de 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Ella vive con Armando, su pareja y padre de sus hijos, en una casa propia en la localidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo (selva central). A Katia le gusta el trabajo del campo, que aprendió gracias a la convivencia con sus padres y suegros. De esta manera cuenta con una parcela de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra café hace 4 años. La venta de café es buena en los meses de abril, mayo, junio y julio ya que los precios llegan a costar 1 sol y 80 céntimos (precio mayor). Pero requiere de muchos cuidados y constante abonamiento de fertilizantes. En esta tarea la ayudan operarios a quienes contrata al día, o sino su pareja, siempre y cuando esté en la localidad. Por motivos de trabajo, Armando se encuentra en la ciudad de Lima como empleado de una fábrica de cuadernos, sin embargo siempre regresa a su ciudad natal para ver y atender a su familia. Le gustaría continuar trabajando con la venta de café, y si hay suerte más adelante irse a vivir a la ciudad capital del país, junto a su pareja e hijos, por la mejor educación y acceso a servicios. Animada por sus amigos, Katia ingresa al banco comunal “Aroma de café”, por eso, éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP. Afirma su puntualidad y exactitud en los pagos de las cuotas. Agradece por anticipado su apoyo.
De obtener el crédito, ella podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de café, así como para el pago de personal.
texts.en:
Katia, age 21, is the young mother of two children ages 2 and 4. She lives with Armando (her partner and the father of her children) in their own home in Santa Rosa de Palomar, in the San Luis de Shuaro district, Chanchamayo province (Selva Central). Katia enjoys working in the fields. She learned this work from her parents and in-laws. She has her own plots of land where she has sown coffee for four years. Coffee sales are good in April, May, June and July, because coffee hits its best price at this time: 1 sol and 80 cents. However, coffee crops require a lot of care and constant fertilizing. Katia hires workers by the day to help her with this work, or else her partner helps her whenever he is around. Armando is employed in the city of Lima in a notebook factory, but he always goes back to the city of his birth in order to see and care for his family. He would enjoy continuing to work selling coffee, and with luck in the future he would like to live in the capital city with his family so that they can have better access to services and education.
Katia joined the "Aroma de Cafe" communal bank at the encouragement of friends. This will be her first loan with MFP. She says she will be punctual and precise in the payments of her quotas. She thanks you in advance for your support.
Upon receiving this loan, she will buy bags of fertilizer for her coffee crops and pay for labourers.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and to hire labourers.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Maritza; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de pan, la socia elabora diferentes panes y los vende en la plaza principal del poblado aprovechando la llegada y parada de los buses, combis y autos particulares que descanzan para seguir el camino a las ciudades de Arequipa, Puno, Puerto Maldonado. La socia desea invertir el credito en la compra de insumos para elborar los diferentes panes.
texts.en: This borrower is Maritza. She is continuing with her business of selling bread. She makes various kinds of bread and sells them in the main plaza of her town. She takes advantage of the fact that buses, vans and private cars arrive and stop there before they continue on the roadway to the cities of Arequipa, Puno, and Puerto Maldonado. She would like to invest the loan in buying supplies to prepare the various kinds of bread she makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make various kinds of bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a television for her room

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha is a 29-year-old single woman from Madaba, Jordan. She sells clothes and accessories. Sabha is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian dinars to purchase clothes and accessories for trading purposes. Sabha is looking to expand her project and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and accessories for trading purposes

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; continua con sus terrenos de cultivo, le socio también continua con su consultorio naturista y desearia poder ampliar el local y poner vitrinas para la exhibicion de los productos alternos que vende de la linea omnilife, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos naturales y los batidos de la misma linea.
texts.en: The member, Feliciano, continues with his farming.  He also continues with his natural products consultancy and wants to be able to expand his place and install display cases to show the alternative products he sells from Omnilife.  This time he wants to invest the loan in buying natural products and shakes of the same brand.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife natural products and shakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años, hace 5 años unió su vida a Medalit, la madre se sus 2 hijos Jean y Manuel. Wilfredo y su familia viven en la casa de su madre, en la localidad de Alto Sanchirio, en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Trabajador y constante, Wilfredo se dedica a la agricultura. En sus 3 parcelas de terrenos productivos tiene sembrado café y plátanos. Las faenas en la selva son intensas, ya que las malas yerbas crecen con rapidez, es así que tiene que limpiar constantemente sus sembríos. De igual manera, el abonamiento lo hace 4 veces al año, llegando a invertir como 1000 soles en cada fertilización. Wilfredo ama su trabajo. Desde pequeño aprendió a desenvolverse muy bien en el campo. Ya lleva más de 10 años en esta actividad y ha tenido que afrontar problemas como las plagas, el mal tiempo y la baja de precios. Pero aún así continúa laborando. Deja atendidos sus cultivos para luego hacer los viveros de café, de los que gana como 400 a 500 por millar. Wilfredo es un hombre incansable. En sus ratos libres hace labores de carpintería como pulir maderas, y ayudante en construcciones. Es así, que piensa adquirir un carro de segunda mano para movilizarse desde su localidad hasta la ciudad de La Merced. Éste sería su préstamo número 5, que obtendrá de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente contento y satisfecho con su banco comunal “Aroma de café”. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para la elaboración de viveros de café.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old. Five years ago he joined his life with Medalit, the mother of his two children, Jean and Manuel. Wilfredo and his family live in his mother’s house, in the town of Alto Sanchirio, in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, in the province of Chanchamayo. 

He works arduously in the field of agriculture. On his three parcels of productive lands he has planted coffee and bananas. The chores in the jungle are intense, as weeds grow rapidly, and so you have to constantly clear the sown fields. He also has to fertilize four times a year, spending 1,000 soles each time. 

Wilfredo loves his work. From the time he was young he learned to get around in the field. He has more than ten years in this activity and he has faced problems such as pests, bad weather and low prices. But even so he continues working. He is clearing out the tended crops so that later he can make a coffee nursery, which earns 400 to 500 per thousand.

Wilfredo is a tireless man. In his free time he does carpentry work such as burnishing wood and helping out in construction work. So, he is thinking of getting a secondhand car so he can get about from his town to La Merced.

This will be his fifth loan through MFP. He promises to be punctual in his monthly payments. He feels happy and satisfied with the communal bank Aroma de Café. He will use the money from the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizers for the preparation of coffee nurseries.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is a 41-year-old divorced woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan. Nidaa started her business by packaging Dead Sea clay and minerals in amazing packages made by her. Dead Sea is the lowest area in the world and the sea is full of minerals and clay which help in healing many skin and bone issues. Then Nidaa expanded her business to include making mosaics to meet the demand of the market.

Nidaa is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian dinars to purchase materials needed for her packaging and mosaics business, such as 
clay, fabrics, etc. Nidaa is looking to customize a room in her home so that she can display all her products together. She hopes to then open a shop as a second step.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sack of sugar and bags of beans.

loans.name: Maria Derlis

texts.es: La señora Maria Derlis a sus 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos tales como papelería, accesorios femeninos y ropa en una vitrina que tiene ubicada en la sala de su casa y que le genera los ingresos mínimos para el sostenimiento propio y el de su hijo de 11 años de edad. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas, la señora Maria Derlis desea comprar útiles escolares y ropa para dama con el fin de tener surtido para las dos temporadas que podrían mejorar sus ventas. El sueño de la señora Maria Derlis es tener su propio almacén y brindarle todo lo necesario para vivir a su hijo.
texts.en: Señora Maria Derlis, age 35, sells products such as stationery, women's accessories, and clothing. She has a display case in a room in her home. This generates her a small income which covers her needs and those of her 11-year-old child. In the hopes of improving her sales, Maria Derlis wants to buy school supplies and women's clothing in order to have stock for the two seasons which could improve her sales. Maria Derlis' dream is to have her own store and to offer her child all the necessities.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, decorations, and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy passion fruits for resale.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 49-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Huda is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance on her home with an aspiration to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her home

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 48 años, hace 8 años formó su familia, junto a Eugenia. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Carlos y Carla a los que crían bajo el seno de un hogar propio, en la comunidad de Santa Rosa Palomar en la provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva central). La agricultura es su forma de vivir, por que le gusta trabajar en el campo. De niño aprendió esta labor gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Cuenta con parcelas de tierras de cultivos en los que siembra café, plátanos y paltas. En todo este tiempo tuvo que afrontar problemas como: las plagas, la baja de precios de los productos, falta de personal humano. Carlos es un padre admirable. Por motivos de trabajo, Eugenia tuvo que partir a la ciudad de Lima, por esa razón se dedica a la crianza y alimentación de sus hijos. Carlos cocina, lava y como si fuera poco también trabaja en el campo. Con la ayuda de personal operario, a quien paga por sus servicios al día, puede agilizar sus tareas agrícolas. Sus ventas son considerables en los meses de mayo y junio. En esos días el precio del café llega a costar a 1 sol y 50 céntimos (precio más alto), siendo muy beneficioso para él y su familia. Carlos ansía comprarse un carro. Con el vehículo ahorrará gastos en transporte de sus productos y de su persona. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue antes. A su vez, siente satisfacción de integrar el grupo comunal “Aroma de café”, por el trabajo en equipo.
Carlos invertirá el dinero en el pago de personal para la poda de sus plantaciones y adquirir nuevos viveros de café para una próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos is 48. He and Eugenia started their family eight years ago. They have two children, Carlos and Carla, and are raising them in their own home. The live in the community of Santa Rosa Palomar, in the Chanchamayo province (Selva Central). He makes his living from agriculture because he enjoys working in the field. He learned this work as a child, thanks to his parents' teaching. He has his own plots of land where he sows coffee, bananas and avocado. Throughout the years, he has had to confront challenges such as plagues, low prices, and lack of labourers.
Carlos is an admirable family man. Because of her job, Eugenia had to move to the city of Lima; so Carlos takes care of the children. He does all the cooking and cleaning as if it were nothing, on top of working in the fields. With the help of labourers, whom he pays by the day for their labour, he is able to speed up his agricultural chores. His sales are considerable in May and June. At that time of the year, the price of coffee is around 1 Sol and 50 cents (the highest price). This is very good for him and his family. 
Carlos really wants to buy a car. With this vehicle, he will be able to save on transportation for himself and his produce. This will be his fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual with the payments of his quotas, as he has always been. He is happy to be part of the "Aroma de Cafe" communal bank because of the group work.
Carlos will invest this loan in paying labourers to prune, and in acquiring new coffee plants for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to hire labourers and acquire coffee plants.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is 31; she is from Irbid, Jordan and a mother of three children. 

Yusra is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do maintenance for her home with an aspiration to add another room for the house along with expanding the kitchen. 

Yusra is looking to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks for her new farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of bulk rice for making porridge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Busayra

texts.en: Her first Kiva loan has helped Busayra to purchase cattle. Busayra also used the revenues from her loan to purchase seeds of tomatoes, eggplants and peppers and she was able to widen her business activities by land cultivating, which allowed her to earn about 10.000 KGS seasonally. Now she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 80.000 KGS for purchasing two bull-calves to fatten and resell.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: G.s. Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario juntos podemos está conformado por Teresa y Eliu. Ambos son personas responsables y no es su primer crédito que está  solicitado. Teresa tiene un negocio que es  una pulpera, en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece como: granos básicos, fideos, huevos, detergentes, pan, refrescos y golosinas. Con mucho empeño y dedicación quiere realizar muchos proyectos que espera en el futuro los realice. Ambos solicitan el crédito para aumentar la compra de productos para esta temporada altas donde las ventas son buenas.
texts.en: The united group "Juntos Podemos" is comprised of Teresa and Eliu. They are both responsible people and this is not the first loan that they have had. Teresa has a grocery store, and most of her customers come to buy products such as: basic grains, noodles, eggs, detergents, bread, sodas, and candy.  With much perseverance and dedication, she wants to implement many projects and hopes to do so in the future. They are both requesting the loan to increase the projects that they can buy for the high season when sales are good.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, noodles, eggs, detergents, bread, sodas, and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients that will enable her to fry in larger quantities for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more children's wear and ladies wear for sale

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania de 59 años, vive junto a Ignacio hace más de 27 años. Con él tiene 3 hijos que ya viven independientemente. Melania e Ignacio viven juntos en una casa propia en la localidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo. Hace 30 años que Melania se entregó al trabajo de campo. En todo este tiempo aprendió lo necesario para comercializar con éxito sus productos (café y plátanos). Pero ve que su sacrificio es recompensado, cuando vende a los mayoristas que visitan su zona constantemente, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Además de tener el apoyo de su esposo, quien vende pescado a los pobladores de su localidad, realizando la venta de casa en casa. Y cuando termina de repartir la mercadería, apoya en las labores del campo. Producto de su intenso trabajo ha logrado ampliar su hogar con más cuartos para hospedar a sus hijos cuando vayan a visitarla. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Melania de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café que están creciendo sin mayores dificultades.
texts.en: 59 year old Melania has lived with Ignacio for more than 27 years. They have three children who live independently. Melania and Ignacio live together in their own house in Santa Rosa de Palomar in the district of San Luis de Shuaro, in the province of Chanchamayo. Melanie began working in the fields 30 years ago. In all this time she has learnt what she needs to know to successfully sell her produce (coffee and bananas). She sees her sacrifices pay-off when she sells her goods to the wholesalers, who visit the area all the time, and she makes a good profit. She also has the support of her husband, who sells fish to door-to-door in the town. And the goods that are sold in the market are a result of her labors in the field. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to extend her house, adding more rooms for her children to stay in when they go to visit. In time, she hopes to improve her fields and plant much more coffee. She belongs to the community bank "Aroma de Café" and this is her 5th loan from MFP. She promises once again to make her repayments on time, as she has done with earlier loans. She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united. When she receives her loan, Melania will use it to buy sacks of organic fertilizer so that her coffee plants will grow without any great difficulty.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Vista Nueva Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Vista Nueva” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados con el comercio. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Alejandro quien en la foto se encuentra ubicado al final del grupo, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda y además viste una chaqueta color rojo con negro. Se dedica a prestar servicios de edición, fotografía, grabaciones e iluminación. Alejandro es dueño de una productora, la cual tiene el nombre de “AMR Producciones”. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años.
Comenta que hace poco tiempo le sustrajeron tres cámaras fotográficas profesionales, pérdida que ha sido muy compleja para la entrega de sus servicios de manera eficiente. 
El trabaja de manera independiente y subcontrata personal para desempeñar su negocio de mejor manera. Además tiene un trabajo dependiente como ejecutivo de empresa.
El crédito y dinero adicional lo utilizará para comprar una cámara fotográfica profesional, ya que le servirá para trabajar fuera de la zona.
Su horario laboral es flexible, sin embargo debe tener la disponibilidad para trabajar de lunes a domingo. 
Una de sus metas es formar nuevamente la productora, con toda su implementación.
Alejandro vive junto a su esposa e hijo de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son establecerse con su productora, esto le permitirá retomar el ritmo de vida laboral  antes del robo.
Alejandro se encuentra agradecido de la oportunidad que le brindó Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio, esto le permitirá concretar sus proyectos también. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que se siente muy cómodo, ya que son muy organizados y las reuniones son muy buenas.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "vista Nueva" and it is comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different types of business. They all live in the city of Puerto Montt.
Alejandro is at the back of the group in the photo in the first place if you look from right to left and is wearing a red and black jacket. He offers services in publishing, photography, recording, and lighting. He has his own production company called "AMR Productions". He has been doing this for 10 years.
He says that he recently had three professional cameras stolen from him, and this loss has made it very difficult for him to deliver his services efficiently.
He works for himself and subcontracts so that his business operates in the best way. He also has a job as a company executive. 
He will use the loan and additional money to buy a professional camera that will enable him to work outside the area.
His work timetable is flexible but he has to be available to work Monday through Sunday.
One of his goals is to set-up a new production company.
Alejandro lives with his wife and 8 year old son. His goal is to establish his production company, and this would allow him to get back to how things were before the robbery.
Alejandro is grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in his business, and this will help him to make his projects real. He says he feels very comfortable with the loan group he is a part of as they are very organized and the meetings are good. 
Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green countryside, its quiet beaches, its food, and especially the reputation of its fish, seafood, and crafts. It is also the port for reaching Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in tradition and legends.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera for his work outside the area.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sonia de 42 años, es conviviente y tienes 3 hijos los cuales aún son dependientes. Tiene 3 años siendo cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, tales como gaseosa, cerveza, arroz, lejía, detergentes, etc.; lleva 10 años en este negocio al cual le puso el nombre de “Bodega Ivonne” y que comenzó con el sueño de poder abrir su negocio propio para así solventar sus necesidades. 
Con su esfuerzo y trabajo también ha podido abrir un local de alquiler de cabinas de Internet el cual tiene 3 años. 
Actualmente sus ingresos los destina a los gastos de alimentación y una parte a capital de trabajo, mientras que su pareja cubre los gastos de agua y luz. Su plan a futuro es terminar de construir su casa en donde pueda alquilar habitaciones. 
la Sra. Sonia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Mujeres de Éxito” con el cual lleva 1 año y 4 meses como socia y 8 meses como presidenta del grupo el cual está conformado por 7 personas. 
Piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de mercaderia ya que en estas fechas sus ventas se incrementan por campaña navideña y año nuevo.
texts.en: Sonia, 42, lives with her husband and 3 dependent children. She has been working with Edaprospo for 3 years and sells groceries like sodas, beer, rice, bleach, detergent, etc. She has owned her store, Bodega Ivonne, for 10 years, and started with the dream of opening her own business to pay for her daily necessities. With her effort and hard work, three years ago she was also able to open an internet cafe. Currently her income pays for food and business capital, while her husband covers water and electricity expenses. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house so that she can rent out rooms. Sonia has belonged to the lending group "Mujeres de Exito" for 1 year and 4 months, and has been the president of this seven-person group for 8 months. She would like to use the loan to purchase groceries such as sodas, beers,rice, bleach, detergent, etc. since her sales increase for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase soda, beer, rice, bleach, detergents

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina de 66 años de edad vive con Justo, su pareja. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos. Esta familia habita un hogar propio en la localidad de Santa  Rosa Palomar, distrito de San Luis de Shuaro, provincia de Chanchamayo (Selva central). Gracias a sus sembríos de café, Guillermina ha logrado mantener a sus hijos mayores, quienes ahora ya dejaron el hogar para ser independientes. Se siente orgullosa. 
A pesar de su avanzada edad, confía en sus fuerzas para seguir en la agricultura con cultivos de café, plátanos y paltas. Pero la venta de café es la que más gratificaciones le ha dado. 
Con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos logra comercializar sus productos en la ciudad de La Merced, donde ya cuenta con compradores asegurados. Le gusta lo que hace. Con el tiempo, ella quisiera ampliar sus sembríos, ya que los precios del café han subido beneficiándola con las ventas. Para ello deberá invertir en la compra y arriendo de los terrenos. Éste sería su préstamo número 5, que obtendrá de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente satisfecha con su banco comunal “Aroma de café”. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar bolsas de abonos orgánicos y pagará la mano de obra para la época de la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Guillermina, who is 66 years old and lives with her partner, Justo. They both have 8 children, although they only 3 live with them. This family lives in their own house in the town of Santa Rosa Palomar, in the San Luis de Shuaro district, province of Chanchamayo (central rainforest). Thanks to her coffee crops Guillermina has managed to provide for her older children, who have already left home to be independent. She feels proud. 

Despite her advanced age, she trusts in her strength to be able to continue working in agriculture with crops of coffee, bananas and avocados. However, selling coffee is what has given her most satisfaction.

With the help of her husband and children she manages to market her products in the city of La Merced, where she already has assured customers. She likes what she does. In time, she would like to expand her crops, as the price of coffee has increased which benefits her in its sales. In order to do this she needs to invest in buying and leasing terrain. This will be her fifth loan from MFP. She is committed to being punctual with her monthly payments. She feels satisfied with her communal bank "Aroma de café". With the money from this loan she will be able to buy bags of organic compost and she will pay for labour in the coffee harvesting season.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic compost and hire labourers.

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Liana es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” grupo conformado por 07 socios, la cual llevan trabajando con el Programa – Prosperidad 08 meses. Liana tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo, ella es madre soltera. Actualmente Liana se dedica al alquiler de cabinas de internet, la cual lleva 07 años en dicho negocio, poco a poco Liana a mejorado su negocio ya que nos manifiesta que comenzó con 05 maquinas, actualmente cuenta con 08 maquinas, aparte instalo un pequeño bazar, obteniendo un ingreso mas. Liana es una mujer trabajadora que desea seguir progresando. La meta de Liana es de instalar un locutorio pues así asegura que obtendrá mayores ganancias. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar  juguetes como muñecas, carritos, guitarras, entre otros y así poder ofrecerlo en su bazar por fiestas navideñas. La Alcancía Comunal “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” agradecen el crédito brindado. Vilma no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo, la cual adjuntamos su fotografía.
texts.en:
Liana is a member of the seven-person lending group "La Union Hace la Fuerza", which has been working with the Prosperity Program for 8 months. 

Liana, 31, is a single mother to one son. She has been running an internet cafe for 7 years, and little by little has improved her business. She started with 5 computers and now has 8, and she also installed a small store to earn more income. Liana is a hardworking woman who wants to keep making progress. Her goal is to add a telephone booth to ensure even more income. 

She asks for a loan to buy toys like dolls, cars, guitars and other things to offer in her shop for the Christmas season. The lending group "La Union Hace la Fuerza" is grateful for the loans. Vilma couldn't arrive on time for the photo because of work, so her picture was added.

loans.use: to buy toys like dolls, toy cars and guitars.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta de 45 años es una mujer soltera y vive contenta. En la ciudad de Lima vive su única hija, Mariluz de 16 años. Ahora Jacinta vive sola en su casa propia, en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Palomar, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Jacinta es una mujer admirable. Su fuerza y decisión ha hecho posible que eduque a Mariluz en la capital del país. No le importa vivir sola, pues sabe que los sacrificios al final traerán buenos resultados. Gracias a la agricultura, a podido salir adelante y solventar sus gastos. Cuenta con terrenos propios de cultivo, donde tiene sembrado café, plátanos y palta.  Predominando la producción del producto bandera se su zona, el café. La faena es dura y cansada, por esa razón tiene que contratar personal para la limpieza, abonamiento y cosecha de sus productos. Los meses de mayo y junio son cruciales en el negocio de los granos de café. Los compradores ya saben como contactarla. Jacinta no se preocupa de las ventas solo de la producción.
Es consciente que sola no se sentirá feliz. Así que después de ahorrar el dinero necesario viajará a la ciudad de Lima para vivir con su hija. Pero afirma que no descuidará sus cultivos, dejando a personal encargado para su mantenimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café”, y éste sería su crédito número 2 de MFP, por lo que agradecería su apoyo. Por su parte menciona ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas, como lo fue en el ciclo anterior. Con el dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos, así también pagará los servicios de los operarios a quienes contratará para la época de cosecha.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 45, is single and lives contently. Her only daughter, Mariluz, is 16 and lives in the city of Lima. Jacinta now lives alone in the house she owns in the community of Santa Rosa de Palomar in the province of Chanchamayo. Jacinta is an admirable woman. Her hard work and decisions have made it possible that Mariluz is educated in the capital. She doesn't mind living alone because she knows that ultimately her sacrifices will bring good results. Thanks to farming, she has been able to get ahead and cover her expenses. She has her own farmland where she plants coffee, plantains and avocado. In her region, coffee dominates the production. The work is hard and tiring, so she has to hire workers for cleaning, spreading manure and harvesting her products. The months of May and June are crucial for the coffee bean business. The buyers already know how to contact her. Jacinta isn't worried about her sales, just about her production.

She is aware that she won't be happy alone. After saving enough money, she will travel to Lima to live with her daughter. She will leave workers in charge of maintaining her crops, so they don't go uncared for. 

Jacinta belongs to the communal bank "Aroma de Cafe" and this will be her second loan with MFP, whom she thanks for their support. She will be punctual in her repayments, as she was in the previous cycle. With the money she will buy bags of compost for her crops and will also pay the wages of the laborers that she will contract during the harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost and contract day laborers.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Austin, Texas' "Anytime Labor" is a start-up staffing company that was started in August by 35-year-old Joseph. His business currently employs only Joseph who works with construction and warehouse companies on light manual labor such as cleaning up after construction projects. Joseph is using the loan money to purchase equipment such as shovels, gloves, rakes, hard hats and other work-related tools needed to perform the job. These devices are needed but not offered through the construction companies. 

Joseph decided to become an entrepreneur because of the flexibility it gives him to juggle returning to school, focusing on his career and making his own decisions. Though this is a recently opened business, Joseph said by next year, it should be up and running. He plans to hire 10 to 20 employees depending on how many companies are willing to take advantage of his services. 

When he realized he could not afford everything needed, Joseph turned to ACCION Texas Inc. for his business loan. He said he has good credit but lacks any credit history. Joseph said ACCION Texas gave him a head start, "and I appreciate that. " Without the loan, "I think I would have started everything with my own money. (The loan) is going to help me a lot." Joseph thanked ACCION Texas for the help and stated that it is a great place to receive a business loan. In addtition to working and attending school, Joseph is a father of two children, both under the age of 18.

loans.use: To pay for construction clean-up supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Josefa

texts.es:
Deisy Josefa, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, uno de ellos esta estudiando en la escuela, vive en Esquías, Comayagua.
hace cinco años que Deisy estableció su negocio de pulpería, venta de arroz, manteca, huevos, frijoles, azúcar, harina, pastas, cereales, jugos, lácteos, pan, churros, dulces, productos de limpieza, papel higiénico, etc. de este negocio salen sus ingresos para alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Le dedica 12 horas diarias para satisfacer a sus clientes. Actualmente a solicitado este préstamo de L.10,000.00 a ODEF para surtir de productos como arroz, frijoles, lácteos, manteca, refrescos, churros y otros, para mantener su pulpería siempre surtida. Su meta es que con las ganancias, ampliar mas el negocio y mantenerlo surtido para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Deisy Josefa, 29, is a single mother; she has two children who are 10 and 4 years  old.  One of them attends school.  She lives in Esquías, Comayagua.

Five years ago Deisy opened a grocery store.  She sells rice, lard, eggs, beans, sugar, flour, pasta, cereals, juice, dairy products, bread, snacks, candy, cleaning supplies, toilet paper, etc.  The business produces income enough to feed and educate her children.  She spends 12 hours daily taking care of customers.

She is currently requesting this L.10,000.00 loan from ODEF to stock up on merchandise like rice, beans, dairy products, lard, soft-drinks, snacks and others to keep her grocery store well stocked.  Her goal is to use her profits to expand the business and to keep it well stocked to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.en:
Girasoles (Sunflower) Trust Bank was formed five years in San Juan Ostuncalco, a small village outside of Quetzaltenango, which is located in the western highlands of Guatemala. The seven women members of the Trust Bank are all neighbors and have known each other for many years. Each member makes the hour-long trip each way to the Quetzaltenango market on a weekly basis to buy goods and materials for their businesses and, ultimately, to sell their products. This is the fifth loan for the Sunflower Trust Bank, and all previous loans were paid on time and in full.

Vicenta Marroquin, named after her grandmother, is 28 years old and has three young girls.She has been an active member of the Sunflower Trust Bank since its inception. Vicenta is a seamstress and creates colorful traditional Mayan clothing, a craft she learned as a child from her aunt. Through previous loans from Friendship Bridge, Vicenta started a bakery business, with two other Trust Bank members more than a year ago. She plans to split her current loan between her two business, using half to buy additional thread and cloth and the remaining amount to buy powder, sugar, and other baking goods.  It is Vicenta’s dream to own her own bakery. She feels that it is a blessing that lenders around the world have shown such kindness to help her and her fellow Sunflower Trust Bank members.

loans.use: To buy more fabric, thread, flower and sugar for her two businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for her oil.

loans.name: Rosas De Chijipina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE CHIJINI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Jenny. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora Jenny  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido y venta de mantas que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo este oficio de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de lanas) que adquirirá de la Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The lending group "Rosas de Chijini" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Achacachi. The group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by Jenny. The group members' businesses are varied and include: weaving cloths, commerce, production and services. 

Jenny says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. For many years, she has been waving and selling blankets. She learned the trade from her mother.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her merchandise by buying wool in La Paz; later she will sell her products in the markets. This work has allowed her to earn income to support her family as much as possible. She lives with her husband and has one son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the training.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Las Clavellinas Group

texts.en:
Las Clavellinas Trust Bank, named after the small carnations found in the region of Totonicapan in the western highlands of Guatemala, was formed four years ago by ten industrious women.  These ladies have a variety of businesses including embroidery, meal preparation and sales, firewood sales, clothing stores, and convenience stores.  They typically sell their products in Totonicapan City during the market days. Some members have established client lists with set orders. 

Felipa Batz is a member of Las Clavellinas Trust Bank.  She is 31 years old and has five children, all of whom are in elementary school.  Felipa has been a weaver for the last 15 years, a craft that she learned from her sisters.  She is always at the forefront of fashion so that she can meet her clients’ needs. 

Felipa is an entrepreneur looking for new opportunities.  She plans to use her loan to purchase more cloth and to buy a sewing machine in order to start a new business making aprons.  Felipa normally works in the afternoons, since her children are home from school and they can help with the household chores.  

One of Felipa’s dreams is to grow her business to the point that she can have her own shop where she can sell her products to locals and nearby visitors.  Felipa is very happy and proud that lenders around the world are supporting women like her and thanks them for helping make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and a sewing machine for textiles.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana Luz es una emprendedora de éxito, que con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante junto con su esposo para sacar a delante a sus hijos que están a su cargo. Diana no es la primera vez que trabaja con Fundación, ya que su record crediticio es muy bueno, ella nos explica que gracias al financiamiento y al apoyo a salido adelante. Además Diana posee unas tierras en cual también apoyada con su esposo la trabajan. Diana está solicitando crédito para poder comprar repuestos para el vehículo, ya que se ha dañado y lo necesita de urgencia.
texts.en:
Diana Luz is a successful entrepreneur. Through a lot of sacrifice, she and her husband have been able to get their children ahead. This is not the first time that Diana has worked with the Foundation, and she has a good credit record. She explains that thanks to the first loan and the support she has made progress. Diana also has some land where she and her husband work. 

Diana is asking for a loan to buy repair parts for her vehicle, which has been damaged and needs to be fixed urgently.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for her vehicle.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is single and sells children's ware and a traditional food popularly known as "boodo" (made from ripe plantain) at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is responsible for herself and uses her income for her upkeep.  

Gifty needs this loan to purchase more children's ware for sale and plantain for food preparation for sale. Gifty hopes to use her new profit to continue her education.

The picture was taken in her storage room where she keeps the plantain till it is ripped and read for use.

loans.use: to purchase more children's ware for sale and plantain for food preparation for sale

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa de 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 4 son dependientes. Tiene 3 años con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de salchipapas con el cual lleva 2 años en este negocio. Comenzó a raíz de poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos y obtener solvencia para sus gastos, ya que es ella quien cubre los gastos de alimentación, agua y luz. También se dedica a la venta de cosméticos con el cual tiene 1 año. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha podido comprarse un terreno en donde piensa construir su casa y abrir un negocio propio. Tiene 3 años formando parte de la alcancía comunal “Corazón de Jesús” el cual esta conformado por 8 personas y que se formo por un acuerdo entre las vecinas de la zona. Lleva 11 meses como presidenta del grupo y piensa usar el reciente préstamo en la compra de mercadería y algunos cerdos para crianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old. She lives with a partner and has five children, four of which are dependent. She has been working three years with Edaprospo and works selling salchipapas (fried hotdogs and potatoes served with condiments) and has been in the business for two years. 

She began the business because she wanted to give her children an education and pay their school fees, and she also pays for food, water and electricity. She has also been selling cosmetics for a year. Through her efforts and work she has been able to buy some land where she is thinking of building a house and opening her own business.

She has been a member of the communal bank Corazón de Jesús for three years which is made up of eight people and was formed by an agreement of neighbors. She has been the president of the communal bank for eleven months and is thinking of using the latest loan to buy merchandise and some pigs to breed.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen integrante del Banco comunal “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vende lencería desde hace 20 años, además incorporó a sus ventas el detergente.
Carmen ofrece sus productos por catalogo y se dedica a la venta puerta a puerta, ya que acude a los domicilios de sus clientes.
Su horario es flexible y lo distribuye generalmente durante las tardes, ya que las mañanas las destina principalmente para la realización de sus actividades domesticas. Los días que trabaja son de lunes a sábado.
Su mercadería la compra en diferentes distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago y cuando no puede viajar recurre a las encomiendas.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio. 
Quiere aprovechar la época de navidad, ya que es una muy buena temporada para ofrecer sus productos. 
Una de sus metas a largo plazo es instalarse con una distribuidora de lencería, comenta que necesita capital y mucha perseverancia, para concretar sus proyectos. 
Carmen vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijas de 22, 18 y 10 años de edad, su hija mayor estudia en la Universidad, Su hijas del medio acaba de rendir la prueba de selección universitaria y su hija menor estudia en la enseñanza básica. Por ende uno de sus sueños a nivel personal, es que sus hijas se realicen profesionalmente. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, para invertir en su negocio. Además está muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que son organizados, comprometidos y solidarios. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Carmen, a member of the “Walking Towards the Future” cooperative bank, is from the city of Talca.

She has dedicated herself to commerce, more specifically, to selling lingerie, for the past 20 years.  In addition, she incorporated detergent sales into her business.  Carmen offers her products by catalog and sells door-to-door at her customers’ homes.  Her schedule is flexible; she generally distributes her goods in the afternoons, since in the morning she takes care of her household tasks.  She works Mondays to Saturdays.

She buys her merchandise from different distributors in the city of Santiago and, when she can’t travel, she relies on deliveries.  She wants to take advantage of the holiday season, as it is a very good time to offer her products.  One of her long-term goals is to set herself up with a lingerie distributor.  She comments that she needs capital and a great deal of perseverance in order to make her projects a reality.

Carmen lives with her husband and three daughters ages 22, 18 and 10.  Her oldest daughter is studying at the university, her middle daughter just finished taking her college entrance exams, and her youngest is in school.  One of her personal dreams is to see her daughters become successful professionally.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza to invest in her business.  In addition, she is very comfortable with the group that conforms the cooperative bank where she is a member, as they are committed and supportive.  On the other hand, the trainings offered have served her well in organizing her business.  

Talca belongs to the Maule region, which is in the central part of the country.  It constitutes the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  With regards to Talca, there is a curious reference in Chile, the phrase “Talca, Paris and London”.  Among the legends in this respect, some say it is a derivation of a quote from an Englishman, “Talca seems like London”, given the abundance of fog that frequently covers the city during wintertime, very similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.
